Chatacabra.hunter_notes:
Amphibians that use their long tongues to seize and devour prey such as Bulaqchi. Their evolved forelimbs store a sticky mucus-like substance. When agitated, Chatacabra rub their forelimbs against the ground to collect stone and ore, widening the range and destructiveness of their blows.
Helpful Hints: The Chatacabra's soft tongue is the place to strike; look for openings after their attacks or when they become tired. Destroying the ore stuck to their forelimbs will leave them wide open to attack. They roam a wide area, so environmental elements like falling boulders or Flashflies will be useful in taking them down. To give you an idea of how hungry these things can get, some hunters have witnessed them swallowing entire barrels during their charges.Chatacabra primarily fights using both its long tongue and its muscular forearms to slam into its target. Whenever a Chatacabra enrages, it will drag its forearms through the ground to armour them with rocks, causing their arm slams to kick up debris, extending the range of these attacks. Dealing enough damage to their forearms will remove this armour and topple the monster.
After performing their double arm slam, Chatacabra's tongue may be left exposed, becoming a weak point for Focus Strikes.
Chatacabra.sightings: Chatacabra is only found in the Windward Plains.
Chatacabra.characteristics:

When agitated, Chatacabra rub their forelimbs against the ground to collect stone and ore, widening the range and destructiveness of their blows.

Tetranadon.hunter_notes: After a large meal, its movements become sluggish, but don't be fooled; its swings become more weighty and destructive as well! Watch for when it moves slowly, strike true, and it'll belch up its dinner and return to normal.Tetranadon attack with movements reminiscent of a sumo wrestler, involving open-palmed slaps, stun-inducing claps and slamming their body down. Eventually, Tetranadon will dig their beak into the ground while swallowing gravel, causing their belly to expand drastically in size. Tetranadon can also enter this state if they are able to successfully pin a hunter while deflated. While in this state, their attacks are more powerful but are also much slower. After spending enough time in this state Tetranadon will rear backwards before firing a water beam in front of them, returning them to their deflated state. By attacking their belly enough while it's inflated, Tetranadon will be knocked out of this state and will be toppled.
Tetranadon.sightings: Tetranadon is found in the Shrine Ruins, Frost Islands, Lava Caverns  and Jungle.
Tetranadon.characteristics:
An amphibious monster resembling a frog. Its appetite is infinite, and if it sees anything moving, it will gobble it up, dirt an all. It's theorized that the dirt it consumes builds up in its stomach and aids in digestion. If it eats something that it cannot digest, it will throw it back up. The cranial disc protecting its tender head is said to harden and become a more brilliant blue over time.After a large meal, its movements become sluggish, but don't be fooled; its swings become more weighty and destructive as well! Watch for when it moves slowly, strike true, and it'll belch up its dinner and return to normal.The Tetranadon is a large Amphibian monster whos body plan closely resembles that of frogs. It has a large, duck-like beak, a sturdy carapace and thick forelimbs. Its belly is a cream colour, while the rest of its hide is a swampy green. Its shell, head, and arms are covered in a thick layer of moss and algae that soak up water, allowing the monster to keep its skin moist.
The Tetranadon's moisturizing organ is protected by a disc-shaped bone on its head.[2] This cranial disc hardens as the monster ages and eventually becomes a brilliant blue colour. Underneath this disc, the monster's head is incredibly tender.[3]
Tetranadon.behavior:
Tetranadon hunt by lurking in deep waters and swallowing anything that that approaches them. They have been known to do this to humans on some occasions, which usually ends with the Tetranadon spitting them back out, as it cannot digest an entire human properly.[4]
Female Tetranadon lay their eggs on clumps of seaweed and hide them in spots where they can lay low and watch them as they hatch, often preferring the bottoms of waterfalls. Male Tetranadon are instinctually drawn to such spots and will engage in competitions of strength nearby, pushing and throwing eachother, hoping that a hidden female is watching.[5]

Zamtrios.characteristics:
Threat Level: ★★★★Zamtrios are large shark-like amphibians covered in a cyan hide, which transitions into a brown-white coloration around the underside. This hide is made up of many small scales and has the surface quality of sandpaper, which is why it is often used to polish and sharpen human weaponry.[3] The hide of a Zamtrios regenerates constantly by growing newer, harder layers underneath itself, with the old hide eventually tearing to make way for the next layer. Thus, the defensive quality of this tissue increases as the amphibian ages.[4] The hide on the underside of Zamtrios is also extremely elastic.
A notable feature of Zamtrios is their large dorsal fins. These tall features are used to cut through ice as the amphibian swims underneath it,[5] and are considered extremely valuable in most markets.[6]
The hands of Zamtrios are four fingered, with the two outer fingers being considerably shorter than those in the middle of the hand. The feet have five toes, of which the second toe is the longest, followed by the third and fourth, while the first and fifth are reduced. Each digit is connected by yellow webbing and the tail is horizontally broad and flat.
Zamtrios have pure white eyeballs with no visible irises.
Zamtrios.behavior: Zamtrios hunt by using their cold environments to their advantage. By waiting in the icy waters and spraying a freezing liquid around and onto themselves, Zamtrios can incapacitate prey quickly. While they feed on a variety of smaller animals, they have been noted to be especially attracted to the taste of frogs.[7]

Tigerstripe Zamtrios.hunter_notes: Unlike its standard counterpart, this distinctively-striped Zamtrios subspecies dwells primarily in desert climes, and can employ its ability to expand and contract its body even while in motion, making it an even more formidable adversary.Threat Level: ★★★★
Tigerstripe Zamtrios.characteristics: Unlike its standard counterpart, this distinctively-striped Zamtrios subspecies dwells primarily in desert climes, and can employ its ability to expand and contract its body even while in motion, making it an even more formidable adversary.Threat Level: ★★★★

Aknosom.hunter_notes: Characteristics: Tending to stand on one leg, this monster somewhat resembles an umbrella. The Aknosom is highly territorial; it will spread out its wings and show off its characteristic comb to scare off threats. It also bears flammable venom that burns fiercely and lingers on the ground when lit. Draw the beast to water for an easier fight. It can manipulate the umbrella-shaped crest on its head to curl up, fan out, or shut tight. Observe its shape closely, and you might be able to predict which attack it will use next.Threat Level: ★★Aknosom attack with very dance-like movements involving their wings, their head crest and their legs. Their fireballs are unique in that they bounce across the ground multiple times when fired, leaving behind a patch of fire with each bounce.
Aknosom.sightings: Aknosom is found in the Shrine Ruins, Frost Islands and the Jungle.
Aknosom.characteristics: Tending to stand on one leg, this monster somewhat resembles an umbrella. The Aknosom is highly territorial; it will spread out its wings and show off its characteristic comb to scare off threats. It also bears flammable venom that burns fiercely and lingers on the ground when lit. Draw the beast to water for an easier fight.Characteristics: Tending to stand on one leg, this monster somewhat resembles an umbrella. The Aknosom is highly territorial; it will spread out its wings and show off its characteristic comb to scare off threats. It also bears flammable venom that burns fiercely and lingers on the ground when lit. Draw the beast to water for an easier fight. It can manipulate the umbrella-shaped crest on its head to curl up, fan out, or shut tight. Observe its shape closely, and you might be able to predict which attack it will use next.Threat Level: ★★

Giadrome.characteristics:
Threat: ★★★Giadrome closely resemble their close relative Velocidrome - they are slim, bipedal Bird Wyvern with sharp claws, long tails and yellow beaks. Their hides are striped and the Drome - which serves as the alpha of the pack - grows a large, backwards-pointed crest on its head to signal its authority.
The main factor that outwardly differentiates the Giadrome from its close relative is coloration. They are a lighter shade of blue compared to Velocidrome, and their headcrests are teal colored instead of red.
The claws of Giadrome are exceptionally sharp, and thicken as the wyvern ages.[3] These claws are also considered quite beautiful and are sometimes used as decorations.[4]
Giadrome possess one physiological ability that Velocidrome lack: They can spit out a freezing liquid, which can rapidly incapacitate prey when splashed with it. This ability is thought to have evolved out a necessity to increase the percentage of prey that can be captured in order to provide enough food for a pack up in the snowy mountains.[1] This is however a fairly rudimentary elemental attack, and Giadrome do not seem to have true Ice Sacs or equivalent organs.
Giadrome.behavior:
Like their close relatives, Giadrome spend their days ruling over a pack of Giaprey, whom they both protect and guide. Unlike Velociprey packs though, Giaprey packs can sometimes be seen co-led by two Giadrome.[5] Due to this, it is believed that this species is overall more social and cooperative than Velociprey on average.[1]
Giadrome themselves are considered quite clever on their own merits.[6] They actively patrol and enforce the packs territory, and will engage in turf wars when necessary.[7] These alpha wyvern are also thought to be quite protective and proud of their head crests.[8]

Great Baggi.hunter_notes:
It commands many lesser Baggi to form a wave of all out offense; a tactful hunter will pick off the herd one by one and avoid being surrounded. The Great Baggi spits out a sedative venom that will knock you out if you're stuck by it, but having Energy Drinks on hand helps offset that threat.The main weapon of a Great Baggi is their ability to fire off a sleep-inducing toxin. Whenever the hunter is put to sleep, the Great Baggi will attempt to counter by swiping their head at them.
Great Baggi typically fight alongside a pack of Baggi. Great Baggi are capable of both calling Baggi to the zone if none are present and commanding any present in the zone with them to attack, typically with their sleep spit. This is signalled by them howling into the air.
Great Baggi.sightings: Great Baggi is found exclusively in the Frost Islands.
Great Baggi.characteristics:
A carnivorous bird wyvern. Noted for their projecting cranial crests and bluish-white skin that's adapted to snowy climates. Great Baggi craftily command other Baggi to surround their prey and stun them with a tranquilizing fluid.It commands many lesser Baggi to form a wave of all out offense; a tactful hunter will pick off the herd one by one and avoid being surrounded. The Great Baggi spits out a sedative venom that will knock you out if you're stuck by it, but having Energy Drinks on hand helps offset that threat.Great Baggi is a medium-sized raptor-like Bird Wyvern. Its defining feature is its large pointed crest, which dwarfs that of the smaller Baggi. Its light blue and white coloration lends it to snowy environments. Small patches of fur cover the sides and back of its head, its shoulders, its hips, and its tail. On close inspection, most Great Baggi are covered in old battle scars.[4]
Both Great Baggi and Baggi produce a powerful liquid sedative which they launch from their mouths. This projectile attack covers considerable distance, allowing a pack to incapacitate a target quickly and safely.
Great Baggi.behavior: Great Baggi leads a pack of Baggi, which it commands by vocalizing. Baggi will help their pack leader by surrounding and attacking prey and perceived threats. The degree of control and superiority of a Great Baggi is determined by the size of their crest - the bigger they are, the greater their authority becomes.[5]

Great Izuchi.hunter_notes: Their razor-sharp tail attacks in combination with their synchronicity make them a force to be reckoned with. Take out their pack leader to send the herd into disarray and pick them off easily.Great Izuchi primarily attacks with by sweeping their hook-like tail around them, with it frequently embedding itself in the ground after an attacks. Great Izuchi are usually accompanied by two Izuchi, who will attack alongside their leader. If the Great Izuchi is knocked over, the smaller Izuchi will be knocked over with them. If these Izuchi are killed, the Great will howl into the air to summon more to the Area.
Great Izuchi.sightings: Great Izuchi is found in the Shrine Ruins and Frost Islands.
Great Izuchi.characteristics: The alpha Izuchi of its pack, identified by its larger build, upended white fur and scythe-like tail. A Great Izuchi forms a herd of many smaller Izuchi and selects two from the group to accompany it on territory patrols. Once it spots prey or senses danger, the Great Izuchi issues commands to their fellow Izuchi, and coordinates their movements. Take care that you don't get overwhelmed.Their razor-sharp tail attacks in combination with their synchronicity make them a force to be reckoned with. Take out their pack leader to send the herd into disarray and pick them off easily.

Great Maccao.characteristics:
Threat: ★★★The Great Maccao is a medium-sized bird wyvern that commands a pack of Maccao. Its larger, muscular build and impressive crown of feathers makes it easily distinguishable from its pack mates. Most of the monster's body is covered in bright green plumage, while the skin on its head and underbelly is a contrasting red. The Great Maccao's arms, legs and tail are protected by sturdy, brown shells that are especially thick.[2]
The hide of the Great Maccao thickens each time it is struck, with the bravest of individuals sporting the toughest hides.[3] Over time, the Great Maccao’s hide becomes extremely resilient. This makes hides with more scars more valuable, and high-quality Great Maccao hides are used to reward valour.[4]
One of the Great Maccao’s most striking features is its large feather crest. The size and beauty of the crest is proportional to the strength of an individual Great Maccao.[5] This eccentric plumage establishes the Great Maccao as the alpha male within the hierarchy of its pack.[6]
The paddle-shaped tail of the Great Maccao's is very strong and muscular. The tip of its tail is wide, thick, and adorns incredibly sturdy tailspikes on either side that grip to surfaces, allowing the monster to maintain its balance.[7] As a result, the Great Maccao can prop itself up on its tail and use it as a spring to launch itself forward in combat.
Great Maccao.behavior:
Despite being the alpha male of a Maccao pack, the Great Maccao doesn't have much authority over its pack like other Dog Wyverns. As a result, when there is danger, the Maccao pack is very likely to leave the leader to fend for itself.[8]
When threatened, the Great Maccao will stand on its tail and show its red underbelly as an intimidation tactic. Should it be provoked further, the monster will use its tail to launch itself towards foes, kicking them with its thick clawed feet. Its powerful leg muscles allow it to jump high and deliver devastating kicks.
Great Maccao feed on the eggs from large monster nests. Their hands are specifically made for not only punching enemies, but for cracking eggs open. When the Great Maccao snags an egg from a nest, it brings it to a safe area, where it then cracks the egg open with its fist.[9]

Great Wroggi.hunter_notes:
Remember to bring some Antidotes to deal with its poison. Taking out the sac around a Great Wroggi's neck will also prevent it from producing venom, so aim for the head.The main weapon of a Great Wroggi is their ability to fire off clouds of poisonous mist which linger in the air. Breaking the Great Wroggi’s head will cause the poison clouds to linger for far less time.
Great Wroggi typically fight alongside a pack of Wroggi. Great Wroggi are capable of both calling Wroggi to the zone if none are present and commanding any present in the zone with them to attack, signalled by them howling into the air.
Great Wroggi.sightings: Great Wroggi is found in the Shrine Ruins, Flooded Forest, Lava Caverns and Jungle.
Great Wroggi.characteristics:
Wroggi are bird wyverns that travel in packs that are led by the largest and most toxic member. Be careful when once raises its head and its poison sac expands – that signals that it's about to spit a cloud of poisonous mist.Remember to bring some Antidotes to deal with its poison. Taking out the sac around a Great Wroggi's neck will also prevent it from producing venom, so aim for the head.Great Wroggi is a large Bird Wyvern, known for sporting an enormous poison sac that spans the throat and sides of the head. Its hide is bright orange with intricate brown patterns. The body is also covered in scales which grow thicker as the monster ages.[3] On the front half of the body, light yellow bumps run its sides; the top of the lower back is covered by these bumps as well. The tail grows peculiar fin-like protrusions that are absent on that of the smaller Wroggi. On the front limbs, Great Wroggi grow special braces that reinforce the wrists. These structures consist of various kinds of tissue growing into eachother, including scales, shells and claws.[4] Cutting open such a brace allows the retrieval of some of these materials.[5]
When the Great Wroggi empties its bulging poison sac, it produces a cloud of poison mist that hangs around in the air and envenomates all that are caught in it. This airborne poison is so powerful that even the Great Wroggi itself - who is otherwise extremely resistant to poisons - has to protect itself from it. Its nose is modified with special tissue that can be used to plug the nostrils at will, preventing accidental inhalation.
Great Wroggi.behavior: Should a target somehow evade their poison or survive its effects, Great Wroggi go on the offensive, with their brothers aiding from the sidelines. Using its massive body, the alpha charges at the enemy, while the smaller Wroggi spit blobs of poison whenever they see an opening. The Great Wroggi may even use clever tricks, such as using its cloud of poison as a smokescreen to attack through.

Gypceros.hunter_notes:
Wyverns that can stun enemies by striking their prominent crests to produce powerful flashes of light. Their stretchy, rubbery hide resists blunt impacts and reduces the effectiveness of shock traps. A smart hunter knows to maneuver carefully around the poisonous filth they spew, which drips from ceilings or down slopes.
Helpful Hints: Faced with a Gypceros, a hunter has two headaches to deal with: the poison and the flashes. The poison will pool and hamper your movements, but you can clear it away with some watermoss. As for the flashes, destroying its crest will stop them; in the meantime, it’s a good idea to take cover. If you see its crest glow before the attack, that means you’re still inside the dazzling danger radius.Gypceros attack using their elastic tail which is capable of extending multiple times its normal length. They can also spit out poison that flows with the terrain, oftne doing so while charging. Gypceros also possess a crest capable of producing a blinding flash, instantly stunning any hunter within range. By breaking their head twice, their crest can be removed.
When near death, Gypceros are capable of faking their own dying animation, though no Quest Complete screen will appear. During this state, the Gypceros can be carved for materials. Eventually, their body will twitch before they flail around back onto their feet.
While in their nest in Area 11 of the Oilwell Basin, Gypceros are capable of running on the walls during their charging spit.
Due to the rubbery properties of their hide, Gypceros are immune to both the Thunder element and to Shock Traps, and due to their use of their own blinding flash, they are immune to Flash Bombs.
While preparing their crest for a flash, Gypceros' head will become a weak point for Focus Strikes.
Gypceros.sightings: Gypceros can be found in the Oilwell Basin and the Iceshard Cliffs. They can also be found in the Windward Plains, but only during the Fallow and Tempered individuals can also be found in the Ruins of Wyveria.
Gypceros.characteristics:
Hunters Notes: Wyverns that can stun enemies by striking their prominent crests to produce powerful flashes of light. Their stretchy, rubbery hide resists blunt impacts and reduces the effectiveness of shock traps. A smart hunter knows to maneuver carefully around the poisonous filth they spew, which drips from ceilings or down slopes.
Helpful Hints: Faced with a Gypceros, a hunter has two headaches to deal with: the poison and the flashes. The poison will pool and hamper your movements, but you can clear it away with some watermoss. As for the flashes, destroying its crest will stop them; in the meantime, it’s a good idea to take cover. If you see its crest glow before the attack, that means you’re still inside the dazzling danger radius.
Gypceros.useful_information: Faced with a Gypceros, a hunter has two headaches to deal with: the poison and the flashes. The poison will pool and hamper your movements, but you can clear it away with some watermoss. As for the flashes, destroying its crest will stop them; in the meantime, it’s a good idea to take cover. If you see its crest glow before the attack, that means you’re still inside the dazzling danger radius.

Purple Gypceros.characteristics:
Threat: ★★★★A Subspecies of the Bird Wyvern Gypceros distinguished from the common species by little other than its colouration and heightened toxin production.[2] They inhabit the same environments and have similar diets, though behaviorally, the Purple Gypceros is comparatively more belligerent and violent once agitated. Demand and rarity drives the selling price of their hide and wings.[3]
Most of the body of a Purple Gypceros is coloured exactly as the name would suggest, but the wing membranes are tinted a reddish-orange, and running down the sides of its neck is a line of emerald green. The end of its elastic tail shares this colour, as does the area around the Monster's eye when enraged.
The venom of this subspecies is more potent than that of its more obiquitous cousin, causing noxious poison in those afflicted. It also produces more of it, to a point that it will begin to salivate the substance upon becoming enraged, making pecks from its beak inflict poison as well.
Contrary to what reports may suggest, the Purple Gypceros itself isn't any more resistant to poison than a regular Gypceros.[4]

Kulu-Ya-Ku.hunter_notes: A Kulu-Ya-Ku uses small boulders to shield itself or smash against its enemies. Force it to drop whatever it's holding by staggering or blinding it, or if it's holding a cracked boulder, attack it to break it.Kulu-Ya-Ku attack by pecking and by swiping at their hunters with their claws. Periodically, Kulu-Ya-Ku will peck the ground before picking up either a boulder or a pot in their hands, which they will proceed to use as a weapon. While pots are fragile and easily broken, boulders cause most attacks directed at them to bounce. Damaging either object enough will cause the object to break. Kulu-Ya-Ku will also drop its held object if their head is flinched. They can also throw their held object to immediately get rid of it.
Kulu-Ya-Ku.sightings: Kulu-Ya-Ku are found in the Shrine Ruins, Sandy Plains, Flooded Forest, Lava Caverns and Jungle.
Kulu-Ya-Ku.characteristics: A bird wyvern that has developed limbs capable of carrying objects. It has been spotted stealing eggs from nests. If attacked while carrying an egg, it will drop the egg in fright and flee. When engaged, a Kulu-Ya-Ku will dig up a small boulder to shield itself against threats or use it in its attacks.A Kulu-Ya-Ku uses small boulders to shield itself or smash against its enemies. Force it to drop whatever it's holding by staggering or blinding it, or if it's holding a cracked boulder, attack it to break it.

Pukei-Pukei.hunter_notes:
The regurgitation of a Pukei-Pukei varies depending on what it has eaten: it may spread wider, linger on the ground, or even stun prey more easily. Check, therefore, that the monster's mouth and tail aren't swollen prior to engaging.Pukei-Pukei attacks using their long, extendable tongue and by releasing poison: both by spitting as projectiles from their mouth and releasing it as a gas from their tail. Severing their tail drastically reduces the range of their tail gas.
Periodically, Pukei-Pukei will head to plant/mushroom gathering spots on the map and eating from them, causing their chin and tail to inflate. This gives them access to new poison attacks from their head and tail. Dealing enough damage to these parts will return that part to normal. Depending on what kind of plant Pukei-Pukei eats, the effects of their poison projectiles will change:
Pukei-Pukei.sightings: Pukei-Pukei is found in the Shrine Ruins, Sandy Plains and Flooded Forest.
Pukei-Pukei.characteristics: A bird wyvern known to store toxins within its body. It uses its tongue like a whip and can stretch or shrink it at will, allowing it to grab up food. As a defense against threats, Pukei-Pukei have numerous toxic attacks. Keep an eye on both its mouth and tail!The regurgitation of a Pukei-Pukei varies depending on what it has eaten: it may spread wider, linger on the ground, or even stun prey more easily. Check, therefore, that the monster's mouth and tail aren't swollen prior to engaging.

Coral Pukei-Pukei.hunter_notes:
Much like Pukei-Pukei, Coral also attacks using their long tongue. They are also capable of spitting water from their mouth and spraying it from their tail. Severing their tail, however, prevents them from firing water from it, severely weakening their moveset.
Coral is also capable of eating specific plants in the environment, causing their tail to inflate after their first and their chin to after their second. This gives them access to new water attacks from both their head and tail as well as enhancing their existing ones. Dealing enough damage to these parts will return that part to normal.
Coral Pukei-Pukei.sightings: Coral Pukei-Pukei is found primarily in the Coral Highlands. They can also be found in the Coral region of the Guiding Lands.
Coral Pukei-Pukei.characteristics: A bird wyvern that stockpiles water inside its body, fortified by the plant life it consumes. When threatened, it can expel a powerful stream from its mouth or tail.
Coral Pukei-Pukei.useful_information: Useful Information: After feeding, the water attacks from both ends are enhanced: focus on those two areas to weaken the creature again. Cowardly by nature, it refuses to eat around a predator.

Qurupeco.hunter_notes: Threat: ★★★In Monster Hunter 3 Ultimate, G-Rank Qurupeco can put Hunters and Monsters alike to sleep with its song. When fatigued, the performing Qurupeco will fall asleep as well.
Qurupeco.sightings: When performing a call, the Qurupeco will dance to invigorate itself and other Monsters in the area, them a boost in their attack, defense, or stamina, or healing. By damaging the inflated gular sac sufficiently, the Qurupeco can be made to abandon its performance and run away, causing the boost to be granted to the Hunters instead.
Qurupeco.characteristics:
Threat: ★★★The white downy feathers on the Qurupeco's cheeks, neck, and belly are longer than the lime green feathers that make up the majority of the Monster's plumage, but the longest are the vivid lilac display feathers that decorate its back. A small black horn is situated on the back of its skull, and its tail can fan out into a broad, oar-like shape.[5]
The soft crest on the Bird Wyvern's beak forms a trumpet shape when air blows through it, amplifying the volume of its calls. Before broadcasting, a Qurupeco will inhale large volumes of air, causing the gular sac to inflate dramatically, at which point it will be vulnerable to attacks or loud noises.
Adorning the wings are Flintstones, which produce sparks when struck together, which can be used as a deterrent and a weapon.[6] Qurupeco additionally produce a highly flammable mucus, which they can either spit out at enemies to make them more susceptible to fire, or combine with their sparks to create small and fast fire blasts.[7]
Qurupeco.behavior:
When threatened, the timid Qurupeco employs its unique ability to mimic the calls of other species of Monster to attract them, allowing it the opportunity to escape in the ensuing commotion. Depending on the size of Monster summoned, the Qurupeco will move differently during the call: when summoning smaller Monsters, such as Jaggi, Ludroth, or Melynx, it will hold its wings to the ground and head high in the air; for larger Monsters, such as Great Jaggi, Barroth, or Rathian, it will stand on one leg and swing its head right and up.
To replenish its stamina, a Qurupeco will feed on fish.
Male Qurupeco use the same dancing and singing skills they display in combat to appease females during the breeding season, adding distinct sounds into their performances to differentiate its purpose.[8] Mated Qurupeco pairs warm their eggs together, and both males and females participate in parenting behaviors, taking turns between watching the nest and gathering food. Juvenile Qurupeco are born with their vocal apparatus already fully developed, and begin practicing their songs very early. This can lead to them accidentally successfully calling a dangerous predator to their nest, which the parents then counteract by imitating the calls of an even higher-ranking predator to scare the threat off again. Specific songs and dances are believed to be passed down from parents to children. The main cause of death for Qurupeco chicks is falling from the nest while practicing their dance moves. Should a parent be present during such an incident, they can catch the falling chick with their wide fan-tails, which have been theorized to have evolved for this very purpose.[7]

Crimson Qurupeco.characteristics:
Threat: ★★★Crimson Qurupeco are a subspecies of Qurupeco distinguished by the colour of their coat, the so-called Voltstones growing on their wings, and a more belligerent temperament befitting the more extreme environments their range extends to, which includes regions actively experiencing vulcanism.[3]
The downy feathers on the belly are coloured a creamy white, just as in the nominate subspecies, but those on the cheek are decorated by lines of crimson. [4]This same eye-catching colouration covers much of the Bird Wyvern's body, and is what gives it its name. The plumage of display feathers running along its neck and back posses a teal rim, and scales of the same colouring mark their wing fingers, while the forearms are yellow and membranes decorated by a bow of white running across their rim.
Crimson Qurupeco.behavior:
By striking together the Voltstones on its wings, a Crimson Qurupeco is able to either discharge electricity or produce a blinding flash to stun adversaries, and like its lime-coloured cousin, it will also spit a fluid from its mouth to increase the potency of its elemental attacks: it is conductive to electricity, thus decreasing the elemental resistances of those doused in it.[3]
Also like in its cousin, a rubbery orange crest that amplifies the volume of its calls stretches over the top of the Crimson Qurupeco's long beak, allowing it to perform elaborate song displays to invigorate itself or lull victims to sleep, and broadcast the mimicked sounds of other Monsters across the region to summon them to distract threats.[3]
Due to the more volatile menagerie of Monsters that inhabits the jungles and volcanoes Crimson Qurupeco calls home, the summoned help can be more dangerous than those typically called upon by a regular Qurupeco, such as Brute Tigrex, Green Nargacuga, or Stygian Zinogre.

Tzitzi-Ya-Ku.hunter_notes:
Tzitzi-Ya-Ku's primarily weapon are their antennae which, after unfolding them, are capable of generating a blinding flash in front of them. Breaking their antennae will not immediately disable their flash, with their head needing to be flinched an additional time for them to be fully disabled. If another monster is in the same area as them, Tzitzi-Ya-Ku will attempt to blind them with their flash, fleeing from the zone when successful.
While in their nest in Area 7, Tzitzi-Ya-Ku can use their flash at the shells in the wall to refract it in different directions.
Tzitzi-Ya-Ku.sightings: Tzitzi-Ya-Ku is found primarily in the Coral Highlands. They can also be found in the Coral region of the Guiding Lands.
Tzitzi-Ya-Ku.characteristics: This odd monster blinds both prey and enemies with a special pulsing organ near its head. It then uses its strong legs to deliver finishing blows.
Tzitzi-Ya-Ku.useful_information: Useful Information: Tzitzi-Ya-Ku's organs begin to radiate before it releases its blinding pulse, giving you enough time to escape and flank it. Damaging this organ will dramatically decrease the flash's effective range.

Yian Garuga.hunter_notes:
Yian Garuga is a relentless adversary, attacking by slamming their beak down, swiping with their venomous tail and by shooting fireballs, frequently chaining several of their attacks together. Severing their tail, however, will remove its ability to inflict Poison. Yian Garuga is also capable of flying backwards while roaring, often following up with another attack from the air.
While engaging with a target, the ears of a Yian Garuga will fan out. When they are near death however, they will be folded back up again.
While enraged, Yian Garuga is immune to Pitfall Traps, immediately flying out of them.
Yian Garuga does not have a Tempered form, with Scarred Yian Garuga acting as their Tempered version instead. The two monsters share research levels.
Yian Garuga.sightings: Yian Garuga is found in the Ancient Forest. They can also be found in the Forest region of the Guiding Lands from level 3 onwards.
Yian Garuga.characteristics:
A short-tempered bird wyvern marked by its hard, black scales and impressive mane. It strikes with its distinctive beak.Yian Garuga share many features with Yian Kut-Ku, so much so that they are sometimes confused for eachother. Yian Garuga are covered in a similar spiked shell, although theirs is dark purple as opposed to the Kut-Ku's pink coloration. The scales that compose this shell are also noted to me much tougher than anything found on the Yian Kut-Ku's body.[5] These scales vary greatly in quality, with the most pristine ones sparkling like purple quartz.[6]
Yian Garuga also display silvery fur mane behind their large heads, which is noted to shimmer on better groomed individuals.[7] The beak is spiked and uneven, and the ears are smaller and jagged. A most notable difference between the Kut-Ku and the Garuga species is the tail - while in the former it is simply an armored whip, the latter grows a thick tail tip lined with numerous venomous barbs.
Yian Garuga are capable of producing painfully strong vocalizations, and can roar loud enough to stun a Deviljho.[8]
Yian Garuga.behavior:
Yian Garuga are extremely aggressive and will attack nearly anything on sight.
The breeding habits of Yian Garuga are a hot research topic. It has been suggested that they might be brood parasites, laying their eggs into the nests of other monsters and tricking them into raising their offspring for them. This is however not yet definitively determined.[9]
Yian Garuga.useful_information:
Characteristics: A short-tempered bird wyvern marked by its hard, black scales and impressive mane. It strikes with its distinctive beak.Useful Information: It moves violently with its entire body, enough to break pitfall traps when enraged. Slow it by breaking body parts or baiting out its stamina-intensive beak attacks.
Known Habitats: The Guiding Lands

Scarred Yian Garuga.hunter_notes:
Scarred fights very similar to Yian Garuga, attacking with their beak, venomous tail and by shooting fireballs, with them additionally being capable of shooting off rapid volleys of fireballs. Severing their tail will similarly removes it ability to inflict Poison. They are notably more agile in the air compared to the standard Yian Garuga.
While engaging with a target, Scarred's ears will fan out. When they are near death however, they will be folded back up again.
While enraged, Scarred is immune to Pitfall Traps, immediately flying out of them.
Scarred Yian Garuga shares a research level with the standard Yian Garuga.
Scarred Yian Garuga.sightings: Scarred Yian Garuga is found in the Forest region of the Guiding Lands from level 6 onwards. They are always encountered Tempered.
Scarred Yian Garuga.characteristics: A tempered Yian Garuga that survived a grueling battle with just a scar on its head. Be careful of its successive breath attacks.Scarred Yian Garuga are Yian Garuga individuals that have been scarred in battle, generally distinguished by a large scar on the face. Besides this, they do not display any obvious physiological differences to regular individuals. They do however possess greater control over their combat abilities, likely as a result of honing their skills in deadly conflicts. Scarred Yian Garuga can produce and release fireballs faster than regular individuals and boast improved agility, especially when airborne.[5]
Scarred Yian Garuga.behavior:
Scarred Yian Garuga are even more aggressive than regular specimen, and will attack nearly anything they spot.[3] When triggered, they are known to unleash rapid fire flame barrages that can incinerate prey within seconds. They also alternate quickly between airborne and grounded combat in an attempt to confuse and overwhelm targets, a strategy born from years of experience.[5]
Scarred Yian Garuga found in the New World are always classified as Tempered Monsters,[6] and are considered so challenging to hunt that only veteran hunters are ever tasked with doing so.[5] On that continent, they are exclusively found in the Guiding Lands, where they engage in fierce territorial disputes with Zinogre.[7]
Scarred Yian Garuga.useful_information:
Characteristics: A tempered Yian Garuga that survived a grueling battle with just a scar on its head. Be careful of its successive breath attacks.Useful Information: Like the normal species, its head is easily breakable, and it's quick to run out of stamina. It behaves differently when flying short distances though, so be careful.
Known Habitats: The Guiding Lands

Yian Kut-Ku.hunter_notes:
Bird wyverns with impressive beaks and large ears. They tend to be skittish but will sometimes initiate attacks on a perceived threat. Yian Kut-Ku arrive in large groups during the season of Plenty in the Scarlet Forest. The absence of eggs or young suggests that the purpose of this is not to breed, but rather to seek out mates and nourishment.
Helpful Hints: The Yian Kut-Ku's superior hearing comes with great sensitivity to sound. A loud noise is sometimes all it takes to stop them in their tracks, reason enough to make liberal use of sonic bombs. But there's a catch: once a Yian Kut-Ku comes back to itself, it's going to be really flocking mad and come at a hunter even more viciously than before.Yian Kut-Ku attack by pecking at their target or by spitting a fiery liquid, often doing so while charging forward. While engaging with a target, the ears of a Yian Kut-Ku will fan out, however when they are near death they will be folded back up again.
Yian Kut-Ku possess a highly acute sense of hearing, meaning that Screamer Pods are capable of stunning the monster. However, once they have recovered, the Yian Kut-Ku will become instantly enraged. They are immune to the effects of Screamer Pods while enraged.
Yian Kut-Ku.sightings: Yian Kut-Ku are primarily found in the Scarlet Forest, with Frenzied individuals also being found in the Iceshard Cliffs. While in the Scarlet Forest, they are frequently encountered in large flocks.
Yian Kut-Ku.characteristics:
Hunters Notes: Bird wyverns with impressive beaks and large ears. They tend to be skittish but will sometimes initiate attacks on a perceived threat. Yian Kut-Ku arrive in large groups during the season of Plenty in the Scarlet Forest. The absence of eggs or young suggests that the purpose of this is not to breed, but rather to seek out mates and nourishment.
Helpful Hints: The Yian Kut-Ku's superior hearing comes with great sensitivity to sound. A loud noise is sometimes all it takes to stop them in their tracks, reason enough to make liberal use of sonic bombs. But there's a catch: once a Yian Kut-Ku comes back to itself, it's going to be really flocking mad and come at a hunter even more viciously than before.Yian Kut-Ku are medium-sized Bird Wyverns found in tropical climates with impressively large beaks and ears. It sports vibrant pink dorsal shells that protrude outwards like spines, while its ventral scales are primarily cream. It has long legs and three-toed feet, and is known to be agile on foot. The lateral scales separating the dorsal shells from its underbelly are bright yellow. The wings of the Yian Kut-Ku have blue webbing that is incredibly resistant, making it highly valued as fusing material.[2] Its carapace is fire-resistant as well, eliminating the risk of being burnt by the fireballs it spits during combat.
One of the Yian Kut-Ku's most impressive features is its large ear frills, which can fold and expand at will. These frills can be used to intimidate predators by not only making the monster look bigger, but also by amplifying the sound of the Yian Kut-Ku's screeches.[3][4] When expanded, the ears resemble satellite dishes in appearance, and allow the monster's highly developed audio receptors to pinpoint the locations of both predator and prey. Its exceptional hearing also allows it to detect changes in its chicks' health by picking up on subtle differences in the calls of its young.[3] Unfortunately, the Yian Kut-Ku's sensitive ears render the monster particularly vulnerable to loud noises, such as those produced by Sonic Bombs, which can damage its ear canals and momentarily paralyze it.[3] Fully-grown Yian Kut-Ku ears are considered to be good luck charms and are often used to craft Bowguns due to their fire-resistant nature.[5][6]
The Yian Kut-Ku uses its large beak to dig holes in the ground in search of food, primarily insects. Its favourite prey is Konchu, and bypasses the Neopteron's tough exoskeleton by simply swallowing it whole.[7] Its beak is uniquely shaped to act as a shovel, aiding it in unearthing insects and larvae hiding underground. Holes can be seen scattered around the monster's territory as a result of it foraging.[8] While primarily insectivorous, during the breeding season, Yian Kut-Ku have been observed eating the honey from beehives.[4]
Yian Kut-Ku.behavior:
Yian Kut-Ku are typically quite skittish, but will act aggressively towards perceived threats. While considered to be weaker than other Wyverns, they are agile and enough of a threat to be considered dangerous to humans, especially since they possess a Flame Sac and are capable of spitting fireballs at enemies.
Yian Kut-Ku will occasionally reproduce en-mass when weather conditions are favourable for earthworms, one of the monster's favourite prey items, to multiply in large numbers. With an increase in the Yian Kut-Ku population, however, comes food scarcity, so the monsters seek new territory to forage for food, which eventually ends up with them attacking human settlements. In response, large-scale Yian Kut-Ku hunts are ordered to reduce the population before it spirals out of control. This ends up with a notable decline in the population's numbers, which return to normal the year following the reproduction bloom.[4]
During the season of Plenty, huge flocks of Yian Kut-Ku migrate to the Scarlet Forest. This is to either find a mate or food, considering the lack of juvenile individuals.[9]
Yian Kut-Ku.useful_information: The Yian Kut-Ku's superior hearing comes with great sensitivity to sound. A loud noise is sometimes all it takes to stop them in their tracks, reason enough to make liberal use of sonic bombs. But there's a catch: once a Yian Kut-Ku comes back to itself, it's going to be really flocking mad and come at a hunter even more viciously than before.

Blue Yian Kut-Ku.characteristics:
Threat: ★★★This subspecies is overall quite similar to the common Yian Kut-Ku and shares much of the same physiology and ecology. The main difference between the two is the Blue Yian Kut-Ku's shell, which is a light blue color rather than pink. This shell is tougher than the one found on common individuals, and is resistant enough to reliably repel wyvern fangs.[2] Blue Yian Kut-Ku are also generally stronger than pink individuals, displaying greater strength and resilience especially when enraged.
It is currently unknown what factors caused this species to deviate from the common Yian Kut-Ku.

Anjanath.hunter_notes:
Anjanath primarily attack with their head, either by biting or simply swiping it in front of them. They can also attack with their tail, the spines on it extending to create wind pressure around it.
When Anjanath enrages, they will ignite their throat on fire as their back sails extend outwards, enabling them to breath fire from their nose. Dealing enough damage to their head will de-ignite their nose and topple them, preventing them from utilising fire for the rest of their enrage.
Anjanath.sightings: Anjanath is found in all maps bar the Frost Islands.
Anjanath.characteristics:
Like many Brute Wyvern, Anjanath sport powerful jaws, two muscular hind legs, robust tails and short forelimbs. Their most distinct feature is that they are covered in patches of dark fur. While the Hunter's Guild calls this tissue "Anjanath Fur", it is in fact made up of small feathers, making the Anjanath the only currently known feathered Brute Wyvern.[3]
The scales of Anjanath are hard as iron and offer high defense.[4] They owe their sturdiness to being tempered by the high body temperature and flame ability of the Anjanath.[5] Very rarely, these scales can combine and overlay, turning into a valuable rolled scale plate called an Anjanath Plate.[6]
Anjanath "fur" is believed to mostly aid in temperature regulation, helping the wyvern maintain the high body temperature necessary for its high level of activity.[3] This coat is however also highly defensive in nature: The feathers are thick and densely packed, providing high resistance to physical attacks.[7] Additionally, the coat is extremely fire resistant. This quality has made it a popular material for firefighter garments[8] and high quality cuts of Anjanath "Fur" are considered quite valuable.[9] It is believed that juvenile Anjanath possess a much larger, more developed feather coat, which then thins out as they reach maturity.[3]
Anjanath are well-known for their distinctive pink coloration, but their skin is actually translucent. The pink hue comes from the blood flow that is visible through the skin.[3]
Another defining feature of Anjanath is their ability to produce and spit fire. This is achieved through a two-tiered mechanism: In their throats, Anjanath have a Flame Sac[10] which produces an flammable powder that ignites upon coming into contact with air.[11][12] Producing that powder takes time, and the Flame Sac will begin glowing through the creature's skin as it accumulates and heats the substance.[10] Simultaneously, an organ connected to the olfactory canal produces copious amounts of flammable mucus.[13] By mixing the powder and mucus in their mouths and exposing the mixture to air, Anjanath are capable of producing and spewing a destructive flame.[10]
Anjanath are known to possess powerful bites. Their fangs are sturdy and hard, shaped by the pressure and heat inside of an Anjanath's mouth.[14] As time goes on, these fangs continually gow in size and heat resistance, eventually turning into Anjanath Hardfangs.[15]
One very distinctive feature of Anjanath is their nose. They have an extremely well developed olfactory sense, and can track prey by scent alone. This ability is amplified by a peculiar characteristic of Anjanath: They are able to unfurl their nostrils and expose their entire sinus structure on top of their heads. They do so by raising their nose hood, and this maneuver increases their sense of smell even further.[13] Much is still unknown about the bone structure that enables this ability, and Anjanath Nosebones are a hot research topic as a result.[16] It is believed that larger, more developed nosebones are more commonly found in more powerful Anjanath individuals.[17]
Anjanath Tails are covered in highly flexible feathers on their top side and retractable spikes on the underside. These features can be extended at will, and when fully flexed, they allow Anjanath to create small gusts of wind by swinging their tails.[18] Anjanath tails are considered a delicacy in the regions near Kamura Village.[19]
On their hips, Anjanath grow a pair of extendable sail membranes. These unique structures are only visible when the wyvern is enraged, and have been found to be full of capillaries.[18] They have thus been theorized to serve as temperature regulators, potentially compensating for the Anjanath's lack of sweat glands.[20]
The small forearms of the Anjanath are deceptively powerful, and are used to help the wyvern with climbing up rocky cliffs.[18] Like many wyvern, Anjanath also grow valuable gems inside their bodies, formed through the continuous accumulation of impurities and marginal waste materials. Anjanath Gems are said to be tinged with fire.[21]
Anjanath.behavior:
Anjanath are extremely aggressive, known to pursue prey for vast distances. In the New World, this even leads them to sometimes chase targets all the way from the Ancient Forest and into the Wildspire Waste. Anjanath do not seem to differentiate between minor and major threats and appear to attack with full force regardless of the situation.[1] This high degree of aggression might be linked to this species' strong food motivation - Anjanath have been observed eating as often as five times a day.[18]
Solitary by nature, Anjanath patrol their vast territories daily, marking their borders with mucus up to thirty times each day.[18] Within these territories, Anjanath hunt alone and usually choose Aptonoth as their preferred prey. Curiously, Anjanath do not use their flame breath at all while hunting. It has been noted that this species prefers the taste of raw meat over cooked meat, so perhaps it avoids burning prey for that reason.[20]
Due to their aggression, Anjanath often find themselves embroiled in territorial disputes with other monsters. During such skirmishes, Anjanath extend their sails, tail feathers and nostrils[18] and focus on inflicting physical damage first. Using their powerful bodies, Anjanath brutally assault their enemies. Anjanath are actually quite calculated fighters, as their brutish barrage serves mainly to wear down their enemies and buy time for the wyvern's flame sac to charge up.[10] Once ready, the Anjanath enter into a fired-up state, where the flame sac in their throats glows menacingly. Anjanath then move in for the final blow, attempting to overwhelm the opponent with devastating flame attacks. This state is powerful, but usually shortlived: Keeping the flame sac active appears to be quite exhausting for the Anjanath. Additionally, hunters have occassionally witnessed the flame in an Anjnath's mouth detonating inside of it, harming the creature - likely a risk inherent to the use of this ability. Due to these factors, Anjanath try to finish opponents off quickly once they become fired up, releasing all their stored up mucus and flame powder into one devastating fire blast once they notice that their time is up. Due to these difficulties and the fact that it remains entirely unused during regular hunting, it has been theorized that the Anjanath's flame breath evolved specifically as a last resort weapon against opposing large monsters.[10]
When not in combat, Anjanath have been observed sunbathing in the Ancient Forest. Why exactly they do this is unclear, but Anjanath are known to seek out the opportunity to sit in the sun at least three times a day.[3] Very little is known about the social behavior between Anjanath, but the sails have been proposed as a possible means of communication between individuals.[18]
