Table_1.Price: A monster organ filled with a highly explosive powder. Extremely dangerous!

Fulgur Anjanath.hunter_notes: Much like Anjanath, Fulgur primarily attacks by biting or swiping with their head. They are also capable of firing off balls of snot from their nose. As the fight, Fulgur will begin to charge themself with electricity, gaining access to new Thunder-based bite attacks and causing their mucus to also inflict Thunderblight. Eventually, Fulgur will roar and extend their sails, having fully charged up. In this state, all their bites attacks are capable of inflicting Thunderblight. After a while, Fulgur will step back before lunging towards their target while coated in electricity, exiting their charged state afterwards. If enough damage is dealt to their head while fully-charged, they will lose their charge and be toppled in the process.
Fulgur Anjanath.sightings: Fulgur Anjanath can be found in any locale. They can be found in any region of the Guiding Lands from level 2 onwards.
Fulgur Anjanath.characteristics: Feared as the “Thunder Jaw Wyvern”, this Anjanath subspecies electrifies its jaws and dorsal membrane with every blow.
Fulgur Anjanath.useful_information: Useful Information: Once it enters an electrified state, its hide hardens, and its attacks deal elemental damage. Focus blows on its head to dissipate the charge. Also note its broad territory.

Banbaro.hunter_notes: Banbaro primarily attack with their antlers, swiping them around themself. One noteworthy attack of Banbaro involves them digging their antlers into the ground, picking a rock up in them and charging forward with it. The effects of the boulder depend on the environment:
Banbaro.sightings: Banbaro can be found in every locale. They are found in the Coral, Rotten, Volcanic and Frozen regions of the Guiding Lands and the Forest and Desert regions from level 2 onwards.
Banbaro.characteristics: A monster marked by its furious charge and by the majestic twin horns that uproot trees and gouge at the earth as it runs.
Banbaro.useful_information: Useful Information: Blows to the Banbaro's legs are an effective counter to its deadly charge. Hunters have also reported that firing scatternuts or crystalbursts mid-charge can halt the beast.

Barroth.hunter_notes:
If you get hit by the mud Barroth flings around, you'll get muddy, which means that any pro hunter should prioritize attacking the muddy parts of the monster to clean it off! Once you've got rid of all that mud, fighting it will be some good, clean fun!Barroth primarily attack by charging at the hunter, though they are also capable of slamming with their crown, hips and tail. While these parts of their body are coated in mud, attacks utilising them will fire off balls of mud that leave behind movement restricting piles of mud.
Barroth will begin the fight coated in mud on all parts of their body, reducing damage dealt to them. This mud armour can be broken by dealing enough damage to it, though the Barroth will periodically wander over to and roll around in pools of mud to re-armour themself. If a part of their body has been either broken or severed, it will be unable to be coated in mud.
Barroth.sightings: Barroth is found exclusively in the Sandy Plains.
Barroth.characteristics: Barroth usually remain beneath the mud, perhaps to shield themselves from heat; they are even known to attack by flinging mud. They will charge in a frenzy at anything that disturbs their bogs.If you get hit by the mud Barroth flings around, you'll get muddy, which means that any pro hunter should prioritize attacking the muddy parts of the monster to clean it off! Once you've got rid of all that mud, fighting it will be some good, clean fun!

Brachydios.hunter_notes:
Brachydios primarily attacks by punching with their powerful forelimbs. Punches with these limbs will leave behind pools of slime that, when stood in, inflict Blastscourge before eventually exploding. Brachydios can also attack with their slime-covered horn, creating slime pools that also restrict movement. As they attack with their forelimbs, the slime coating them will gradually decrease, preventing them from leaving behind pools. Brachydios can lick their forelimbs to replenish their slime mold. Breaking their forelimbs causes their slime to deplete faster.
While Brachydios' is enraged, most attacks with their fists will no longer leave behind slime, instead generating immediate explosions. They can also plunge their horn into the ground to create ranged explosions.
Brachydios.sightings: Brachydios is found primarily in the Elder's Recess. They can also be found in the Volcanic region of the Guiding Lands from level 2 onwards.
Brachydios.characteristics:
This marine-blue brute wyvern uses its saliva to prime the sticky slime coating its massive arms, rendering it highly explosive.The Brachydios is a carnivorous Brute Wyvern most often encountered in volcanic and polar regions, as well as the Deserted Island. Its body is covered in a sleek armor of glossy marine-coloured carapace, which shields it from the blasts of the volatile slime mold produced on its body.
On the arms, this shell overgrows from the knuckles to form a battering structure referred to as a "pounder", which protect the two-fingered hand from the impact of blows against hard surfaces. A similar structure is formed by the horn on the scalp, while the tail ends in a club-like structure. The individual plates of shell that form the outer part of a Brachydios's armor are sharply pointed at the ends, and form long spikes on the legs, forearms, neck, and skull, where a set of particularly broad and robust spikes form a crest at the back.
The thick slime that secretes from the Brute Wyvern's scalp and covers much of its body is believed to be a species of silme mold, which has a volatile reaction with the contents of its saliva and is produced in the horn even after death.[4] When striking the ground with its horn or forearms, a Brachydios will leave behind a puddle of this explosive slime, which will begin changing colour from green to red before exploding; when enraged, the puddle explodes immediately, and the slime covering its body will glow yellow and orange.
Brachydios.behavior:
This explosive slime mold allows the Brachydios to prey on dangerous Monsters such as Uragaan or the Leviathan Agnaktor, blasting through their armor of cooled lava and inflicting grave injuries that allow it to overpower them with its brute strength.
Brachydios is a highly agile Monster, with long and muscular hindlimbs that enable it to quickly close the distance between itself and its opponents by breaking into a fast sprint or leaping large distances through the air. When scaling steep inclinations, it will climb up by driving its pounders into the wall, leaving behind a trail of explosive slime.
Brachydios.useful_information: Useful Information: Its scalp secretes a thick slime capable of tripping hunters who step in it. Water will dilute it, however, making water and ice attacks to its head and arms effective.

Raging Brachydios.hunter_notes:
Raging uses similar moves and attack patterns to Brachydios, utilizing its arms, tail, and head to launch physical blows that inflict  Blastscourge. These attacks will also leave behind pools of slime that inflict Blastscourge on contact before eventually exploding, inflicting  Fireblight.
Body parts coated in slime will eventually turn red, causing these parts to instead create immediate explosions, as well as gaining access to stronger explosion attacks. Melee attacks, attacks with the  Water element, or Puddle Pods can knock the red slime off of Raging's body to temporarily remove it, although this will cause it to drop to the ground and explode shortly after. Raging can also "prime" its arms by licking them, instantly turning them red; all of its body parts will also instantly turn red when enraged.
When moving to its nest in Area 15, Raging will repeatedly pulverize the ground and alter the environment, turning its whole body smoldering black. The exits to the area are sealed off, preventing escape (even through a Farcaster), and Traps can no longer be used. In this state, Raging changes its explosive slime pools to superheated pools that do not initially explode, instead inflicting continuous damage to hunters standing on them. It also gains the ability to roar to spread the slime in a wider area. After a period of spreading this slime, Raging will let out a distinct high-pitched screech, detonating all slime pools in the area, dealing massive damage to hunters as well as damaging themself if it happens to be in the blast radius.
Raging Brachydios.sightings: Raging Brachydios is only found in the Guiding Lands. They will begin the fight in Area 2, progressing in a set pattern to Areas 3, then 5, then 14 and finally 15.
Raging Brachydios.characteristics: A Brachydios variant that is much larger than the normal species. The slime on its body will activate over time and detonate.
Raging Brachydios.useful_information: Useful Information: Use melee attacks, water element attacks or watermoss to stop the slime from activating. However, watch your step, as this will cause the slime to fall off and detonate.

Deviljho.hunter_notes:
Deviljho attacks primarily by attempting to bite at the hunter, as well as by slamming into them with the weight of their body. While they are exhausted, their acidic saliva causes all of their bites to inflict Defense Down.
When Deviljho enraged, the muscles on their back will swell and they gain to ability to fire off Dragon breath. Damaging the glowing spot on Deviljho's chest enough will result in them attempting a counter attack, dragging their body along the ground. Hitting them in the chest again during this attack will result in them being toppled, with them being unable to utilise the Dragon element for the remainder of their enrage.
Deviljho are capable of picking up certain other large monsters in their mouth, where they will proceed to use them as weapons against the hunter, all attacks with the monster inflicting Defense Down. Deviljho are capable of picking up: Great Jagras, Kulu-Ya-Ku, Tobi-Kadachi, Tzitzi-Ya-Ku, Great Girros, Odogaron and Dodogama.
Deviljho.sightings: Deviljho can be found in any locale, though they can only be encountered in High Rank*.
Deviljho.characteristics:
Due to its enhanced metabolism, Deviljho must constantly seek out prey. It is extremely violent, and known to snatch up large monsters in its powerful maw and flail them around.Deviljho is a large, bipedal brute-wyvern with a body similar to a T-Rex, but with its own unique physiology. Its body is covered in dark green scales. They have compact, bulbous bodies. A line of spikes runs down its back. Its body is held up by powerful legs. The feet have three clawed toes that touch the ground and another that hangs on the side. The tiny forearms end in two fingers. The tail is large and meaty. Spikes run down both the tail's top and bottom with two more lines on each side. The neck is thick. It holds the head below the level of the back. 
The head is large and the yellow eyes are small. Unlike most Brute Wyverns, Deviljho lacks any horns or crest on its head. Instead, it has very robust jaws. The jaw adductor muscles are bright pink and well-developed. The area behind the adductor muscles lacks scales, this gives the illusion that Devoljho's mouth continues into the neck. Rows of razor-sharp teeth line both the inside and outside of the mouth. Devljho continuously grows more teeth throughout its life. It will rub its mouth on the ground to remove teeth that are old or damaged[4].
Deviljho's muscles are extremely large and dense, giving them terrifying strength. Deviljho are easily capable of breaking through fallen trees[5] and launching boulders. They can even lift other large monsters such as Diablos over its head.[6] Deviljho also have a faster metabolism than other wyverns, allowing them to be active for longer periods.[2] Due to its fast metabolism and large muscles, Deviljho is almost always hungry[2]. Its hunger causes its mouth to constantly drool. A Deviljho's saliva is highly acidic, melting through scale and bone alike. It deteriorates the armor of hunters just as easily.[4]
When enraged, adrenaline causes a Deviljho's body goes into overdrive. Blood flow increases. The muscles swell to be even larger and glow blood red. The most notable effect is that Deviljho will begin to produce dragon energy. It will breathe streams of Dragon Element vapor upon its opponents. There is a cost to this additional power. The swelling causes the skin to tear, reopening old wounds.[7]
Deviljho are highly adaptable, they can appear in seemingly any habitat. Hot, cold, dry, humid, hazardous, or peaceful. If there is a lot of prey available, Deviljho will appear.
Deviljho of the New World differ from those of the Old World. Deviljho of the New World are generally more muscular, especially in the head and neck. However, their chest are leaner. The reason for this increased muscle mass is unknown. It may be related to the tendency of New World individuals to carry large prey in its jaws.[8]
Deviljho.behavior:
Deviljho are only driven by their insatiable hunger. They endlessly wander looking for more prey. This prey could be small herbivores, large wyverns, Elder Dragons, or even its own kind. Deviljho will pursue them indiscriminately. Deviljho uses its strong sense of smell to search for food. Smaller prey is swallowed whole immediately. Larger prey has to be torn apart before consumption.[2]
Deviljho are Invaders. They will enter any habitat and disrupt the balance of its ecosystem by predating on too many monsters. Some individuals in the Old World have caused an ecosystem to collapse.[2] Deviljho have been observed to specifically hunt the apex monsters ruling the location they invade. For Flying Wyverns, Deviljho will ambush them, seizing them in its jaws before they can take flight. On the rare occasion when a Deviljho is not hungry, it may still attack a smaller monster for seemingly no reason. Deviljho's violent nature has earned it many names such as "Gluttonous Demon"[9] and "World Eater."[10]
Deviljho chiefly rely on their jaw to subdue opponents. They will bite opponents like most Brute Wyverns do but also have other attacks that are uniquely reckless. A common attack is when the monster raises its body and opens its mouth. Then it will slam its teeth down on the opponent. Another is to shove its lower jaw into the ground and then advance toward the opponent in an attempt to scoop it into its maw. Deviljho will also lunge at its prey, though with significantly less grace than other monsters. They will also swing their huge bodies, stomp the ground to cause tremors, and launch boulders at their opponent. When enraged, Deviljho puts even more force into each attack. It also gains the ability to spew clouds of Dragon Energy out of its mouth. 
Once a Deviljho's prey is firmly in its maw, it will throttle its prey and slam it on the ground. Regardless of whether the prey dies or not, the Deviljho may walk around with its meal still in its jaws. If it spots another potential prey item, the Deviljho will forget it already has a meal in its mouth and pursue the new target. It will use the creature in its mouth as a brutal weapon. Deviljho will slam its new prey with its old prey, causing significant damage to both.[4][11]
Deviljho.useful_information: Useful Information: When enraged, Deviljho's swollen muscles glow a hellish red. It will start spewing a sweeping dragon element attack, so watch your distance. Deviljho stays on the attack even when wounded, but don't give up; keep fighting and you'll come out on top.

Savage Deviljho.hunter_notes:
Much like Deviljho, Savage attacks primarily by biting with or slamming their jaws, which are capable of inflicting Defense Down, as well as scattering clouds of Dragon energy. They are also capable of always breathing out Dragon energy, both as lasers or as lingering clouds.
Eventually, Savage will enrage. Notably, Savage can enrage without needing to take any damage. After dealing enough damage to them, they will attempt a counter attack, dragging their body along the ground. Hitting them again during this counter cause them to topple, forcing them to exit their enrage. Savage will never natural exit their enrage otherwise.
Savage are capable of picking up certain other large monsters in their mouth, where they will proceed to use them as weapons against the hunter, all attacks with the monster inflicting Defense Down. Deviljho are capable of picking up: Great Jagras, Kulu-Ya-Ku, Tobi-Kadachi, Viper Tobi-Kadachi, Tzitzi-Ya-Ku, Great Girros, Odogaron, Ebony Odogaron and Dodogama.
Savage Deviljho.sightings: Savage Deviljho can be found in any locale. They can be found in any region of the Guiding Lands from level 5 onwards.
Savage Deviljho.characteristics: A mutated Deviljho variant, driven mad by its overpowering hunger. It will attempt to feed on all it sees.
Savage Deviljho.useful_information: Useful Information: The monster grows in strength as it fights and feeds, so preventing it from eating is paramount. Blows to the head are effective. It will ignore hunters around larger prey.

Glavenus.hunter_notes:
Glavenus can attack by biting forwards, however they most prominently attack with their large blade-like tail. As Glavenus attacks with their tail, it will gradually heat up, eventually setting itself aflame. In this state, attacks with their tail inflict Fireblight. Glavenus' tail can only be severed while it is heated. Eventually, Glavenus' tail will cool down and rust over. Glavenus are capable of sharpening their tail in their mouth to return it to its default state.
After Glavenus sharpens their tail, they will ignite the ingested minerals in their throat, causing it to glow red. In this state, bites from the Glavenus inflict Fireblight and they are capable of spewing explosive pools of lava. Damaging their throat enough will return it to normal, toppling them.
Glavenus.sightings: Glavenus is found in the Ancient Forest, Wildspire Waste and Elder's Recess. They can also appear in the Desert region of the Wildspire Waste from level 2 onwards and the Forest and Volcanic regions from level 3 onwards.
Glavenus.characteristics:
A brute wyvern that wields its heavy, blue tail like a blade. It grows hotter and more keen with each strike until it glows red.Glavenus are large bipedal brute wyverns best known for their giant razor-sharp tails. They are covered in red scales and have backs adorned by massive, flame-shaped spikes. The head is also ornamented with various protrusions. Their forearms are small and generally useless.
This species of brute wyvern grows a specialized organ in the throat, called a Flaming Bursa. Through the use of this organ, Glavenus are able to produce and spit flaming hot globs of waste material, often likened to magma.[5] The bursas of certain Glavenus produce a concentrated orb of pure fire that is considered quite valuable.[6]
Glavenus are the male part of a sexually dimorphic species, but where or what their female partners are is currently unknown.[7]
Glavenus.behavior: Glavenus are solitary until the breeding season arrives. During that time, males and females will meet up and mate, before separating shortly after. Male Glavenus will sometimes breed with multiple females in a single breeding season. Females meanwhile will lay a single egg, which hatches soon after. Juvenile Glavenus only spend a very short time with their mothers, before setting out into the world to search for ore veins to grow their tails with.[8]
Glavenus.useful_information: Useful Information: Once red hot, its tail will begin to rust and the monster will sharpen it anew with its fangs, storing the slag to expel as fiery breath. Strike its throat when it glows red.

Acidic Glavenus.hunter_notes:
At the start of the fight, Acidic fights in a similar manner to Glavenus, biting forward and slamming down their blade-like tail. Any attack performed with their tail will fling off acidic crystals which inflict Defense Down. After a while, Acidic will place their blade in their mouth before spinning forward, shedding the acidic crystals from their tail in the process.
In this state, Acidic proceeds to adopt a new stance, holding their tail-blade to their side. They now prefer to attack with precise slashes from their tail, gaining new follow-ups to some of their old attacks. Acidic's tail can only be severed while in this state. Eventually, Acidic will regrow the acidic crystals on their tail, returning them to their base state.
Acidic Glavenus.sightings: Acidic Glavenus is found primarily in the Rotten Vale. They can also be found in the Rotten region of the Guiding Lands from level 3 onwards.
Acidic Glavenus.characteristics: A subspecies of Glavenus found in the Rotten Vale. A corrosive fluid has crystallized on its tail, spraying acid with each swing.
Acidic Glavenus.useful_information: Useful Information: The acid on its tail will lower a hunter's defenses on contact, and spreads with time, increasing the range of its spray. Scrape it off and the blade only grows sharper.

Radobaan.hunter_notes:
Radobaan attacks in a similar manner to Uragaan, namely by slamming their chin into the ground, rolling along the ground, either vertically or horizontally, or by expelling clouds of sleep gas. While their body parts are coated in bones, most of these attacks will throw off bone fragments around them.
At the start of the fight, Radobaan is covered in a layer of bone armour that acts as protection. The armour can be broken off with enough damage, with breaking their back specifically causing them to stumble as they attempt to roll. While in their nest in Area 4, Radobaan are capable of digging below the zone before emerging with their bone armour replenished.
Radobaan.sightings: Radobaan is found primarily in the Rotten Vale. They can also be found in the Rotten region of the Guiding Lands.
Radobaan.characteristics: A gigantic brute wyvern that eats the bones of carcasses found in the Rotten Vale, using some of it as armor. It also rolls into a ball as a form of attack and transportation.
Radobaan.useful_information: Useful Information: Attack it as it rolls around to throw it off balance and knock it down. Chunks of bone can be mined from its body once it's down. Shattering its bone armor is the key to winning a fight against this beast.

Rompopolo.hunter_notes:
Dappled brute wyverns that prowl Oilwell Basin. They use their tails to inject gas into the ground and detonate it, then feed on the small creatures that are unearthed. The toxic gas they spray from their tongues serve to weaken prey, which they then finish off with the blasts. Rompopolo are extremely territorial and will readily engage their own kind.
Helpful Hints: Hunters must be wary of the Rompopolo's poisonous explosions. Gas sacs can be found all over their bodies; the anterior ones contain poison, while the posterior sacs are for explosions. If you see one start to swell strike it to shrink it back down. When fighting in oilsilt, the blasts will kick up rubble that can act as stable footholds.Rompopolo attacks utilising its sharp blade-like forelimbs. Its posterior sac is capable of creating explosions in the ground that, if they occur on oil silt, create temporary platforms that are easier to walk on. Its anterior sac is capable of expelling a poisononous mist. If this sac is deflated, Rompopolo loses this ability.
When not enraged, the gas sacs on its head, back and tail can each be individualled deflated, toppling the monster if all three sacs are deflated. Eventually however, Rompopolo will re-inflate its sacs. While the monster is enraged, damaging one sac enough will cause all of its sacs to deflate, the monster to be knocked over and for Rompopolo to exit their enrage.
After expelling poison from their tongue, Rompopolo's tongue is left exposed as a weak point for Focus Strikes.
Rompopolo.sightings: Rompopolo is found exclusively in the Oilwell Basin.
Rompopolo.characteristics:
Hunters Notes: Dappled brute wyverns that prowl Oilwell Basin. They use their tails to inject gas into the ground and detonate it, then feed on the small creatures that are unearthed. The toxic gas they spray from their tongues serve to weaken prey, which they then finish off with the blasts. Rompopolo are extremely territorial and will readily engage their own kind.
Helpful Hints: Hunters must be wary of the Rompopolo's poisonous explosions. Gas sacs can be found all over their bodies; the anterior ones contain poison, while the posterior sacs are for explosions. If you see one start to swell strike it to shrink it back down. When fighting in oilsilt, the blasts will kick up rubble that can act as stable footholds.The Rompopolo is a bizarre-looking Brute Wyvern with insectoid traits, such as lidless red compound eyes, a curved proboscis-like beak, and an elongated tail with a large stinger at the end. Its forelimbs have been adapted into purple raptorial structures used to pierce the vitals of prey,[2] while its hind limbs end in three digits resembling purple suction cups. The monster's entire body is covered in a saggy, mottled indigo hide with spots of teal and purple throughout. This hide is extremely elastic and can stretch to several times its normal size,[3] but always returns to its original shape afterwards.[4] The spotted patterns on a Rompopolo's hide are said to indicate how poisonous it is.[5]
Rompopolo produce gases within their bodies, which they pump into saggy sacs on their head, torso, and tail, causing them to dramatically inflate. The sacs on the anterior half of its body are filled with poison gas that the monster expels from a hole in its whip-like tongue, while the posterior sacs contain pressurized gas which is injected into the ground using the stinger on its abdomen, creating violent explosions when the gas bubbles to the surface.[6]
Rompopolo.behavior:
Rompopolo are highly territorial and aggressively attack intruders, and will even regularly pick fights with their own kind.[6]
Rompopolo primarily feed on small creatures buried in the ground, such as Crudeshell Crabs, by using their gas explosions to unearth them before snapping them up with their beaks.[6]
Rompopolo.useful_information: Hunters must be wary of the Rompopolo's poisonous explosions. Gas sacs can be found all over their bodies; the anterior ones contain poison, while the posterior sacs are for explosions. If you see one start to swell strike it to shrink it back down. When fighting in oilsilt, the blasts will kick up rubble that can act as stable footholds.

Quematrice.hunter_notes:
Brute Wyverns with disproportionately long tails. They spread a flammable substance which vaporizes quickly, then it ignite it by dragging their tails along the ground. By nature, Quematrice rarely hunt their own prey, and instead scavenge herbivore carrion left behind by other predators. This often leads to confrontations with other, smaller carnivores.
Helpful Hints: Keep an eye on where the flammable material settles on the ground to gauge how much a Quematrice's fire will spread. Since they rely on their tails to attack from a distance as well as to start blazes, a hunter can weaken this monster significantly by cutting it off.Quematrice primarily attacks with its tail. Its tail is capable of spreading a flammable substance across the ground, allowing it to send off waves of fire during its attacks. These fires are capable of igniting any patches of grass they come in contact with. However, by severing the monster's tail, its ability to spread fire with it is removed.
Quematrice.sightings: Quematrice is found primarily in the Windward Plains, with Tempered individuals also being found in the Ruins of Wyveria.
Quematrice.characteristics:
Hunters Notes: Brute Wyverns with disproportionately long tails. They spread a flammable substance which vaporizes quickly, then it ignite it by dragging their tails along the ground. By nature, Quematrice rarely hunt their own prey, and instead scavenge herbivore carrion left behind by other predators. This often leads to confrontations with other, smaller carnivores.
Helpful Hints: Keep an eye on where the flammable material settles on the ground to gauge how much a Quematrice's fire will spread. Since they rely on their tails to attack from a distance as well as to start blazes, a hunter can weaken this monster significantly by cutting it off.Quematrice are relatively small for a Brute Wyvern. The Quematrice's scales are grey in color with blue mottling. They have short, robust skulls and strong jaws. The eyes are midway between the front and back of the skull.[2] The eyes have a golden color. The pupils are slit. Quematrice possesses a nictitating membrane that can be briefly seen when it blinks. Interestingly, the teeth are similar to a canine's. On the lower jaw, there are three pairs of small incisors in the front, a pair of very stout canines, and four pairs of carnassials in the back. The outer two incisors and canines in the lower jaw stick out of the mouth when it is closed, there is a kink in the upper jaw that the canines fit into. The teeth in the upper jaw have a similar arrangement, though the upper canines are much smaller.[2] There is a bright red comb on top of its head, similar to a rooster's. Two more crests surround each eye and project backwards. They resemble a reddish-orange mask. All three crests naturally have holes in them.
The sides of the neck have two large dewlaps. The dewlaps are grey with red spots and dark blue at the fringes. The torso region is round like a barrel. The arms are short and somewhat pudgy. The hands are small with three short fingers on each. The legs are also short but muscular, especially the thighs. There are four toes on each foot. The innermost toe is vestigial. The tail of Quematrice is very long and muscular. It is lined with long tasseled frills called "pleats."[3] These pleats make Quematrice look significantly larger. Where they attach to the tail, the pleats are grey, moving outwards, they are dark blue and then red near the fringe.
The tail contains a flammable fluid, Quematrice Igniter. When it swings its tail, Quematrice can release this fluid as a grey gas. The pleats of its tail rubbing together create sparks that ignite the gas.[4] The gas will burn for a single second before dissipating. Severing a Quematrice's tail makes it difficult to create sparks.
The scales of a Quematrice have a sharp, fine edge. It can be used to polish armor or cut into stone.[5][6] This sharpness is possibly why they create sparks. Its scales and hide are very heat-resistant.[7]
Quematrice.behavior:
Quematrice primarily inhabit the savanna area of the Windward Plains, where large groups of the local herbivores gather. It may enter more barren areas if chased off by another monster, but it will soon return. They rest inside large cut-out areas of cliffsides. They can also be found in the Ruins of Wyveria.
Quematrice is chiefly a scavenger. It feeds off of animals that have already died, usually by other carnivores.  Instead of waiting, Quematrice will seize food from smaller predators, be it Talioth or Felynes delivering meat[8]. The formal are hostile towards the Brute Wyvern for this reason. There are many larger predators that are a danger to Quematrice. These include Rathian, Doshaguma packs, and Rey Dau during the Sandtide.  The comb also serves as a decoy for predators to attack instead of the head itself.[9] The Brute Wyvern may fight back against these predators, but will quickly retreat once it sustains enough damage.
Quematrice fights with its head and tail. It will bite with its strong jaws or "peck" with the front of its snout. Its large tail can be used to sweep away or smash opponents. The tail can spread a flammable gas. The gas will then be ignited by sparks made when the tail is swung again. This creates a ring of fire and a subsequent circle of burnt grass around Quematrice.
When not competing with other predators, Quematrice is relatively docile. It ignores all living herbivores and hunters that stay at a moderate distance. A monster that they will not tolerate is another Quematrice. When two individuals see each other, they will immediately engage in a brief territorial battle. The one who is knocked over first will retreat. Quematrice will shake the bright comb on its head to display its aggression toward opponents.[10]
Quematrice.useful_information: Keep an eye on where the flammable material settles on the ground to gauge how much a Quematrice's fire will spread. Since they rely on their tails to attack from a distance as well as to start blazes, a hunter can weaken this monster significantly by cutting it off.

Uragaan.hunter_notes:
Uragaan primarily attack with their large chin, smashing it into the ground, and by curling up and rolling around. They can also expel both sleep-inducing and fiery gas from their stomach. Several of their attacks will additionally throw off molten ores that remain in the ground, which explode when hit by an attack or the tremors that Uragaan creates. Additionally, in Master Rank, if Uragaan rolls over one of their thrown ores, their body will be temporarily lit aflame.
While an Uragaan is toppled, it is possible to mine for ores from their back.
While in their nest in Area 5, if Uragaan rolls into one of the sloped walls, they are capable of turning around to roll back towards the hunter. This is typically performed several times in a row.
Uragaan.sightings: Uragaan is found primarily in the Elder's Recess. They can also be found in the Volcanic region of the Guiding Lands from level 2 onwards.
Uragaan.characteristics: Large brute wyverns that feed on ore, using their mighty jaws to crush solid rock to powder. They've been known to confront Lavasioths over territory disputes.
Uragaan.useful_information: Useful Information: A crushing slam from the Uragaan's jaw can send shockwaves across the ground, detonating any explosive rocks in the area. In addition, when an Uragaan is toppled, its body can be mined for ore.

Daimyo Hermitaur.hunter_notes: Daimyo Hermitaurs' weak point is their head. Attacking it will inflict massive damage, so focus your attention there. However, they will use their gargantuan claws to defend themselves and to protect this soft spot. Using a Sonic Bomb when they adopt a defensive position is an excellent tactic to "crack the shell to get the nut inside."Daimyo Hermitaur attacks primarily with their claws, often moving sideways before attacking. They can also use their claws to guard their face. Trying to attack them in this state will cause them to retaliate with a counter-attack. Throwing a Sonic Bomb at them in this state will flinch them out of their guard. Daimyo are also capable of firing off beams of water from their mouth and burrowing underground before attempting to skewer the hunter with their shell.
Daimyo Hermitaur.sightings: Daimyo Hermitaur is found in the Shrine Ruins, Sandy Plains, Flooded Forest and Jungle.
Daimyo Hermitaur.characteristics: Large Carapaceons that live in costal regions and sandy soil. Daimyo Hermitaurs use their massive claws to guard themselves against enemy attacks. These creatures wear wyvern skulls on their backs, unlike the shells carried in their infancy. These shells serve not only as protection, but also as a method for attacking prey. They are highly valued for their materials - their brains in particular.Daimyo Hermitaurs' weak point is their head. Attacking it will inflict massive damage, so focus your attention there. However, they will use their gargantuan claws to defend themselves and to protect this soft spot. Using a Sonic Bomb when they adopt a defensive position is an excellent tactic to "crack the shell to get the nut inside."

Plum Daimyo Hermitaur.characteristics:
Threat: ★★★★A rare form of the Daimyo Hermitaur, Plum Daimyo Hermitaur carry a Diablos skull instead of the typical Monoblos skull. They also sport a purple and white carapace as opposed to the more common red variety. They have long antennae and pitch black stalk eyes used for sensing the world around them on land as well as submerged in the ocean. Their change in coloration is believed to be the result of a change in diet, with the new staple foods of this type of Daimyo Hermitaur coloring the shell purple. Why this subspecies seems to prefer Diablos skulls is however unknown.[2]
The Plum Daimyo Hermitaur are able to move faster than normal Daimyo Hermitaur and strike with rapid speeds. They have also been noted to leap higher into the air and spew their bubble breath further than the more common variety. They possess powerful claws which aid them in digging beneath sand and dirt as well as acting as shields.
Plum Daimyo Hermitaur.behavior:
The environment Plum Daimyo Hermitaur inhabits generally overlaps with that of its common species, being coastal tropical jungles and deserts. Plum Daimyo Hermitaur are much more aggressive however, striking prey with their cunning speed and impressive leaps. This subspecies was originally dsicovered in the Old Desert.[2]
While it is well known that common Daimyo Hermitaur grow from their smaller Hermitaur relatives, no equivalent stage has ever been observed for Plum Daimyo Hermitaur.

Shogun Ceanataur.hunter_notes:
Shogun Ceanataur change up the way they fight depending on the shell they wear. Breaking the shell exposes the weak point, so focus your attention there. However, Shogun Ceanataur wield claws that can attack a wide area. Prioritize breaking the claws to reduce their threat.Shogun Ceanataur attack using their blade-like claws, either by sweeping them around themself or slamming them into the ground, with some of these attacks being able to cause Bleeding. Shogun Ceanataur are also capable of digging into the ground to attack with their claws from below. When a Shogun enrages, their claws will unfold, extending the range of all their claw based attacks. Breaking their claws will prevent their range from extending.
Shogun Ceanataur are capable of wearing 3 different shells on their back: a conch shell, a wyvern skull or a Gravios skull. While wearing a Gravios skull, Shogun are capable of firing a beam of urine from the skull’s mouth. Damaging the shell enough will break it, exposing the Shogun’s weak backside. Eventually, they will burrow beneath the ground before emerging with a new shell.
Shogun Ceanataur.sightings: Shogun Ceanataur is found in the Flooded Forest and Lava Caverns.
Shogun Ceanataur.characteristics: These large Carapaceons can be found around volcanoes and in the Flooded Forest. Shogun Ceanataur wield long, developed claws that are usually folded away, but unfurl into terrifying blades when enraged. Shogun Ceanataur like the Daimyo Hermitaur, are also known to use wyvern skulls as shells. Specimens that do, have been observed using a water jet-like attack.Shogun Ceanataur change up the way they fight depending on the shell they wear. Breaking the shell exposes the weak point, so focus your attention there. However, Shogun Ceanataur wield claws that can attack a wide area. Prioritize breaking the claws to reduce their threat.

Nu Udra.hunter_notes:
The cephalopod that reigns supreme over Oilwell Basin's ecosystem. Usually, when sighted, Nu Udra is covered in oilsilt, but when enraged it will ignite the coating, transfiguring itself into a horror of flame. The oculi that appear on its body and mant arms are presumed to be sensory organs, but the truth is still being investigated.
Helpful Hints: Each of a Nu Udra's many unique tentacles can be severed. But watch out when they get angry and burst into flame. You can douse any parts that are burning with watermoss - a recommended strategy, since it will leave the monster weakened. A Nu Udra's soft body allows them to slip through crevasses and move in surprising ways, so be careful not to let them get the jump on you.Nu Udra primarily attacks with physical strikes from its six grounded arms, being able to launch attacks in nearly any direction and strike with multiple arms at once. The glowing sensory organs on the tips of their arms provide hunters with an idea of who is currently being targeted by which arm. Each arm can be individually severed to reduce their range and provide extra carves.
Once enraged, Nu Udra's body begins glowing as they ignites it on fire and begin to use more powerful fire-based attacks. This includes flaming oil projectiles that create delayed explosions on impact and using its siphon to expel large amounts of fire on the ground. Eventually, Nu Udra will shed its oil coating in a dense rain of flaming oil, reappling its oil coat afterwards. Dealing enough damage to them while they are enraged will knock them out of their enrage, remove the oil coating on their body and topple them, weakening them for a time.
While in its nest in Area 17, Nu Udra is able to burrow into the cracks in the ground to quickly reposition around the area.
After performing its quadrupal arm slam, Nu Udra's beak, located behind its face tentacles, becomes a weak point for Focus Strikes.
As it does not rely on sight to detect prey, it is immune to Flash Bombs and similar effects.
Nu Udra.sightings: Nu Udra is only found in the Oilwell Basin and is primarily active in the Firespring, although it can rarely be found during other weather conditions.
Nu Udra.characteristics:
Hunters Notes: The cephalopod that reigns supreme over Oilwell Basin's ecosystem. Usually, when sighted, Nu Udra is covered in oilsilt, but when enraged it will ignite the coating, transfiguring itself into a horror of flame. The oculi that appear on its body and mant arms are presumed to be sensory organs, but the truth is still being investigated.
Helpful Hints: Each of a Nu Udra's many unique tentacles can be severed. But watch out when they get angry and burst into flame. You can douse any parts that are burning with watermoss - a recommended strategy, since it will leave the monster weakened. A Nu Udra's soft body allows them to slip through crevasses and move in surprising ways, so be careful not to let them get the jump on you.Nu Udra is an enormous monster with a strong resemblance to octopuses. It has a striped teal, purple, and black hide that becomes more yellow towards the ends of its tentacles, but is usually found completely coated in a tar-like "oilmucus" produced as a combination of its naturally flammable mucus and surrounding oilsilt,[2] the former of which is produced from a siphon beneath its mantle. Like a real-world octopus, it bears a total of eight tentacles; six larger arms used for locomotion and offense, and two smaller ones that conceal its beak like an upper lip. Each of the six main tentacles has rows of spines running along them—said spines also cover Nu Udra's mantle—a blue eye-like sensory organ on each end, and numerous large spikes lining their bottom side. Another pair of these sensory organs can be found on the head, where they can easily be mistaken for actual eyes. Above them are a pair of horn-like protrusions that protect its "eyes", giving the monster a demonic appearance. When enraged, its sensory organs, horns, and upper body glow bright blue.
Nu Udra has the ability to spontaneously ignite the fluid it produces, allowing it to emit massive deluges of fire towards enemies by pumping flaming mucus towards them, engulf itself in flames once enraged, or throw globs of explosive oilmucus with its tentacles. The flames it ignites are extremely hot and burn for a prolonged period of time,[3] while Nu Udra suffers no ill effects due to its fireproof hide.[4] Its tentacles are extremely muscular despite their flexibility, with each one being strong enough to lift a large monster like Ajarakan with no visible exertion; it uses them to grapple and bludgeon enemies or prey while gouging them with the numerous twisted spikes lining them.[5]
Because its body is soft and boneless barring its beak and spines, Nu Udra is able to fit its whole body into extremely small openings, which it uses to traverse its environment by squeezing through crevices and tunnels.
Nu Udra.behavior:
Nu Udra is highly aggressive towards intruders in its territory, but seems to seldom venture out of it, as it had not been sighted in many decades when it was rediscovered by Azuz and the Guild. It is seemingly attracted to sources of heat and fire, and is noted to become more aggressive in their presence. It appears to be a fairly intelligent monster, making full use of its dexterous tentacles and soft body for both defense and offense.
Nu Udra, unlike many other monsters, sleep in tight cavernous pits, blocking off almost all access to its den. It pokes one tentacle out of the hole however, as a way to sense incoming intruders in its territory.
Nu Udra primarily hunts during the Firespring, the Inclemency of the Oilwell Basin.
Nu Udra.useful_information: Each of a Nu Udra's many unique tentacles can be severed. But watch out when they get angry and burst into flame. You can douse any parts that are burning with watermoss - a recommended strategy, since it will leave the monster weakened. A Nu Udra's soft body allows them to slip through crevasses and move in surprising ways, so be careful not to let them get the jump on you.

Xu Wu.hunter_notes:
Cephalopod predators whose prey include Guardian monsters. The mucus secreted from their tentacles hardens quickly into sharp edges that resemble blades or spears, which is why some call Xu Wu the "Piercing Assassin". The sizable mouth hidden on their underside allows them to devour even rather large prey.
Helpful Hints: Due to their predatory nature, you can expect Xu Wu to attack Guardians inside their habitat. They have no eyes, but their other senses are developed and they excel at catching prey off guard, especially with their ability to enter small crevices and crawl quickly across the ground. When one exposes its mouth, that means a deadly attack is coming, but with a powerful blow, you might be able to topple the creature.Xu Wu attacks almost exclusively with their arms, using their mucus to form golden blades on the limb they are about to attacks with. They are also capable of throwing these blade-like secretions as projectiles. While their front arms can only be broken, their middle and back arms can be severed to reduce their range.
Occaisonally, Xu Wu will rear up, exposing the mouth on their underside before lunging forward at their target. If the monster is flinched while preparing to lunge, they will enter a special toppled state where their mouth is exposed. This will also occur when a hunter hits Xu Wu's mouth with Slinger ammo if it grabs and attempts to devour them.
While in their nest in Area 12, Xu Wu are capable of burrowing into the ground in order to reposition, including to emerge from the ceiling into an immediate lunge with their mouth.
As it does not rely on sight to detect prey, it is immune to Flash Bombs and similar effects.
Xu Wu.sightings: Xu Wu is found in the Ruins of Wyveria and Wounded Hollow.
Xu Wu.characteristics:
Hunters Notes: Cephalopod predators whose prey include Guardian monsters. The mucus secreted from their tentacles hardens quickly into sharp edges that resemble blades or spears, which is why some call Xu Wu the "Piercing Assassin". The sizable mouth hidden on their underside allows them to devour even rather large prey.
Helpful Hints: Due to their predatory nature, you can expect Xu Wu to attack Guardians inside their habitat. They have no eyes, but their other senses are developed and they excel at catching prey off guard, especially with their ability to enter small crevices and crawl quickly across the ground. When one exposes its mouth, that means a deadly attack is coming, but with a powerful blow, you might be able to topple the creature.Xu Wu is a medium sized Cephalopod that shares the general body shape of its class, with six thin but muscular tentacles used for locomotion and two smaller ones on the front of its body. Its head is large, rocky, and mushroom-shaped, with several teeth on the top, and a small, saggy mantle hanging off the back. Beneath its mantle is a "false face" resembling a set of teeth with grey fibers resembling a beard; the former will glow blue and start emitting vapor when Xu Wu is enraged. Its body and tentacles are highly fibrous in texture, and are primarily black with golden highlights. Its body underneath its tentacles is bright blue and lined with many rows of sharp teeth, with a large mouth directly beneath its head. Its mouth and fangs can crush nearly any prey,[2] and can devour prey larger than one would expect it to be able to.
Xu Wu's tentacles secrete a golden mucus that quickly hardens on contact with air, creating crystalline structures on its tentacle tips that it uses to hunt.[3] It is able to create sharp blades that can swiftly pierce and slash prey, crystal clusters that it can break off and launch as knife-like shrapnel, and hooks that it can use to immobilize prey or drag itself around terrain. These crystals are extremely hard despite their brittle appearance, but appear to be short-lived, as the weapons dissolve shortly after being created.
Xu Wu does not have eyes, but its other senses are highly developed to compensate.
Xu Wu.behavior:
Xu Wu is an apex predator that primarily uses its maneuverability to take its prey off guard with surprise attacks that kill without a sound,[4] particularly its ability to squeeze through the small spaces of its habitat. If forced into combat, Xu Wu will use its agility to outmaneuver a target, leaping and slithering around them while striking them with a flurry of precise piercing and slashing blows from its formed weapons, then crushing them within its maw.
It is adapted to prey on the Guardians of the Ruins of Wyveria, and is attracted to Guardians, their cocoons, or anything made to resemble them,[5] although it will also attempt to prey on anything else that enters the Ruins, even humans. Although it uses its ambush tactics against the Guardians, it is able to dominate them in direct combat as well, as its hide can easily repel their attacks,[6] and it has been seen rather easily bringing them down with its tentacles before moving in to devour them.[7]
Xu Wu is most active during the Wyvern's Wakening, the Inclemency of the Ruins of Wyveria, where it emerges to prey on the increased number of awakened Guardians.
Xu Wu.useful_information: Due to their predatory nature, you can expect Xu Wu to attack Guardians inside their habitat. They have no eyes, but their other senses are developed and they excel at catching prey off guard, especially with their ability to enter small crevices and crawl quickly across the ground. When one exposes its mouth, that means a deadly attack is coming, but with a powerful blow, you might be able to topple the creature.

Guardian Arkveld.hunter_notes: An artificial species created by an ancient civilization and imbued with the power of a monster called Arkveld. It cannot reproduce and does not require food, relying instead on Wyvern Milk for energy. In addition to absorbing and discharging energy the way other Guardians do, Guardian Arkveld can also absorb elemental energy through the chainblades on its wings and use it for sustenance.Helpful Hints: Guardian Arkveld use retractable chainblades on their wings to attack. Not only are the blades used to absorb and release energy like other Guardians, but they can also convert the energy to the dragon element and discharge it, which will trigger an explosion of the same element if it comes into contact with Wylkrystals. The crystals formed by their attacks will explode from elemental interference, making Slinger ammo effective.
Guardian Arkveld.characteristics:
Hunters Notes: An artificial species created by an ancient civilization and imbued with the power of a monster called Arkveld. It cannot reproduce and does not require food, relying instead on Wyvern Milk for energy. In addition to absorbing and discharging energy the way other Guardians do, Guardian Arkveld can also absorb elemental energy through the chainblades on its wings and use it for sustenance.Helpful Hints: Guardian Arkveld use retractable chainblades on their wings to attack. Not only are the blades used to absorb and release energy like other Guardians, but they can also convert the energy to the dragon element and discharge it, which will trigger an explosion of the same element if it comes into contact with Wylkrystals. The crystals formed by their attacks will explode from elemental interference, making Slinger ammo effective.Guardian Arkveld closely resembles its original variant, but is slightly more pale in coloration, along with having the signature glowing purple veins of the Guardians distributed along its body, most prominently its head and chains.
Similar to the other Guardians, Guardian Arkveld is unable to reproduce and has no need to predate, feeding exclusively on Wyvern Milk. However, due to retaining parts of the unique physiology and energy absorption abilities of the Arkveld species, it is capable of additionally absorbing elemental energy for sustenance.[3] This notably allowed it to regain parts of its original physiology and instincts by absorbing energy from other monsters, such as its predatory drive and reproductive capabilities. However, it appears still unable to properly digest solid food.
Guardian Arkveld.behavior:
Originally the only one of its kind created to serve Wyveria, Guardian Arkveld managed to reawaken and break free after being put into stasis, escaping the Ruins of Wyveria and starting to hunt other monsters. By aggressively targeting and draining the largest sources of energy, it was able to partially regain its nature as a Flying Wyvern, such as its drive to predate and ability to lay eggs. However, it was unable to control its intake of Wyvern Milk after learning feeding behavior, upon which the excess energy intake from feeding caused it to descend into a berserk frenzy where it slaughtered and attempted to devour every monster in its vicinity, despite seemingly being unable to ingest the food. The Avis Unit was forced to put it down to prevent it from decimating the ecosystem.
It is unknown how Guardian Arkveld behaved prior to its reawakening.
Guardian Arkveld.useful_information: Hunters Notes: An artificial species created by an ancient civilization and imbued with the power of a monster called Arkveld. It cannot reproduce and does not require food, relying instead on Wyvern Milk for energy. In addition to absorbing and discharging energy the way other Guardians do, Guardian Arkveld can also absorb elemental energy through the chainblades on its wings and use it for sustenance. Guardian Arkveld use retractable chainblades on their wings to attack. Not only are the blades used to absorb and release energy like other Guardians, but they can also convert the energy to the dragon element and discharge it, which will trigger an explosion of the same element if it comes into contact with Wylkrystals. The crystals formed by their attacks will explode from elemental interference, making Slinger ammo effective.

Guardian Doshaguma.hunter_notes:
An artificial monster species created by an ancient civilization and imbued with Doshaguma's power. Guardian Doshaguma cannot reproduce and do not require food, relying instead on Wyvern Milk for energy. While anything but agile, they're tough enough to charge right through attacks without flinching, making them extremely dangerous.Helpful Hints: Most Guardian Doshaguma attacks are big forelimb swings. While not agile, the attacks that carry Guardian energy will cause wide explosions. Watch out for the acid in their saliva, which temporarily lowers defense. By dealing with their forearm attacks properly, you can expose a weak point worth exploiting. The crystals formed by their attacks will explode from elemental interference, making Slinger ammo effective.Much like its base counterpart, Guardian Doshaguma primarily attack both with their claws and by biting. Additionally, their drool is corrosive and can be flung at the hunter, as well as causing their bite attacks to inflict Defense Down.
Certain attacks performed with Guardian Doshaguma's arms will cause bursts of Wylk to occur, signalled by their arms glowing white beforehand. When these attacks are performed on pools of Wylk, they will leave behind a Wylkrystal. Hitting a Wylkrystal with any form of elemental attack will cause it to explode, dealing damage corresponding to that element.
Like all Guardians, Guardian Doshaguma are capable of regenerating any wounds inflicted upon them. However, destroying enough wounds will cause the monster to Topple and prevent them channeling Wylk into their attacks. Guardian Doshaguma will re-enter their empowered state upon absorbing enough Wylk from the ground.
After performing a wylk-based attack with their forelegs, they will become a weak point for Focus Strikes.
Guardian Doshaguma.sightings: Guardian Doshaguma is found exclusively in the Ruins of Wyveria.

Guardian Ebony Odogaron.hunter_notes: An artificial monster species created by an ancient civilization and imbued with Ebony Odogaron's power. Guardian Ebony Odogaron cannot reproduce and do not require food, relying instead on Wyvern Milk for energy. They will attempt to corner targets with flurries of attacks from their well-developed claws and tails.Helpful Hints: Guardian Ebony Odogaron are most notable for their honed claws that induce bleeding and dexterous tails, both of which carry Guardian energy that can trigger explosions. If their dragon-element attacks connect with Wylkrystals, it will cause an explosion of the same element. However, since the crystals are triggered through elemental interference Slinger ammo can also be used effectively.

Guardian Fulgur Anjanath.hunter_notes: An artificial monster species created by an ancient civilization and imbued with Fulgur Anjanath's power. Guardian Fulgur Anjanath cannot reproduce and do not require food, relying instead on Wyvern Milk for energy. Not only can the lightning charged in their bodies be released as an attack, they can also use it to empower themselves and perform vicious biting attacks.Helpful Hints: A hunter must watch out for a Guardian Fulgur Anjanath's sparks and teeth. While their lightning attacks alone are a threat, their maws infused with Guardian energy will cause wide-range explosions. Try to topple one by aggressively targeting its legs. The crystals that form from their attacks will explode through elemental interference, so Slinger ammo can also be effective.

Guardian Rathalos.hunter_notes:
An artificial monster species created by an ancient civilization and imbued with Rathalos's power. Guardian Rathalos cannot reproduce and do not require food, relying instead on Wyvern Milk for energy. Just like the original Rathalos, they are superior fliers and will attack more violently with their claws while airborne.Helpful Hints: The unique Guardian energy from Guardian Rathalos's claw attacks is explosive and dangerous. This energy will cause wyvern milk on the ground to crystalize, and if these crystals are hit by the monster's fire attacks it will cause an explosion of the same element. Given that they are triggered by elemental interference, Slinger ammo could be used effectively against them.Much like its base counterpart, Guardian Rathalos primarily attacks with their poisonous talons and their flaming breath, though they are more adept at attacking with their talons from the ground.
Most attacks performed with Guardian Rathalos's talons will cause bursts of Wylk to occur, signalled by their legs glowing white beforehand. When these attacks are performed on pools of Wylk, they will leave behind a Wylkrystal. Hitting a Wylkrystal with any form of elemental attack will cause it to explode, dealing damage corresponding to that element. However, Guardian Rathalos' fire attacks can also cause the Wylkrystals to explode.
Like all Guardians, Guardian Rathalos are capable of regenerating any wounds inflicted upon them. However, destroying enough wounds will cause the monster to Topple and prevent them channeling Wylk into their attacks. Guardian Rathalos will re-enter their empowered state upon absorbing enough Wylk from the ground.
Guardian Rathalos.sightings: Guardian Rathalos is found exclusively in the Ruins of Wyveria.

Zoh Shia.hunter_notes:
A massive Guardian that has been feeding off the Dragontorch's energy. Its body is encased in crystallized Wyvern Milk, allowing it to regenerate. Zoh Shia, like other Guardians, excels at energy attacks and can produce repeated explosions to crystallize the whole area. Beneath its white Guardian coat, its body pulses with dark recollection - which you may see, should it reveal its full power from the days of yore.Helpful Hints: Zoh Shia share the same basic traits of other Guardians. The crystals on their wings and head can be stripped away to deplete their energy stores. The white crystals on their bodies will grow back weaker, making them easier to destroy a second time. The crystals they create will detonate if they take elemental damage, but a talented hunter can use elemental Slinger ammo and smart maneuvering to make good use of them.Zoh Shia has three distinct phases that it progresses through as it loses health. Unlike all other Constructs, Zoh Shia is immune to traps, and also cannot be affected by Flashes.
In the first phase, its body will be completely covered by armor that makes it more resilient and renders it immune to Wounding, which can be broken to deal more damage to the monster. Any broken armor parts will regenerate after some time has passed, although they will be significantly easier to break after regrowing. Zoh Shia primarily uses physical blows from its wingarms, and infuses the ground with energy explosions that create Wylkrystals, which can be detonated with its elemental attacks. Hunters can detonate these Wylkrystals with elemental Slinger ammo, such as the Thundercryst and Wyrmsbane lying around the map, dealing damage to Zoh Shia if it is close enough. The explosion of the Wylkcrystals can also cause a chain reaction with other nearby Wylkcrystals, dealing even more damage to the monster and knocking it down if enough hit it at once. Dealing enough damage will cause it to reveal its head, which will use fireball and fire breath attacks while exposed. The head can still grow back its armor, but will be forced to shed it when breathing fire.
Hanging above the area are 2 Shrine Fragments, which can be dropped onto Zoh Shia using the hook slinger and knock the monster down.
In the second phase, Zoh Shia will fly into the air before losing the armor on its wings. After creating a large number of massive Wylkrystals, it ignites the ceiling, causing fireballs to rain down across the area and periodically fall for the rest of the fight. It then breathes a torrent of fire that drastically intensifies after a short delay and ignites all the Wylkrystals to expand its reach. Hunters can detonate the Wylkrystals early with elemental Slinger ammo to prevent Zoh Shia from using them to spread its flames. In this phase, Zoh Shia is still able to use Wylk attacks, but liberally uses a wider array of fire attacks, including jets of flame that leap along the ground. It is also able to use a smaller-scale version of its phase transition nova later in the phase, but this one can additionally be avoided by moving behind Zoh Shia.
In the third phase, Zoh Shia completely sheds its armor and loses the ability to grow it back, showing its true form and gaining the ability to use red lightning attacks. It will begin the phase by creating a large number of Wylkrystals and summoning a barrage of lightning from above, detonating the crystals. It continues to use all attacks from the previous phases in combination with its new lightning attacks, while also reusing its phase transition attack when it is at low health.
After its double wingarm slam while its arms are exposed, Zoh Shia's hands become weak points for Focus Strikes.
Zoh Shia.sightings: Zoh Shia cannot be fought in its Low Rank form after the story except by answering other players' SOS flares. In High Rank, Zoh Shia is fought in the ★8 Assignment Germination, which is unlocked upon reaching HR 50. After this is completed, it can randomly appear in the Dragontorch Shrine during Wyvern's Wakening, becoming available for Quest creation in a similar manner to Jin Dahaad.
Zoh Shia.characteristics:
Hunters Notes: A massive Guardian that has been feeding off the Dragontorch's energy. Its body is encased in crystallized Wyvern Milk, allowing it to regenerate. Zoh Shia, like other Guardians, excels at energy attacks and can produce repeated explosions to crystallize the whole area. Beneath its white Guardian coat, its body pulses with dark recollection - which you may see, should it reveal its full power from the days of yore.Helpful Hints: Zoh Shia share the same basic traits of other Guardians. The crystals on their wings and head can be stripped away to deplete their energy stores. The white crystals on their bodies will grow back weaker, making them easier to destroy a second time. The crystals they create will detonate if they take elemental damage, but a talented hunter can use elemental Slinger ammo and smart maneuvering to make good use of them.Zoh Shia is an enormous monster with traits similar to that of Elder Dragons. It has a slender, quadrupedal frame, with two massive wingarms growing from its back. Its entire body is covered in a coiled, layered shell of crystallized Wyvern Milk, with numerous crystal protrusions resembling flower petals or feathers sprouting from all over, most prominently on its wingarms. Its head is ovoid in shape and somewhat beak-like, lacks eyes, and boasts a frill of wedge-like spikes lining it, with two more prominent spikes at the top in the place of horns. Its claws are elongated by uniform Wylk growths and are distinctly stake-like,[3] while its tail is long and thin, resembling a whip. Its flesh beneath the armor is an unnatural purple, visible when it opens its almost toothless mouth, or in the palms of its wingarms. Should its face plate be broken, a single black eye or eye-hole can be seen beneath the surface.
Its crystal Wylk shell not only continuously regenerates from damage, but stores large amounts of energy that Zoh Shia discharges from its wingarms to defend itself, infusing the ground with energy and creating large explosions that crystallize the surroundings into more Wylkrystals. The crystals on the shell have even been observed growing after they have been removed from the monster.[4] In spite of this, the shell is noted to constrict Zoh Shia as much as it protects it.[5]
As Zoh Shia is damaged, it will slowly shed parts of its shell and reveal its true body, a hideously deformed dragon-like monster seemingly made of an amorphous, wax-like black substance; this "Blackember Mass" can reform and transform freely, allowing Zoh Shia to fit into its original shell and regrow it if needed, and constantly pulses in an alien manner.[6] Its head becomes an asymmetrical tangle of large twisted horns that cover its yellow reptilian eyes, with its mouth becoming more toothy and exposing an elongated, serpentine tongue. Its wingarms expand in size and begin growing horn-like protrusions all over them as well, while the glowing purple parts on their undersides begin to glow bright red when the monster is further angered. All of the feathery spikes along its body are also revealed to be more traditional and draconic in appearance, same with its claws. As the monster continues to shed its shell and enrage, the horn-like growths all over its body will continue to grow larger and more malformed.
In its true form, while Zoh Shia retains its Wylk explosions, it also gains the ability to breathe fire from its mouth and emit it from the palms of its wingarms. When the monster is angered enough, it will also begin emitting red lightning, both from its body and summoned from its surroundings.
Hidden within Zoh Shia's body is an elaborate, inorganic gem that seems to have something wriggling within.[7]
As a Guardian, Zoh Shia does not need to eat or reproduce, able to subsist solely on Wyvern Milk. However, due to an unknown mechanism, it is able to reproduce through fragmentation, where not only can Zoh Shia continue to regenerate and come back to life provided enough energy and time, every fragment separated from Zoh Shia has the potential to grow into an entirely new Zoh Shia. These fragments take on a black liquid form contained in flowery cocoons as they grow, but Zoh Shia itself is able to break the cocoons and absorb the liquid within for an unknown purpose.
Zoh Shia.behavior: Little is known about Zoh Shia's original behavior due to the length of time that passed between its awakening and recent rediscovery. It can be presumed to be a destructive monster that wiped out a civilization, although it's unknown if that is due to its natural instincts or pre-programmed ones. Following that, it took up residence in the Dragontorch Shrine and absorbed energy for an unknown reason (speculated to be some kind of metamorphosis), reacting violently when suddenly reawakened.

Zoh Shia, like other Guardians, excels at energy attacks and can produce repeated explosions to crystallize the whole area. Beneath its white Guardian coat, its body pulses with dark recollection - which you may see, should it reveal its full power from the days of yore. Zoh Shia share the same basic traits of other Guardians. The crystals on their wings and head can be stripped away to deplete their energy stores. The crystals they create will detonate if they take elemental damage, but a talented hunter can use elemental Slinger ammo and smart maneuvering to make good use of them.
