Gore Magala.hunter_notes:
Monsters that drape themselves in their great wings, like a black overcoat. They have no eye sensory organs, so instead they use a scattering of fine scales from their wings to locate prey. When their sensory capacity increases, antennae appear on their heads and they unfurl their wings, entering the aggressive Frenzy State. Their black scales can Frenzy other creatures as well, making them fearsome adversaries.
Helpful Hints: Gore Magala will use its wings to attack anything it detects with its sensory scales without abandon. If a hunter contracts the Frenzy, their natural healing will decrease and any damage taken will increase, but an experienced hunter knows to keep attacking to raise their metabolism before the virus takes to avoid negative effects. Target the head to put a stop to Gore Magala’s Frenzy.At first, Gore Magala primarily attacks by biting and by utilising frenzy-based projectiles, either shots along the ground or sweeping explosions. While their target is infected with their Frenzy virus, they begin to utilise attacks with their wing-arms.
During the fight, Gore Magala will gradually build up frenzy, signalled by their wings glowing purple. This process is quickened while their target is infected. Eventually, Gore Magala will perform a special roar and enter their Frenzy State: extending their antennae, darkening the Area and preventing them from leaving the area they are currently in. In this state, Gore attacks primarily using their wing-arms, as well as using frenzy-based explosions. Gore Magala is permenantly enraged while in the Frenzy State and will cause anyone fully infected with the Frenzy virus to take passive damage overtime. Dealing enough damage to them, followed by a blow to the head, will cause them to exit this state and topple them.
Due to their eyes not being fully developed, Gore Magala are immune to Flash Bombs.
Gore Magala.sightings: Gore Magala was exclusively found in the Iceshard Cliffs, though Tempered individuals could be found in the Ruins of Wyveria after Title Update 1.
Gore Magala.characteristics:
Hunters Notes: Monsters that drape themselves in their great wings, like a black overcoat. They have no eye sensory organs, so instead they use a scattering of fine scales from their wings to locate prey. When their sensory capacity increases, antennae appear on their heads and they unfurl their wings, entering the aggressive Frenzy State. Their black scales can Frenzy other creatures as well, making them fearsome adversaries.
Helpful Hints: Gore Magala will use its wings to attack anything it detects with its sensory scales without abandon. If a hunter contracts the Frenzy, their natural healing will decrease and any damage taken will increase, but an experienced hunter knows to keep attacking to raise their metabolism before the virus takes to avoid negative effects. Target the head to put a stop to Gore Magala’s Frenzy.Gore Magala are extremely unusual creatures. Their body plan resembles that of many Elder Dragons: Six limbs - two of which are modified into large wings -, a long and flexible tail and a horned head. Their bodies are covered entirely with a thick black shell, composed of countless overlapping scales. The massive wing-arms are muscular and sport clawed hands with opposable thumbs. The wing membranes are covered in tiny hairs, which fall off and regenerate continually. This constant stream of particles gives the Gore Magala's wings the appearance of being cloaked in smoke.
The scales of Gore Magala are pitch black, with their dark outer layer being the result of cornification.[4] They are considered to be so deeply black that they are described as devouring light rather than reflecting it.[5] These properties have granted these scales various reputations, as they are considered bringers of ill fortune by some,[6] while others see them as bewitching and alluring.[7] These scales overlap and reinforce eachother into an armor shell, which protects the monster from harm. Gore Magala shells are considered quite resilient, and are said to harm the flesh of weaker attackers on contact.[8] Harder sections of the shell may be called either Carapace or Cortex, the latter of which has been rumored to induce insanity when worn as part of crafted armor.[9][10]
One of the most crucial characteristics of the Gore Magala is that they are blind. They possess no visible eyes and seem to have no traditional visual sense. They instead rely on an entirely unique sensory mechanism centralized around its wings. The wing membranes of Gore Magala produce innumerable tiny hairs, which detach from the membrane surface continually. Once detached, these hair particles saturate the air and spread to nearby surfaces. Gore Magala posses a pair of horns that usually remain folded backwards. These structures - sometimes also called Feelers[11] or Sensors[12] - have the peculiar ability to sense the presence of anything that is covered in the Gore Magala's scales.[13] By spreading this black dander, Gore Magala can therefore enhance their ability to sense their surroundings, making up for their seeming blindness.[14] The sensory acuity of the Gore Magala increases proportionally to the amount of dander that they have been able to expel.[15]
The dander of Gore Magala also serves another purpose however. These tiny particles are the primary vectors that spread the Frenzy Virus (狂竜ウイルス, "mad dragon virus"), a mysterious condition that causes affected monsters to become violent and aggressive. It is called a "Virus" due to its ability to spread from one victim to the next, resembling a viral disease.[13] The disease takes effect when the dander is inhaled, but open wounds can also accelerate infection.[16] The presence on the Frenzy Virus also affects the bodies of Gore Magala. Accumulated clumps of the virus can crystalize into Frenzy Shards, which the Hunter's Guild treats as highly dangerous items that must be turned in.[17] Some of the scales on Gore Magala also absorb the Frenzy Virus over time, becoming empowered enough to earn a new name - Defiled Scales.[18] One scale on the monster's body can be pushed even further beyond, imbued with unbelievable power and called Gore Magala Mantle by the Guild.[19]
The muscular wing arms of Gore Magala are well-developed and covered in highly resistant plating. Some of these armor plates are considered quite valuable, named Gore Magala Plates by the Guild.[20] The claws of the wing arms are razor sharp and can cut through living tissue with ease.[21] These claws are also capable of directly causing Frenzy Virus infection in those they slash.[22] It has long since been rumored among artisans that even after these claws have been removed from Gore Magala, they can still cause various afflictions in those that touch them.[23] Curiously, this fear of infection among craftsmen predates the official discovery of the Frenzy Virus.[16]
Gore Magala wings appear to be constantly writhing due to the endless stream of dander flowing off from them. Fragments of the membrane that have been torn off continue to move and writhe even after they have been separated from the body.[24] Due to their role in spreading the Frenzy Virus, it is said that the mere shadow of these wings can cause insanity in those it covers[25] and the full shape of the creature's wings is sometimes called a Gore Magala Eclipse.[26]
Gore Magala's Horns usually remain hidden by being folded into the head, as the creature has adapted to protecting its valuable sensory organs from damage. When the dander saturation in the area around the Gore Magala reaches its apex however, the horns will spring outwards and reveal themselves to take in as much sensory data as possible.[27] When extended, the tips of the horns will glow in a foreboding purple, as they are absolutely doused in Frenzy Virus.[28] Due to the high risk of infection, these horns were at one point considered "Forbidden Spoils" by the Guild.[29]
Gore Magala have flexible and whip-like tails that can be used as devastating weapons. Their high destructive power comes from the many reverse scales that grow on them,[30] which allow tail swipes to shred prey apart violently.[31]
Various mysterious things grow within the bodies of Gore Magala. Hunter's sometimes retrieve a growth called a Nyctgem from them, which is said to imprison and destroy light itself.[32]
Gore Magala.behavior: Very little is known about Gore Magala behavior. It can often be observed twitching and convulsing, as if it is writhing in pain. The intensity of this behavior has been suggested to be an indicator of its imminent transition into adulthood. It generally seems to roam the lands spreading its Frenzy Virus far and wide. As the amount of frenzy particles increases, the underside of the wings of Gore Magala begin to glow in various colors, transition from blue to purple. Past a certain point, the creature alights with frenzy, extends its horns and wails loudly, entering a condition called the Frenzied State. This ability enhances the monster's abilities temporarily, but wears off if the horns are damaged enough. It has been theorized that this behavior results from Gore Magala temporarily giving in to the Frenzy Virus. Due to these behaviors, Gore Magala appear in ancient legends as Demons of Disease and Death.[16]
Gore Magala.useful_information: Gore Magala will use its wings to attack anything it detects with its sensory scales without abandon. If a hunter contracts the Frenzy, their natural healing will decrease and any damage taken will increase, but an experienced hunter knows to keep attacking to raise their metabolism before the virus takes to avoid negative effects. Target the head to put a stop to Gore Magala’s Frenzy.

Alatreon.hunter_notes:
Alatreon is capable of utilizing Fire, Water, Thunder and Ice elemental attacks, along with physical attacks imbued with Dragon element. Alatreon's water attacks leave behind pools of water than can be ignited with fire attacks, causing damage over time to hunters standing on them. Alatreon's ice attacks leave behind ice shards that explode when struck by thunder.
Alatreon has three "active" states that determine its elemental weaknesses and elemental usage. In its orange Fire Active state, it is weak to Ice and Water, resistant to all other elements, and can utilize Fire. In the blue Ice Active state, it is instead weak to Fire and Thunder, and can utilize Ice. In the purple Dragon Active state, it can use all its elements, becomes moderately vulnerable to all elements, and becomes particularly vulnerable to Dragon. Alatreon only utilizes thunder while grounded and water while flying.
After some time in each Element Active mode, Alatreon will proceed to fly in the air. In Fire/Dragon Active mode, Alatreon will launch a fireball to propel itself off the ground, while in Ice/Dragon Active mode, Alatreon breathes ice into the sky, creating icicles that can drop down from above, similar to Velkhana. Unless the hunter uses a flinch shot mid-air while Alatreon is not enraged, it will only fly back down to the ground after enough time passes, either by breathing fire onto the ground in Fire/Dragon Active mode or a Dragon divebomb in all Active modes.
Depending on the specific quest, Alatreon will begin combat in a different elemental mode. It starts in Ice Active mode in the Event Quest Dawn of the Death Star, which cycles between itself and The Evening Star. Alatreon starts in Fire Active in every other quest.
After enough time passes in Fire/Ice Active, Alatreon will transition to Dragon Active by creating a large Dragon element explosion. Eventually in this state, Alatreon will ready a powerful attack called Escaton Judgement, travelling to the centre of the area and build up power, before unleashing an area-spanning shockwave dealing continuous damage, before switching to the opposite of the Active state it was using before Dragon Active. Alatreon is not interruptable during Escaton Judgement. At its full power, Escaton Judgement will result in the near guaranteed cart to all hunters. 
However, in any active state, dealing enough elemental damage to them will cause them to topple and temporarily dispels their active element while it's downed. Escaton Judgement weakens each time Alatreon suffers an elemental knockdown, which resets after each one; at least one knockdown per cycle is required to survive, while subsequent knockdowns reduce its damage further.
During Escaton Judgement's detonation, the Hunter cannot travel down to the 4th layer from the camp.
Alatreon's horns can only be broken in the Dragon Active state, with breaking a horn neutralizing its ability to switch to the opposite element after Escaton Judgement (eg. if it started in Fire Active, it will now transition back to Fire Active after Escaton Judgement instead of changing to Ice Active). Only one horn can be broken each time it enters Dragon Active.
In Dawn's Triumph, Alatreon has significantly reduced health, but cannot be slain before performing at least one Escaton Judgement.
Alatreon.sightings: Alatreon is fought exclusively in the Secluded Valley. This area has only 3 seperate collidable walls, and are the only ones where Alatreon can be flinch shot to and pull off a wallbang. As the fight takes place in the deepest layer, Farcasters cannot be used at all times. Alatreon cannot be flinched by the red slinger ammo that it drops, but it can be flinched by the Crystalburst found near the camp of the Secluded Valley.
Alatreon.characteristics: Known as a symbol of destruction, people fear even uttering its name. It's rumored to control all of the elements, but most, if not all, records of its existence have been burned.
Alatreon.useful_information: Useful Information: You can mitigate the damage Alatreon's powerful shockwave does by attacking it with an effective element. You can also use healing items during the shockwave, so get your Dust of Life, etc., ready.

Amatsu.hunter_notes:
Characteristics: Elder dragons that can manipulate the weather and are able to conjure up unrelenting gales. Amatsu glide through the air on currents they create using their wing membrane, making it look as if they're dancing in the sky. The storms they summon are extremely destructive and can lay entire cities to waste, thus they are known as the "Looming Calamity." When enraged, their storms become even more violent, enveloping the area with unrelenting lighting strikes. When Amatsu start drawing in the storms around them, get ready for them to unleash a tornado attack. The only way to avoid taking damage is to use a Great Wirebug to escape into the air and to remain suspended until the storm has calmed. Ballistae are scattered around the field, but beware the Silkbinder Shots will be deflected when Amatsu are surrounded by their wind barrier.
Threat Level: ★★★★★★★★★★Amatsu is permanently floating for the entire fight unless knocked down. They intially use physical attacks primarily with their tail and by shooting various blasts or beams of water from its mouth. Amatsu is also capable of summoning tornadoes, either as moving hazards, horizontal wind tunnels or by attempting to suck the hunter in before summoning a tornado where they once were. This attack specifically can be canceled by flinching Amatsu or using the binder on it during the charge-up time. The Silkbinder Shots from the Ballistae are able to temporarily restrain Amatsu while cancelling its attack, but the wind barrier around it will deflect the binder unless the monster is currently in the middle of an attack.
After losing enough health, Amatsu will enter Phase 2 and the storm in the area will intensify. From this point on, Amatsu is capable of utilising thunder-based attacks, either by summoning lightning or creating electric buzzsaws out of wind.
Amatsu will perform several semi-scripted events in order as it loses health:
Amatsu.sightings: Amatsu is only found in the Infernal Springs. In quests to slay Amatsu, the layout of the map will be slightly altered, with several of the large rocks removed and the addition of two Cannons and Ballistae. Several Great Wirebugs will be present around the arena, which can be used to avoid its attacks.

Behemoth.characteristics: A powerful beast from another world. Its large horns and muscular frame defy nature. Unique strategies are required to battle it.
Behemoth.useful_information: Useful Information: Cannot be fought alone; a combination of a healer, attacker, and instigator are required. When Ecliptic Meteor is summoned, take cover behind a fallen Comet or face your fate.

Chameleos.hunter_notes:
Characteristics: Precious few sightings of this elder dragon have been recorded, leading to claims it can vanish into its environment like a chameleon-hence its name. Witnesses report that, when enraged, it can spew a fog-like breath, which seems to come out of nowhere, and enhance its strength by licking the pollen from Petalaces. Chameleos have a meddlesome tendency to vanish suddenly, but by watching their attacks just before they do, you can somewhat predict where they'll reappear. Furthermore, there are eye-witness reports of a Chameleos not being able to vanish after its horn on the top of its nose had been broken.
Threat Level: ★★★★★★★★Chameleos’ main weapon is their long, extendable tongue which, if it hits a hunter, will steal a Spiribird buff they have gained. This causes the effect to appear around Chameleos’ mouth and cause them to gain the effect of the buff. Damaging Chameleos enough will cause them to drop the buff, otherwise they will swallow it causing the buff to be permanently lost. Chameleos are also capable of spewing out noxious poison, either as single blobs, continuous streams or as a ring along the ground that requires use of wirebugs to avoid. Chameleos can also use their poison attacks as counters after being flinched.
Chameleos are also capable of turning partially invisible during certain attacks as well as fully invisible to reposition. If they are damage enough while invisible, they will be toppled. Breaking their horns will prevent them from turning fully invisible.
Chameleos.sightings: Chameleos is found in the Shrine Ruins, Flooded Forest, the Citadel and Jungle.
Chameleos.characteristics:

Risen Chameleos.hunter_notes: After inflicting a sufficient amount of damage to a Risen elder dragon, they'll enter into a Risen state. In this state, their attacks are much more powerful. With Risen Chameleos, they'll create a huge mass of poison and then slam it with their tail to produce a massive toxic explosion. Stay on the offensive to prevent them from entering this state or to knock them out of it.
Risen Chameleos.characteristics: Risen Chameleos are elder dragons that have found a way to overcome their affliction. By suppressing the Qurio virus, they have gained great strength and new abilities. They now boast superior poison and physicality, sending you off into a toxic nightmare if you lose sight of them. When their anger reaches its peak, they'll enter into their Risen state and their body will begin to glow.After inflicting a sufficient amount of damage to a Risen elder dragon, they'll enter into a Risen state. In this state, their attacks are much more powerful. With Risen Chameleos, they'll create a huge mass of poison and then slam it with their tail to produce a massive toxic explosion. Stay on the offensive to prevent them from entering this state or to knock them out of it.

Dalamadur.hunter_notes: A huge elder dragon, massive beyond human comprehension. The only mention of its existence is found in fairy tales, which claim it can warp the very surface of the world and level mountains with a single twitch.Threat Level: ★★★★★★
Dalamadur.characteristics: A huge elder dragon, massive beyond human comprehension. The only mention of its existence is found in fairy tales, which claim it can warp the very surface of the world and level mountains with a single twitch.Threat Level: ★★★★★★

Shah Dalamadur.hunter_notes: A Dalamadur subspecies easily identified by the red spines lining its back. Though they were once thought to exist only in legend, multiple sightings in the past few years have led many to fear Shah Dalamadur as an omen of grave things to come.Threat Level: ★★★★★★
Shah Dalamadur.characteristics: A Dalamadur subspecies easily identified by the red spines lining its back. Though they were once thought to exist only in legend, multiple sightings in the past few years have led many to fear Shah Dalamadur as an omen of grave things to come.Threat Level: ★★★★★★

Fatalis.hunter_notes:
Fatalis has two distinct stances: one where it stands upright on its hind legs, and one where it lays on all fours. Depending on which stance it's in, the moves Fatalis can use will differ. Using a Flinch Shot on it while it's standing will deal a small amount of damage and force it on all fours; it can only be slammed into a wall while already on all fours, which deals heavy damage to its head, but immediately enrages it.
Fatalis will be guaranteed to be knocked down after dealing enough damage with the siege emplacements around the map, or after breaking its head; however, it will prioritize attacking hunters using the siege weapons. It will flinch for every second Dragon Pod that hits it, or when its head takes enough damage. Fatalis can be forced on all fours by damaging its chest enough, although this can also crush unwary hunters.
Fatalis' phase transitions are heralded by the dragon flying off the map and bathing the arena in a torrent of flame that deals constant tick damage before intensifying after a few seconds, upon which any players still inside will be instantly wiped out. When transitioning to the second phase (at roughly 76% HP), hunters will be directed to hide behind a piece of metal debris that shields them from the blast. In the transition to the third phase (at roughly 50% HP), hunters must instead run to the castle gate and close it before the full brunt of the flames hits them.
In the second phase, Fatalis gains several new attacks and becomes able to fly for periods of time, breathing fire at hunters. The arena is slightly expanded, the cannons from the first phase are destroyed if not already, and the Roaming Ballista becomes available.
In the third phase, Fatalis will enter an enhanced state where its chest glows with incandescent light and its flames become bright whitish-blue, which dramatically enhances their damage to the point of likely causing an instant faint on any hit. The enhanced mode will weaken depending on how many times Fatalis' head has been broken; a single break weakens the flames to a purplish-orange, while two breaks reduces the flame to roughly the level it was in the previous phases. No matter how many times its head has been broken, all of Fatalis' fire attacks now leave behind pools of flame that deal persistent heat damage.
Fatalis will also begin using several new fire breath attacks, as well as a pin that has it melt the player to its chest and slowly burn them before flinging them off after a time; another player can flinch Fatalis with Dragon Pods to make it drop its victim. It will also use a powerful flame torrent attack akin to its phase transitions at fixed health thresholds (roughly 38%, 20%, and 5% HP), flying to a far side of the arena and unleashing a cone of flame that becomes invariably lethal after a few seconds, albeit now avoidable by getting behind Fatalis. If Fatalis' head has been broken twice, it is possible to survive the attack.
Fatalis is immune to  Stun and KO effects (including Flash Pods), and is heavily resistant to  Sleep and  Paralysis, making it likely to only trigger them once.
Fatalis.sightings: Fatalis is only found in Castle Schrade, and is a three phase fight with distinct behavior in each phase. In all phases, it uses a variety of physical attacks from all parts of its body, as well as extremely powerful fire breath attacks that often leave behind lingering patches that explode after a delay.
Fatalis.characteristics:
A legendary black dragon known only as Fatalis. Rumored to have destroyed a kingdom in a single night, and has taken its castle for a roost.Fatalis sports a slender, near serpentine body covered in black scales. Its front and hind limbs are well-developed, allowing the dragon to display both a bipedal and quadruped gait, depending on the situation. The hind legs have been theorized to have structural similarities to those of Wyverians.[5]
Its neck is disproportionately long, granting the creature great flexibility in how it angles its head, which is crowned by two pairs of back-facing horns. The front pair is notably larger and more developed. Fatalis' horns are said to give off a dark glow with a disturbing yet attractive property.[6]
The dragon also possesses large wings composed of wing arms (which constitute a third pair of limbs) and wing membranes that stretch over those arms. The wings are hard as steel and yet still flexible and malleable.[7] Despite the wing membranes being wrinkled and even slightly torn, they seem to nonetheless function flawlessly for flight.[8]
Like the neck, the tail is also quite long and flexible. A row of spikes of variable size runs down Fatalis' spine, starting at the back of the neck and continuing all the way down to the tip of the tail.
The black scales of Fatalis have rings on them, indicating their immense age.[9] These scales together form a shell - sometimes also called a cortex - that displays an intricate layer structure, able to deflect attacks and grant the dragon incredible defense.[10] One especially noteworthy part of Fatalis' shell is the section on its chest: The shell plate here is called a Pectus, and is further hardened by having various metals - including the armor and weapons of fallen foes - melted onto it.[11]
A unique anatomical feature of this dragon is its ability to generate an extremely powerful kind of flame called "Kalpa Fire".[12] This powerful fire ability allows Fatalis to inhale vast amounts of air, which is then heated by the dragon's infernal body temperature. Eventually, this creates an explosive flame, which can be released with tremendous force. Unleashed Kalpa Fire can destroy nearly any fortification and is extremely dangerous.[13] Over the course of a battle, the intensity of the Kalpa Fire can increase dramatically, growing so hot that it begins to visibly glow through the dragon's chest. At its most powerful, this devastating flame turns blue. Fatalis' Kalpa Fire is however noted to weaken if the dragon's horns are injured or broken.[14] It has overall been theorized that the dragon's power is in fact contained within its horns.[15]
Fatalis' eyes are a striking orange color, and are said to give off an ominous aura.[16] They have been described as crystalline in nature, and are considered one of the Three Great Treasures.[17]
Fatalis has been noted to not possess the characteristic Elder Dragon Blood - i.e. blood saturated with dragon-energy - which differentiates it from many other Elder Dragons.[14]
Fatalis.behavior:
Very little is known about Fatalis' behavior. It appears to hibernate in or near Castle Schrade for long periods at a time.[8] Its presence seems to intimidate other monsters, as the movements of at least one Lao-Shan Lung were interpreted to be due to it fleeing from Fatalis. Conversely, there has never been any indication that Fatalis actually preys on other monsters.[8]
In battle, Fatalis appears to be somewhat cunning. It has been noted to only use its fire attacks sparingly at first, gradually unleashing them more frequently as the fight goes on. Once an enemy has proven themselves to be a real threat, Fatalis begins using its fire quite liberally while also continually increasing its potency.[13] It also has a habit of sticking out its long tongue and licking its lips.
Its oddest behavior is its tendency to melt the weapons and armor of fallen enemies onto its chest. Within the Guild, some believe this to be intentional, while others argue that it simply happens as a result of the dragon dragging its body across the ground, which is often littered with the remains of its victims.[14]
Fatalis.useful_information: Useful Information: As long as its horns are intact, overcoming its final form's breath attack may be impossible. Cannons and ballistae can topple it. Flinch shots when its flying or standing will lower its head.

Gaismagorm.hunter_notes:
Characteristics: A gargantuan monster living in the darkest depths since ancient times. Gaismagorm's rock-like forearms boast tenacious strength which allows it to burrow underground. It has a symbiotic relationship with the Qurio, and feeds on their life force for energy. Once it has chosen a place to nest, it collapses the surrounding rock bed to create an opening to the surface. The opening forms a massive crater in which it releases the Qurio through. Gaismagorm attacks with the explosive, crystallized Qurio on its carapace. If you break these crystals by attacking, Gaismagorm will get hit by the shards when it starts inhaling debris, taking explosive damage. When Gaismagorm climbs the pit's wall, it's readying a strong attack. Use the ballistae provided to stop it.
Threat Level: ★★★★★★★★★★Gaismagorm’s fight consists of 3 phases. During their first phase, their back is covered in several crystals. Gaismagorm will primarily attack with their large wing-arms, slamming them and sweeping them across the ground. In this phase, these attacks create explosions around them. Sometimes after attacking or receiving damage, Gaismagorm will drop the crystals on their back on the ground. Eventually, Gaismagorm will leap to the centre of the arena before attempting to suck the hunter into a powerful Clap attack. This attack also summons rock debris which the hunter can hide behind to prevent being sucked in. If enough fallen crystals hit Gaismagorm while readying the attack, they will be toppled.
Upon entering Phase 2, Gaismagorm will retreat to the lower reaches of the Yawning Abyss, shedding their crystals in the process. In Phase 2, Gaismagorm is capable of performing weaker suction attacks, as well as firing off blood lasers and meteor showers. Occasionally, Gaismagorm will attempt to scale the walls of the Abyss. During this attack, machine turrets are dropped down, which can be used to shoot at 3 swarms of Qurio on Gaismagorm’s back in an attempt to destroy them. While this is occurring, Gaismagorm can summoning other swarms of Qurio that attempt to home towards the hunter, which can also be destroyed. Destroying 2 of the swarms on Gaismagorm's back will cause them to stumble down the wall, with destroying all 3 causing them to fall off the wall completely and be toppled. If not, Gaismagorm will fire a large blood laser and destroy the machine turrets before leaping off the wall.
In Phase 3, Gaismagorm’s body will light “on fire” while causing the Area to glow red. In this state, their claw slams are capable of summoning trails of explosions and they can perform new attacks: such as jetting forward with one arm and charging will leaving behind clouds of Blast-inflicting dust.
Gaismagorm.sightings: Gaismagorm is fought exclusively in the Yawning Abyss.
Gaismagorm.characteristics:
A gargantuan monster living in the darkest depths since ancient times. Gaismagorm's rock-like forearms boast tenacious strength which allows it to burrow underground. It has a symbiotic relationship with the Qurio, and feeds on their life force for energy. Once it has chosen a place to nest, it collapses the surrounding rock bed to create an opening to the surface. The opening forms a massive crater in which it releases the Qurio through.Characteristics: A gargantuan monster living in the darkest depths since ancient times. Gaismagorm's rock-like forearms boast tenacious strength which allows it to burrow underground. It has a symbiotic relationship with the Qurio, and feeds on their life force for energy. Once it has chosen a place to nest, it collapses the surrounding rock bed to create an opening to the surface. The opening forms a massive crater in which it releases the Qurio through. Gaismagorm attacks with the explosive, crystallized Qurio on its carapace. If you break these crystals by attacking, Gaismagorm will get hit by the shards when it starts inhaling debris, taking explosive damage. When Gaismagorm climbs the pit's wall, it's readying a strong attack. Use the ballistae provided to stop it.
Threat Level: ★★★★★★★★★★Gaismagorm is an incredibly ancient, gargantuan Elder Dragon with a hexapedal gait, somewhat similar to Gogmazios or Shagaru Magala. Its hide is primarily grey with numerous bony ridges and spikes, and its whole body is lined with glowing blue vents, which are usually covered in layers of condensed Qurio energy resembling red crystals. It is flightless, with two enormous clawed arms in place of wings, which are dextrous and strong enough to tunnel through bedrock and throw large objects; their physiology suggests Gaismagorm was once capable of flight in ancient times, but has long since lost its wings to adapt to an underground lifestyle.[3] Its other four limbs are much smaller (with the back two being nearly vestigial), while its tail is large and thick, terminating in a five-fingered claw structure. Its head is stout and angular, with two twisted horns, beady yellow eyes, and a unique jaw structure that splits open to create a five-pointed star shape when it opens its mouth.
When sufficiently enraged, the inside of its mouth starts glowing red, it sheds the layer of crystallized Qurio on its body, and the vents along its body also turn red and extrude feathery red structures. If angered even further, it will draw on more of the Qurio's power and become overloaded with energy, causing its vents to erupt with red flames.
Gaismagorm is the true host of the Qurio, allowing the parasites to feed on its energy and use it as a nest, while it is able to command them to gather nutrition and defend itself. In addition to sustenance, it is able to directly wield their energy by expelling it from the vents in its arms/torso as well as its mouth, usually in the form of explosive red beams or blasts. By consuming more life energy and Qurio, Gaismagorm is able to create a crystalline "armor" to protect itself, which can explode when enough force is applied, or simply output even more energy. However, its body does have limits, and it may become overloaded if it absorbs too much power.
Due to its size, Gaismagorm's body is incredibly strong and durable, with it being able to shrug off multiple exploding Dragonators, falls from the surface to its nest, and blows of similar strength with only a brief interruption. It also boasts powerful lungs that can inhale or exhale massive amounts of air at once, which it uses to draw in or blow away targets, or suck up more Qurio to feed itself.
Gaismagorm.behavior:
Gaismagorm's subterranean lifestyle and recent discovery leaves much of its behavior a mystery, but when it needs to feed, the monster will dig out a large underground nest, then create small pits through which it releases the Qurio to the surface. The parasites drain and consume all the life they can find in the area, followed by Gaismagorm collapsing its nest into a massive sinkhole for the Qurio to return en masse to feed their host. Highly voracious, Gaismagorm can depopulate entire ecosystems to feed itself, moving on to the next after an area has no more nutrition to offer.[4]
Despite its aggressive nature, Gaismagorm can still realize when it is in danger, as it became more passive and hid from Malzeno after suffering major injuries from their battle, only resurfacing after Malzeno was slain.

Jhen Mohran.hunter_notes: Rare ore can be mined from these enormous dragons' backs; thus they are considered symbols of prosperity. They swallow vast amounts of organic material and are always surrounded by scavenging Delex, which sailors use to locate them.Threat: ★★★★★★
Jhen Mohran.characteristics:
Rare ore can be mined from these enormous dragons' backs; thus they are considered symbols of prosperity. They swallow vast amounts of organic material and are always surrounded by scavenging Delex, which sailors use to locate them.Threat: ★★★★★★The Jhen Mohran is a gargantuan, whale-like Elder Dragon adapted to a life spent swimming under the sands. Its massive body is long, near serpentine, with short arms and legs that are usually folded to the body's side. Its tail is thick and wide. Out of its small face, two enormous tusks protrude, each as thick as a ship's mast. The rarely seen chin of the dragon is bulbous and covered in spiked bumps. On its back, the dragon has a blowhole from which it can breathe and expel sand it has ingested while swimming. The mouth and esophagus of the Jhen Mohran splits into two chambers through the use of a filter system: One side takes in food, the other the copious amounts of sand that it swallows, sending it to the blowhole to be expelled later.[3]
While the monster appears to be a dull brown color to onlookers, the underlying scales of the Jhen Mohran are actually a bright blue.[4] The brown coloration is created by sand and other debris sticking to the skin and solidifying.
A noteworthy feature of the Jhen Mohran is its back ridge, which is commonly covered in ore veins and mineral deposits. These deposits develop as the dragon swims through the sand sea, accumulating on its body through the force of its movement.[5] The rarest of these materials is the Earth Dragongem, a mysterious jewel only found on the body of this behemoth.[6]
Jhen Mohran.behavior:
The Jhen Mohran attacks nearby sand-ships by either ramming it with its dual tusks or with its side, requiring an experienced hunter to quickly react by either shooting a ballista binder or utilizing the sand-ship's hunting gong, both of which can temporarily stagger the monster, causing it's attack to miss.
Sometimes it might also shake is body off of excess rocks and minerals, causing large boulders to fall on the battlefield; a simple thing for a beast of such size, but for anyone unfortunate enough to be near it is very deadly.
The Jhen Mohran only rarely surfaces, and it is assumed that it does so to breathe and expel sand through its blowhole. In doing so, it releases enormous quantities of sand into the air with tremendous force, which is believed to actually cause the sandstorms the dragon's emergence is generally associated with.[7] Another omen of its appearance is the increased presence of Delex, which follow around surfacing Jhen Mohran to feed on organic matter that is swept to the surface by the movements of the massive monster.[5]

Hallowed Jhen Mohran.hunter_notes: A subspecies of Jhen Mohran whose appearance has been likened to a crystal shimmering in the darkness. It inspires such awe and wonder that news of a sighting draws a stampede of hunters from across the land.Threat: ★★★★★★
Hallowed Jhen Mohran.characteristics:
A subspecies of Jhen Mohran whose appearance has been likened to a crystal shimmering in the darkness. It inspires such awe and wonder that news of a sighting draws a stampede of hunters from across the land.Threat: ★★★★★★This colossal Elder Dragon shares many physiological features with the common Jhen Mohran. In fact, their skeletal structure is identical, and all differences are found in the organs and on the surface of the body.[2] Superficially, Hallowed Jhen Mohran have a darker skin tone and are covered in purple clusters of quartz, which is accumulated through the dragon's dives into the Great Desert, which sand off impurities and concentrate the mineral upon its body. The purer these crystals are, the more transparent they appear.[3]
As far as internal differences go, Hallowed Jhen Mohran are believed to have larger lungs than the common species.[4]
Hallowed Jhen Mohran.behavior:
The Hallowed Jhen Mohran attacks nearby sand-ships by either ramming it with its dual tusks or with its side, requiring an experienced hunter to quickly react by either shooting a ballista binder or utilizing the sand-ship's hunting gong, both of which can temporarily stagger the monster, causing it's attack to miss.
Sometimes it might also shake is body off of excess rocks and minerals, causing large boulders to fall on the battlefield; a simple thing for a beast of such size, but for anyone unfortunate enough to be near it is very deadly.
Outside of how it comports in combat, very little is known about the life of the Hallowed Jhen Mohran. Based on the enlarged lungs and purified minerals of the dragon, it is believed that this subspecies dives deeper into the sand sea than the common species.[5] Research into the Great Desert has suggested that it was at one point an actual ocean, and that its deepest depths contain condensed layers of ancient coral reefs. These layers are saturated with bacteria specialized in breaking down dead corals, and it has been proposed that these deep desert bacteria form the main diet of the Hallowed Jhen Mohran.[5]
Hallowed Jhen Mohran are even rarer than the common species, and only ever briefly surface from the sandy depths to take a breath exclusively at night. Curiously, they appear to stay on the surface for longer during the full moon.[3]

Kirin.hunter_notes:
Kirin attacks primarily by summoning lightning strikes around themself in various patterns. They can additional summon lightning as bolts along the ground. They can also attack by stabbing forward with their horn.
After a while, Kirin while strike themself with lightning, causing their body to harden considerably, deflecting most weapons. In this state, they are capable of summoning more lightning bolts with their attacks, as well as summoning lightning when charging and hopping. Damaging their head enough will topple them, reverting them to normal. Additional damage can even remove the passive lightning from around Kirin, severely weakening their ability to summon lightning.
Kirin.sightings: Kirin is found primarily in the Coral Highlands. They can also be found in the Coral region of the Guiding Lands from level 5 onwards.
Kirin.characteristics: Kirin are so rarely sighted that little is known of their ecology. It's been said they envelop themselves in pure electricity when they are provoked.
Kirin.useful_information: Useful Information: The lightning a Kirin cloaks itself with has been confirmed to toughen its skin. The key to hunting a Kirin lies in staggering it, using Elderseal weapons, and protecting yourself from and avoiding its lightning attacks.

Kulve Taroth.characteristics: An elder dragon that protects itself with a glittering coat of metal. Its ecology and coat differ with each appearance, thus the need for a thorough investigation.
Kulve Taroth.useful_information: Useful Information: Breaking her head will make it harder for her to escape. Attack her stomach when its covered in gold to soften her up, especially with fire element. Utilize boulders and wall slams.

Kushala Daora.hunter_notes:
Characteristics: It's difficult to even get close to one of these metallic elder dragons, but some claim better odds if the creature is weakened with poison, or has its horn broken, limiting the amount of wind pressure it can muster. Beckons dark dragon wind pressure as the whirlwinds surrounding its body seethe more wildly, and will deflect any non-piercing bow or bowgun shots not aimed at its head. Keep on the attack to quell the wind's power—reports also tell of an opening in its stormy barrier after unleashing a giant wind attack.
Threat Level: ★★★★★★★★Kushala Daora attacks by weaponizing wind, firing it off as balls and beams as well as being able to summon tornadoes that travel across the ground. Kushala are also very adept fliers, being able to easily maneuver and attack from the air. While on cold terrain, some of Kushala’s wind attacks will pick up snow, causing them to Inflict Iceblight. Kushala Daora can also utilize the dragon element by slamming down their claws.
Over the course of the fight, Kushala Daora will summon a barrier of wind around them, creating wind pressure around them. Eventually, they will roar again, upgrading their wind barrier to black Dragon Wind. The strength of their wind barrier is weakened if Kushala is poisoned. Eventually, Kushala Daora will roar again before sucking in hunters towards them and summoning a massive tornado where they once were. Damaging their head enough will weaken their wind barrier and topple him, dissipating it if it is weak enough.
Kushala Daora.sightings: Kushala Daora is found in the Frost Islands, Sandy Plains, the Citadel and Jungle.
Kushala Daora.characteristics:
It's difficult to even get close to one of these metallic elder dragons, but some claim better odds if the creature is weakened with poison, or has its horn broken, limiting the amount of wind pressure it can muster.Characteristics: It's difficult to even get close to one of these metallic elder dragons, but some claim better odds if the creature is weakened with poison, or has its horn broken, limiting the amount of wind pressure it can muster. Beckons dark dragon wind pressure as the whirlwinds surrounding its body seethe more wildly, and will deflect any non-piercing bow or bowgun shots not aimed at its head. Keep on the attack to quell the wind's power—reports also tell of an opening in its stormy barrier after unleashing a giant wind attack.
Threat Level: ★★★★★★★★

Risen Kushala Daora.hunter_notes: After inflicting a sufficient amount of damage to a Risen elder dragon, they'll enter into a Risen state. In this state, their attacks are much more powerful. With Risen Kushala Daora, they'll draw in everything around them and then unleash it as a giant tornado. Stay on the offensive to prevent them from entering this state or to knock them out of it.
Risen Kushala Daora.characteristics: Risen Kushala Daora are elder dragons that have found a way to overcome their affliction. By suppressing the Qurio virus, they have gained great strength and new abilities. They command destructive storms easily cornering their prey with a more varied arsenal of attacks than their regular counterparts. When their anger reaches its peak, they'll enter into their Risen state and their body will begin to glow.After inflicting a sufficient amount of damage to a Risen elder dragon, they'll enter into a Risen state. In this state, their attacks are much more powerful. With Risen Kushala Daora, they'll draw in everything around them and then unleash it as a giant tornado. Stay on the offensive to prevent them from entering this state or to knock them out of it.

Lao-Shan Lung.characteristics:
Threat: ★★★★★★★★The Lao-Shan Lung is a massive Elder Dragon that few monsters rival in sheer size and power. Known by village elders as the "Old Mountain Dragon," this elder dragon is covered in incredibly thick, thorny shells, giving it the appearance of a rocky mountain. The shell of the Lao-Shan Lung is thought to be composed of minerals, volcanic ash and other sediments, melted into the dragon's carapace by its body heat.[3] At birth, the dragon would not possess this shell, suggesting that the Lao-Shan Lung spends many years growing this shell, repeatedly heating and cooling the sediments that make up its hardened carapace.[3] This hypothesis of the formation of Lao-Shan Lung's shell has lead to scholars theorizing that the dragon spends most of its time in dormancy, only awakening when it is disturbed, which would explain why it is never seen when it isn't moving.[4] The colour of the shell may be different depending on the minerals used to form the shell, ranging from reddish brown to grey.[4]
The dragon's skull is adorned with several long, black horns, the longest of which being located at the end of its snout.
While it moves slowly, the Lao-Shan Lung's legs are powerful, devastating towns and villages simply by walking through them.[4] Its claws are so big that even skilled artisans cannot work with the material.[5] The monster is capable of both quadrupedal and bipedal movement.
Lao-Shan Lung.behavior:
The Lao-Shan Lung periodically migrates for unknown reasons. Its migration path often crosses through human settlements, requiring the construction of defensive barricades in order to defend against the dragon.[6] Repelling or slaying a Lao-Shan Lung is no easy feat, as it requires the use of heavy artillery, dragonators and teamwork. As such, fortresses have been built along the known migration paths of Lao-Shan Lung in hopes of redirecting it away from towns and villages.
Despite the devastation it causes, Lao-Shan Lung are docile and are said to almost never attack other creatures.[4] There was a report that a Lao-Shan Lung had appeared when a large mineshaft was built on the side of a mountain, but rather than acting aggressively towards whatever disturbed it, it simply ventured further underground.[3] Even during its crossing through human settlements, as ballista ammo and canons are fired into it, it only attacks the barricades that block its path.

Lunastra.hunter_notes:
Lunastra mainly attack with flaming bites, swiping with her claws or whipping her tail. She can also weaponize fire, either as sweeping flamethrowers or by breathing it to the ground and fanning it with her wings. Lunastra is also capable of flight.
During the fight, Lunastra will walk to specific points in the Area and will begin to charge her aura, countering if successfully interupted. If not, Lunastra will gain a flame aura the 1st time which damages anyone to close, empowering it the second time. With her flame aura, certain attacks will leave behind patches of blue fire on the ground that, if hit by one of her fire attacks, will be set on fire. Getting hit by another fire attack in this state will cause the fire to briefly spread outwards. Puddle Pods can be used to douse these flames.
After a while with her aura at max-intensity, Lunastra will fly into the air and release a powerful heatwave around herself that damages anyone inside of it, followed shortly after by a second heatwave, dissipating her aura afterwards. Damaging her head enough will weaken her aura and topple her, dissipating it if it is weak enough.
While fighting alongside Teostra, the two are capable of combining the effects of their nova's into a powerful Bond Attack.
Lunastra.sightings: Lunastra is found in the Wildspire Waste and the Elder's Recess. While she is in the Elder's Recess, the path to Area 13 will become unblocked. They can also be found in the Desert and Volcanic regions of the Guiding Lands from level 5 onwards.
Lunastra.characteristics: A rare female Elder Dragon that litters the air with hot blue dust. Reports of it traveling with her mate, Teostra, are still unconfirmed.
Lunastra.useful_information: Useful Information: Lunastra's high body temperature and dust saps away health unless you use a Cool Drink. Its dust and blue flame explode when it comes into contact with fire, so use a bomb or Crystalburst.

Malzeno.hunter_notes:
Characteristics: A dragon covered with elegant silver scales. It uses the Qurio to drain the life energy of other living creatures, creeping around at night and attacking its prey from behind. It appears almost regal to start with, but after draining enough energy, it can turn a violent, fresh-blood crimson. This form is known as the "Bloodening" and is widely feared. Certain attacks will cause Bloodblight, causing your life to continuously drain but your attacks to also heal you; keep the pressure on. The Bloodening will occur after a certain amount of time, leading to raging attacks; end it and get a knock down by hitting the red flashing areas on the arms and neck.
Threat Level: ★★★★★★★★Malzeno attacks primarily with their wings and tail, performing quick stabs with both of them. Stabs from their tail are capable of inflict Bloodblight. Malzeno are also capable of utilising various dragon and wind based projectiles, as well as summoning swarms of Qurio to attack.
After a while, Malzeno will rear up before entering the Bloodening. In this state, Malzeno is capable of moving fast enough that they appear to teleport, often performed before an attack. They also gain access to more dragon-based projectiles. After a while, Malzeno will “teleport” into the air before firing a laser around them, followed by them dropping a ball of dragon energy below them that splits into several dragon waves, exiting the Bloodening. Dealing enough damage to the glowing red parts on their body forces Malzeno out of their Bloodening, toppling them.
Malzeno.sightings: Malzeno is found in the Shrine Ruins, Lava Caverns and the Citadel.
Malzeno.characteristics:
A dragon covered with elegant silver scales. It uses the Qurio to drain the life energy of other living creatures, creeping around at night and attacking its prey from behind. It appears almost regal to start with, but after draining enough energy, it can turn a violent, fresh-blood crimson. This form is known as the "Bloodening" and is widely feared.Characteristics: A dragon covered with elegant silver scales. It uses the Qurio to drain the life energy of other living creatures, creeping around at night and attacking its prey from behind. It appears almost regal to start with, but after draining enough energy, it can turn a violent, fresh-blood crimson. This form is known as the "Bloodening" and is widely feared. Certain attacks will cause Bloodblight, causing your life to continuously drain but your attacks to also heal you; keep the pressure on. The Bloodening will occur after a certain amount of time, leading to raging attacks; end it and get a knock down by hitting the red flashing areas on the arms and neck.
Threat Level: ★★★★★★★★Malzeno is a large, slender elder dragon with metallic silver scales, frills on the sides of its head, and red wings resembling tattered webbing. The wing membranes display scarlet patterns, which will be more vibrant if the Malzeno has recently fed on another creature.[3] It has large golden horns and claws, a flexible three pronged tail, and two sharp talons on its wing tips. Its chest is adorned with Qurio, appearing as if it were a gallant robe or cravat. Its head is almost skull-like, with red eyes and a bony fanged jaw. The fangs of a Malzeno are powerful enough to crush shell and bone alike.[4]
After absorbing enough life energy, Malzeno will enter a "Bloodening" state, where its scales turn almost black, its wings and Qurio glow a bright red, and its tail starts radiating Dragon energy.[5]
Malzeno has a special symbiotic relationship with the Qurio. The winged parasites absorb blood and energy from their prey and safely rest on Malzeno's chest and arms, and Malzeno is fed most of that nutrition and can use Qurio projectile clouds in combat. Becauses of its relationship with the Qurio, attacks from Malzeno can infect victims with their virus, manifested as bloodblight.
Outside of the Qurio, Malzeno primarily uses its hooked wings and spiked tail to attack prey with agile physical blows or pins, as well as dragon element breath attacks. It boasts a deceptive amount of physical strength for its lithe frame, being able to tear up the ground, crush armor with its teeth, and lift or throw other large monsters similar in size to itself with its tail. When in the Bloodening state, its attacks become more violent and its speed is dramatically increased, with it notably being able to use bursts of the Qurio's energy to catapult its body short distances with such force that it looks as if it disappears and reappears in another location.
Malzeno.behavior: Due to its need to satisfy the voracious Qurio, Malzeno is a highly aggressive predator that constantly seeks prey for nutrition. It is known to primarily hunt at night, sneaking around and attacking prey from behind to catch them off guard.

Primordial Malzeno.hunter_notes:
Once overwhelmed by the Qurio, it transitions into its "Bloodening" state, which culminates in "Bloodrage" as it is corrupted. Dealing damage is the only way to mitigate this state. When this Malzeno gets low on health, it enters its "Bloodlust" state. Attacks won't calm it down in this state, so extreme caution is advised.At the start of the fight, Primordial primarily attacks with their wings, using them in a similar fashion to both a lance and a shield, as well as slashing with their claw-like tail. After a certain amount of time has passed, Primordial will be swarmed by Qurio, transitioning into the Bloodening. In this state, they are capable of utilising ranged attacks. These include pressurised wing, Dragon element and various projectiles involving their Qurio. Strikes with their tail will now inflict Bloodblight.
Spending enough time in the Bloodening will progress them into their Bloodrage state, where they will begin to “teleport” and utilise their strongest Qurio based attacks. After a while, Primordial will fly into the air and release several waves of Qurio onto the ground below them before teleporting above their target and exploding, collapsing onto the ground afterwards and reverting to the Bloodening. Damaging the glowing red parts on their body enough forces them back to their base state, toppling them.
When on very low health, Primordial will enter a special state known as Bloodlust. Here, Primordial will begin to combo several of their attacks together with little to no down-time, ending their combo with either a grounded or flying Qurio bomb, collapsing onto the ground in pain afterwards. Primordial will remain in this state for the remainder of the fight.
Primordial Malzeno.sightings: Primordial Malzeno is found in the Shrine Ruins, Lava Caverns and the Citadel.
Primordial Malzeno.characteristics:
Malzeno's original form before it was tainted by the Qurio. Ordinarily, it uses its wings and tail with the elegance of a knight, but under the Qurio's influence, it uses underhanded means of cornering its prey, and in it's "Bloodlust" state it wields tremendous power. Because of the explosive energy corrupting its body, it sometimes shows behavior as if its struggling against an overwhelming force.Once overwhelmed by the Qurio, it transitions into its "Bloodening" state, which culminates in "Bloodrage" as it is corrupted. Dealing damage is the only way to mitigate this state. When this Malzeno gets low on health, it enters its "Bloodlust" state. Attacks won't calm it down in this state, so extreme caution is advised.Primordial Malzeno resembles its infected version, but is more physically robust and well-built, being covered in thicker silver-and-gold scales resembling armor plating. The Qurio are completely absent from its body, with the Qurio patches being replaced by thick plated scales, while the frills on its head are now solid and metallic instead of membranous. Its wings are now sturdy and armored rather than gaunt and tattered, resembling large metal shields with blades on their edges, and its wing membranes are now bluish-purple instead of red.
Primordial Malzeno's physical attributes are dramatically stronger than a normal Malzeno, as it has not yet been drained by the parasitic Qurio and is not reliant on their power. It primarily fights using its armored wings as a sword and shield to both slash or stab enemies and protect itself, using them in combination with its lance-like tail and claws for relentless attacks. In spite of the immense physical force carried by its blows, Primordial Malzeno is extremely agile and fights with extreme precision and skill, with its fighting style being compared to that of an elegant knight.
Primordial Malzeno is not the host of the Qurio, and will actively attempt to kill any that approach it. However, if the Qurio manage to catch it off guard and begin forcibly bonding with it, its physical appearance and behavior will change as the infection progresses:
Primordial Malzeno.behavior:
Unlike its voracious infected variant, Primordial Malzeno is known to be more peaceful in nature, to the point where humans of old were able to coexist in its territory without issue, leading to it being revered as a guardian knight of peace before its corruption. However, even in its original state, it is still intensely territorial and will destructively attack any intruders or threats in its turf. Unlike a normal Malzeno which uses underhanded tactics and stealth to ambush prey, Primordial Malzeno is known to battle enemies head-on and overcome them with strength and technique.
Primordial Malzeno are considered a major threat by the Hunter's Guild, and not just on the merits of their own power: As it has been confirmed that these dragons can succumb to the Qurio and turn into devastatingly powerful creatures that actively seek to drain ecosystems of life, the risk of a Primordial Malzeno being overtaken looms over any instance of it emerging, urging hunters to take action before the worst comes to pass.[4]
It demonstrates an unusually high level of intelligence, between its skillful use of its limbs as weapons and being able to seemingly show gratitude towards the Hunter and Fiorayne after they help save it. It is also said to hold a level of enmity towards the Qurio themselves due to the way they attempt to corrupt it and its brethren[1]. However, its behavior still stems from an animalistic urge to protect its territory, and any higher level of intelligence or sentience is unknown. They are believed to have very long lifespans.[5]

Namielle.hunter_notes:
Namielle attacks primarily by shooting water, either as balls or beams, with these attacks leaving behind pools of water on the ground. Performing certain attacks on these pools can cause both damaging waves to travel along them until they reach the edge, or creating currents that pushes the hunter around. Shooting Brightmoss into these pools will dry them out.
Eventually Namielle will shock themself with electricity, allowing them to perform attacks that discharge electricity around them. They also become capable of flight. If a thunder attack comes in contact with a water pool, it will cause the pool to discharge. If Namielle charge themself a 2nd time while also hydrated, they will enter a supercharged state, eventually creating a large pool of slime around them before flying into the air and creating a massive discharge around themself, reverting them to a dehydrated state.
While dehydrated, Namielle's hitzones are soften but they take less elemental damage. Eventually, Namielle will begin pulling water into themself, re-entering their hydrated state. Namielle is capable of charging themself while dehydrated.
Namielle.sightings: Namielle is found primarily in the Coral Highlands. They can also be found in the Coral region of the Guiding Lands from level 5 onwards.
Namielle.characteristics: An elder dragon coated in water and able to freely control lightning. A unique organ allows it to pump electricity into the pools of water it creates, causing massive bursts of steam.
Namielle.useful_information: Useful Information: Emitting water causes its coating to decrease, and it becomes vulnerable when dry. Use brightmoss and other slinger fire to remove any nearby sources of water.

Nergigante.hunter_notes:
Unlike other Elder Dragons, Nergigante possesses no elemental abilities, instead rely on their raw strength, capable of performing attacks with their head, forelimbs, wings and tail. Performing certain attacks with these parts, or these parts taking enough damage, will cause the spikes on them to snap off. Afterwards, the spikes will grow back larger and whiter, causing certain attacks with these parts to fire off spikes around them. Damaging these spikes will cause them to shatter and topple them, returning that part to normal. However, leaving a part with these white spikes for too long will cause the spikes to harden and turn black, causing most weapons to bounce. Eventually, after four of their body parts have hardened, Nergigante will roar before flying into the air and dive-bombing towards their target, shedding their black spikes in the process.
After taking enough damage, Nergigante will perform a special roar and fold their wings out further, allowing them to perform even stronger attacks and enhancing some of their existing ones.
After retreating to their nest in Area 15, Nergigante will dive-bomb into one of the walls, expanding the area in the process. Which wall they dive into is random.
Nergigante.sightings: Nergigante is found exclusively in the Elder's Recess and can only be encountered in High Rank.
Nergigante.characteristics:
A terrible elder dragon that appears when other elders are in the vicinity. Its penchant for destruction is well documented.Nergigante is a muscular elder dragon recognizable by its two bull-like, gigantic white horns on the sides of its head that fade into black at the tips, together with the countless spikes that adorn its whole body. Nergigante has a short yet wide skull with big fangs that are always on display, with a 'crown' of progressively large thorns adorning its head. It has striking yellow eyes with purple markings around them, resembling eyeshadow. It is predominantly a dark-grey color but has a colorful underbelly and wings, transitioning from shades of purple and pink to orange. It has huge spiked forearms packed with muscle, and has opposable thumbs like humans. Its hands and feet are in a naturally curled position when resting, with large beige claws and talons, while its hind legs are smaller and less beefy in comparison; in spite of this, it often stands up on two legs. It also unusually has paw pads on both its feet and arms. The long tail of Nergigante is covered with relatively fewer spikes than the rest of the body but reaches a higher density as it reaches the end of the tail, with one abnormally large spike at the very tip.
Nergigante's spikes grow incredibly quickly, and are formed when multiple of its scales grow and merge into each other[4]. Initially, the spikes are white, pliable and several dozen centimetres each, and are prone to breaking. Upon losing the spikes, it quickly sprouts a new set with rapid cell division. As they grow, they become increasingly hard and darker-colored due to prolonged oxidation[5], forming a black and metallic enamel-like layer. Approximately 1800 spikes adorn Nergigante.[5]
Spike growth is localised around the neck, wing bends, back and tail end, which not only provide a solid defense for Nergigante, but also aid in its attacks as they are in locations that likely inflict as much damage as possible to targets[4], with many of Nergigante's physical blows carrying enough force to break the spikes and send them flying towards a target as a volley of deadly shrapnel. They can also frequently get lodged into surfaces due to its tendency to drag its body along the ground and use full-body tackles or dive bombs. A full set of hardened spikes can make it difficult for Nergigante to move, so it frequently sheds them.[5] In order to remain agile and conserve energy, majority of spikes do not grow on the underside of Nergigante's neck.[4]
Once over half of its spikes harden, Nergigante has the ability to instantly harden all of them.[6] It temporarily enters this steeled form to do a full-body divebomb tackle, throwing itself into the ground with an impact strong enough to send its hardened spikes flying in all directions. This attack is why the people of Astera call Nergigante the "Eater of Elders"[6]. This move additionally helps remove Nergigante's sometimes restrictive hardened spikes.
Nergigante.behavior:
Nergigante is an extremely aggressive and voracious predator that is constantly on the hunt for large sources of bioenergy to consume to sustain its regenerative abilities[2], leaving behind a trail of destruction in its wake. Thus, it came to the New World and sought for the Zorah Magdaros, as its bioenergy yield was vast and pure[2]. It fights with no regard for its safety or wellbeing[2], using extremely violent physical blows that damage its own body as much as the target, although it has the ability to regenerate from any injuries. Even when exhausted and out of stamina, Nergigante becomes more agitated and fights with a more furious intensity. Due to this, people have called these attacks "Ruinous Impulse".[7]
It primarily attempts to prey on other Elder Dragons due to their high bioenergy yield, but it does not exclusively feed on them and considers almost everything potential prey, attacking them recklessly regardless of strength or size[2]. In spite of this, it can still be made to flee if put at an overwhelming disadvantage.
Nergigante are not native to the New World, and actually crossed the ocean from the Old World to reach the previously uninhabited continent. In fact, the area in the Elder's Recess which Nergigante occupies was once the home of the Lynian Gajalaka tribe.[7]
Nergigante.useful_information: Useful Information: Nergigante can recover from wounds almost instantaneously. Regenerated body parts grow harder over time, so attacking them while they're still fresh is the ideal strategy.

Ruiner Nergigante.characteristics:
Countless battles have only hardened this Nergigante variant. In addition to healing, its spikes grow tougher as it loses health.Ruiner Nergigante is an individual Nergigante who has survived through many fights with other monsters in its endless hunger for bioenergy. Visually speaking, it retains many of the same features to its normal counterpart, but there are a few significantly notable differences. Ruiner Nergigante has a darker overall colouration, due to its new black metallic spikes that grow in between its regular and now darker bone spikes.
Some of the metallic spikes are reflective and shiny, resembling white crystals, called the "Diamond Thorns". These unique spikes form after countless battles where its thorns repeatedly break and regenerate,[5] which at a certain point, a mutation occurs that birth these silvery spikes.[6] This mutation also makes spikes stronger each time they break. Unlike the normal spikes, the diamond thorns cannot regenerate if destroyed, however they are more lethal and can cause lacerations when in contact. These vagrant spikes grow in areas of Ruiner's body that have encountered the repeated physical trauma.[7] Every time the monster senses danger, it gradually grows the diamond thorns on its forearms, wings and head.[7]
Its two bull horns on its head are coated in a metallic gray, instead of the white and black colours, as they have hardened and turned black over years of conflict.[6]
In addition to its regenerative abilities, Ruiner Nergigante grows sharper and stronger thorns as its stamina decreases.[5] Destroyed spikes insantly regenerate and undergo a rapid "super-regeneration" process, in which the soft white spines immediately transform into the hardened, oxidised black spikes.[7]
Ruiner Nergigante.behavior:
Ruiner Nergigante seems to act as a nature-balancing agent in the ecosystems it is part of. It preys on dangerous Elder Dragons that threaten the balance of nature, like its battle with Shara Ishvalda, which had potential to cause large-scale impacts and bring about major turmoil in the environment; however, this balancing effect is not intentional on the dragon's part, being a byproduct of its desire to hunt increasingly powerful prey and devour their bioenergy.[7] As spines instantly regenerate as Ruiner Nergigante fights, it becomes stronger and sharper as combat continues. Thus, the more threatening the target, the greater the threat that Ruiner Nergigante will become if it survives the fight. These traits make Ruiner Nergigante the battle-hardened Elder Dragon that reigns the top of its ecosystem.[8]
Like the normal individuals, they shed and scatter their hardened black spikes.[7]
Ruiner Nergigante.useful_information: Useful Information: Like its cousins, it attacks with white and black spikes, but also possesses metallic spikes that do not regrow. Break them to greatly reduce the monster's lethality.

Safi'jiiva.characteristics:
The fully-grown form of Xeno'jiiva. It absorbs energy from its environment to heal itself and change the ecosystem.Safi'jiiva is a massive Elder Dragon with the body shape of a classic western dragon, bearing a tough hide of dark red scales and a tan underbelly. It has a long spiked tail, black horns twisted from excessive growth,[2] and a massive pair of ragged-looking beige wings which display constellation-like patterns when the monster is absorbing energy. Its snout is rather pointed, and it now has a single pair of orange, reptilian eyes as opposed to the multitude of orange bioenergy-sensing organs of its younger self Xeno'jiiva, which have degenerated due to lack of use. Its hide and scales have formed many complex, layered patterns from constant regrowth,[3][4] and are notably so tough that the majority of attacks will bounce off or do greatly reduced damage if no attempt to weaken the hide is made beforehand.
As the adult form of Xeno'jiiva, Safi'jiiva produces a seemingly endless amount of bioenergy to sustain itself, and is able to freely manipulate the bioenergy in its surroundings, allowing it to drain the life from the environment and reshape entire ecosystems to suit its needs. This notably gives it the ability to instantly recover from injuries by draining the bioenergy in its surroundings, rendering it nearly invulnerable as long as it has a supply of energy to absorb, although it can exhaust an area of energy and be forced to relocate if it exerts itself too much. Similar to Xeno'jiiva, it also wields this energy as various blue energy beams fired from its mouth, or explosions of energy to augment physical blows from its massive body. If pushed further, Safi'jiiva can expend a large amount of its bioenergy to unleash an attack known as the "Sapphire of the Emperor", a cataclysmic energy blast that completely destroys every other living thing in the vicinity.
When near death, Safi'jiiva can enter a "Supercritical State" where the gaps between its scales, patterns on its wings, and inside of its throat glow bright white. In this state, Safi'jiiva expends its energy much more recklessly and is far more aggressive as a result. However, this also causes its hide to soften up, rendering it more vulnerable to attack.
Safi'jiiva.behavior: Safi'jiiva is intensely fierce and territorial, reshaping the environment with no regard for consequences, and unleashing its full might against all who would enter its territory, intercepting them early to prevent them from entering the most energy-rich parts of its lair. It is noticeably more intelligent and perceptive than its younger self, being more calculating with its attacks and being able to single out and focus on the most dangerous threat instead of attacking indiscriminately.
Safi'jiiva.useful_information: Useful Information: Its breath can be avoided by hiding behind obstacles. Drain its energy by breaking its parts and using the environment. Once it's cornered, work together to take it down.

Xeno'jiiva.hunter_notes:
At the start of the fight, Xeno'jiiva attacks clumsily: charging forward, slamming their body down and firing off blasts of energy. Eventually, Xeno'jiiva's body parts, namely their head, forelegs and tail, will begin glowing, enhancing their physical attacks with explosions bursts of dragon energy from the ground and transforming their energy bursts into energy lasers. Damaging these parts enough will revert them to normal.
Eventually, Xeno'jiiva's chest will begin to glow orange as they create wind pressure around them, signalling them going Critical. While critical, Xeno'jiiva will leave behind heated patches on the ground after their attacks that inflict Fireblight. Eventually, Xeno'jiiva will rear up on their hindlegs before firing a laser to the ground which they will sweep in front of them. However, afterwards they will become briefly stuck in the ground, removing the glow from all their body parts. Damaging their chest enough forces them to perform this attack earlier.
After dealing enough damage to them, Xeno'jiiva will retreat to Area 2. In this area, Xeno'jiiva will gain the ability to fly. This area contains three destructible floors, which will cause Xeno'jiiva to stumble if caught on them when they fall.
Xeno'jiiva.sightings: Xeno'jiiva is fought exclusively in the Confluence of Fates and can only be fought in High Rank.
Xeno'jiiva.characteristics: A new species discovered in the depths of the Elder's Recess. Its relationship to the other elder dragons is unclear, as its ecology.
Xeno'jiiva.useful_information: Useful Information: Perhaps as a result of its inability to fully control its own incalculable power, Xeno'jiva is prone to go into a rampage when its energy-filled limbs take enough damage. Endure its rampage and you may be rewarded with a good opening for attacks.

Shagaru Magala.hunter_notes:
Characteristics: The form taken by Gore Magala once they mature and molt. Gorgeous, glittering scales cover Shagaru Magala, and their divine wings are large enough to wrap around their entire body. According to records, one was once said to have scattered its black scales over an area the size of a mountain, annihilating any and all lifeforms inhabiting that region. Shagaru Magala use a variety of attackes—including area breath attacks and explosive pollen—and wield their back scales to even deadlier effect than Gore Magala. The Frenzy is as much of a threat as ever, so don't forget to bring Nulberries. Keep your eyes and ears peeled for powerful wingarm strikes and their bevy of breath attackes 
Threat Level: ★★★★★★★★Shagaru Magala fights similarly to Gore Magala while they are in the Frenzy state, primarily utilising their wing-arms for attacks. They are also able to utilise frenzy-based projectiles, both as straight shots or as explosions. Certain attacks of their will leave behind pools of frenzy that damage the hunter if stood in while fully infected. They are also capable of flying.
When a Shagaru is enraged, they will gradually build up frenzy around their mouth, releasing a powerful frenzy laser when the charge is complete. Damaging their head enough will remove the build-up and topple them.
After taking enough damage, Shagaru will fly into the air before enraging, summoning several frenzy mines around themself and darkening the zone they are in. In this state, several of Shagaru’s wing-arm attacks will summon frenzy explosions in front of them. They are also capable of performing a stronger version of their frenzy laser, sweeping it along the ground.
Shagaru Magala.sightings: Shagaru Magala is found exclusively in the Citadel, though they will not appear in Expeditions to this locale. [NEEDS VERIFICATION].
Shagaru Magala.characteristics:
The form taken by Gore Magala once they mature and molt. Gorgeous, glittering scales cover Shagaru Magala, and their divine wings are large enough to wrap around their entire body. According to records, one was once said to have scattered its black scales over an area the size of a mountain, annihilating any and all lifeforms inhabiting that region.Characteristics: The form taken by Gore Magala once they mature and molt. Gorgeous, glittering scales cover Shagaru Magala, and their divine wings are large enough to wrap around their entire body. According to records, one was once said to have scattered its black scales over an area the size of a mountain, annihilating any and all lifeforms inhabiting that region.
