Shagaru Magala use a variety of attackes—including area breath attacks and explosive pollen—and wield their back scales to even deadlier effect than Gore Magala. The Frenzy is as much of a threat as ever, so don't forget to bring Nulberries. Keep your eyes and ears peeled for powerful wingarm strikes and their bevy of breath attackes 
Threat Level: ★★★★★★★★

Risen Shagaru Magala.hunter_notes: After inflicting a sufficient amount of damage to a Risen elder dragon, they'll enter into a Risen state. In this state, their attacks are much more powerful. Risen Shagaru Magala unleash countless viral pillars, before bringing them togther into one giant explosion. Stay on the offensive to prevent them from entering this state or to knock them out of it.
Risen Shagaru Magala.characteristics: Risen Shagaru Magala are elder dragons that have found a way to overcome their affliction. By surpressing the curi virus, they have gained great strength and new abilities. They release larger quantitites of the Frenzy virus, resulting in viral explosions with increased radius. Anything that gets in their way will fall prey to their powerful wingarms. When their anger reaches its peak, they'll enter into their Risen state and their body will begin to glow.After inflicting a sufficient amount of damage to a Risen elder dragon, they'll enter into a Risen state. In this state, their attacks are much more powerful. Risen Shagaru Magala unleash countless viral pillars, before bringing them togther into one giant explosion. Stay on the offensive to prevent them from entering this state or to knock them out of it.

Shara Ishvalda.hunter_notes:
Shara Ishvalda begins the fight coated in a layer of rock, attacking primarily with their large hammer-like wings. In this phase of the fight, Shara Ishvalda is capable of sinking themself into the ground. While sunken into the ground, they can create pits of sand underneath their wings tips by vibrating them. These sand pits not only slow movement but, if they are hit with another of Shara's attacks, they will burst and damage any hunter within them. Halfway through Phase 1, Shara Ishvalda will begin wildly slamming their wings around themself, causing the size of the arena to decrease for the remainder of the phase.
After taking enough damage, Shara Ishvalda will shed their rocky armour and transition into phase 2. In this phase, Shara attacks by sweeping their wings across the ground like a rake, as well as firing off sound waves from their wing-tips. After even more damage, Shara Ishvalda will open their eyes and transition to phase 3, allowing them to also be able to create sand pits. After a while in phase 3, Shara Ishvalda will burrow into the ground before reappearing at the edge of the arena and throwin forward a massive sonic bomb, causing all sand pits in the Area to burst and disappear.
Shara Ishvalda.sightings: Shara Ishvalda is fought exclusively in the Origin Isle.
Shara Ishvalda.characteristics:
A mysterious elder dragon able to manipulate the earth itself. Vibrations from its wingtips reshape the earth, denying hunters footing.Shara Ishvalda initially covers itself in a thick armor of rock and sand, stuck to its body by an adhesive secretion.[6] In this form, which is called its "Rock-wrapped State" (岩纏い状態),[6] it appears as an enormous, bulky golem-like dragon made of numerous beige, blue, and yellow rocky chunks, many of which can be seen shifting and shuddering as it moves. Its body is stout, with four somewhat stubby legs, a short tail, and two enormous four-fingered structures resembling hands or claws in place of wings. Its head is blocky in shape, with an armored jaw that is capable of movement despite its solid appearance, and two beady, faintly glowing yellow "eyes" visible deep within the rock plating.
Its true body, hidden beneath the rock layer, is a slender, near emaciated dragon with a gnarled hide resembling a cross between wood and stone. It is primarily beige in coloration, although the ends of its limbs and chest are more blue and stony, while the tips of its wingarms are pinkish. Its wingarms and tail are now spindly and resemble plant roots, with each digit of its true wingarms being flexible enough to move independently. Its head bears a crown-like crest and a pair of initially closed eyes, which have degenerated due to its underground lifestyle, with the monster instead using a unique sensory organ in its forehead crest to "see".[7] When sufficiently angered, its eyes are revealed to be greenish-yellow with shrunken red pupils.
Using powerful vibrations emitted from its wingtips, Shara Ishvalda can dissolve earth into sand, which it uses to tunnel through terrain. Through these vibrations, it is also able to induce seismic activity over an enormous area, causing earthquakes and tectonic disruptions powerful enough to permanently reshape local geography and climate. The vibrations produce a "song" reminiscent of howling wind, which can be heard across vast distances and greatly irritates other monsters, causing them to exhibit anomalous behavior. For example, it is believed that the vibrations of this song disrupt the natural navigation instincts of migratory monsters and especially flying wyvern such as the Legiana.[8]  When threatened, Shara Ishvalda also utilizes these vibrations for self-defense, being able to fire destructive sonic "beams" resembling pressurized air, turn the terrain into quicksand, trigger seismic explosions, or concentrate its vibrations into enormous beams or blasts.
Shara Ishvalda.behavior:
Very little is known about Shara Ishvalda's behavior as it was abruptly discovered for the first time, then promptly slain. It is known that the monster lives a strictly subterranean lifestyle and seldom surfaces (if at all), and that it was first discovered while burrowing along the energy-rich Everstream. It can be presumed to be rather territorial, as it attacked the Sapphire Star and Ruiner Nergigante shortly after they got close to its resting place.
When approached, Shara Ishvalda is initially slow and cumbersome thanks to its rock armor, and uses rather conservative attacks to fend off intruders, only seldom using its ability to reshape the earth. All of this changes if its attackers manage to strip its rock armor and reveal its true form, upon which Shara Ishvalda becomes drastically more aggressive and uses all of its strength to eliminate them.
Shara Ishvalda.useful_information: Useful Information: Hunters must begin by stripping its sturdy rock armor: bombs and falling rocks and two proven methods. Skills to counter tremors are a boon against its wingtip attacks.

Teostra.hunter_notes:
Characteristics: Brutal elder dragons wreathed in flames that spew blazing fire. Teostra are of such a fierce and deadly nature that the Guild closely monitors their movements. The black scale dust a Teostra scatters will spread over a wide area until it finally explodes; however, reports claim that damaging the elder dragon's head can prevent the larger explosions. Push on the attack when it's fully enveloped in flames or scale dust to stun it, suppressing whichever it was accumulating.
Threat Level: ★★★★★★★★Teostra mainly attack by biting, pouncing or swiping with his claws. He can also weaponize fire, either as sweeping flamethrowers or by releasing clouds of dust around himself that he detonates by snapping his jaws. Teostra is also capable of flight.
Teostra will start the fight with either a flame or blast aura around himself, his flame aura causing passive damage to anyone to close. Depending on the aura he currently has active, different attacks can have different properties. With his flame aura, he is capable of performing more flamethrower attacks and his bites have added flames to them. With his blast aura, certain attacks will create clouds of dust and his flamethrowers are replaced by him creating clouds of dust that explode immediately. His pounces will also inflict Blastblight.
Upon enraging, Teostra’s current aura will intensify. Evenually, after two minutes have passed, Teostra will fly into the air and releasing a powerful Supernova around himself, causing his current aura to dissipate. Damaging his head enough will cause him to topple and for his current aura to dissipate, knocking him out of his enrage. After his aura is gone, Teostra will eventually replaced it with his opposite aura.
Teostra.sightings: Teostra is found in the Sandy Plains, Lava Caverns and the Citadel.
Teostra.characteristics:
Brutal elder dragons wreathed in flames that spew blazing fire. Teostra are of such a fierce and deadly nature that the Guild closely monitors their movements.Characteristics: Brutal elder dragons wreathed in flames that spew blazing fire. Teostra are of such a fierce and deadly nature that the Guild closely monitors their movements. The black scale dust a Teostra scatters will spread over a wide area until it finally explodes; however, reports claim that damaging the elder dragon's head can prevent the larger explosions. Push on the attack when it's fully enveloped in flames or scale dust to stun it, suppressing whichever it was accumulating.
Threat Level: ★★★★★★★★

Risen Teostra.hunter_notes: After inflicting a sufficient amount of damage to a Risen elder dragon, they'll enter into a Risen state. In this state. their attacks are much more powerful. Risen Teostra unleash an unrelenting inferno of explosions that create powerful shock waves. Stay on the offensive to prevent them from entering this state or to knock them out of it.
Risen Teostra.characteristics: Risen Teostra are elder dragons that have found a way to overcome their affliction. By suppressing the Qurio virus, they have gained great strength and new abilities. While clad in flame, Risen Teostra unleash more dust creating a non-stop barrage of explosions until everything in the vicinity has been turned to ashes. When their anger reaches its peak, they'll enter into their Risen state and their body will begin to glow.After inflicting a sufficient amount of damage to a Risen elder dragon, they'll enter into a Risen state. In this state. their attacks are much more powerful. Risen Teostra unleash an unrelenting inferno of explosions that create powerful shock waves. Stay on the offensive to prevent them from entering this state or to knock them out of it.

Thunder Serpent Narwa.hunter_notes:
Characteristics: An elder dragon and Wind Serpent Ibushi's "queen." Its thundersacs glow with accumulated electrical charge; it is thought that these organs therefore generate the powerful magnetic field that lifts the creature and anything around it high into the air. Attacking its thundersacs that have stored energy will cause them to discharge, frounding the beast. Those on its underside are its weakest, provided you can time an attack for when they aren't blocked by its fins. If you're crafty, you can even use the levitating terrain to your advantage
Threat Level: ★★★★★★★★★★
Thunder Serpent Narwa.characteristics:
An elder dragon and Wind Serpent Ibushi's "queen." Its thundersacs glow with accumulated electrical charge; it is thought that these organs therefore generate the powerful magnetic field that lifts the creature and anything around it high into the air.Characteristics: An elder dragon and Wind Serpent Ibushi's "queen." Its thundersacs glow with accumulated electrical charge; it is thought that these organs therefore generate the powerful magnetic field that lifts the creature and anything around it high into the air. Attacking its thundersacs that have stored energy will cause them to discharge, frounding the beast. Those on its underside are its weakest, provided you can time an attack for when they aren't blocked by its fins. If you're crafty, you can even use the levitating terrain to your advantage
Threat Level: ★★★★★★★★★★Thunder Serpent Narwa is a massive Elder Dragon with a serpentine body, vaguely resembling a deep-sea creature like an eel or seahorse. It is covered in a tan, rubbery hide, with two fins that cradle a large, pulsating yellow sac on its belly. The hide is armored with a flexible and light carapace that can ward off attacks without infringing on the dragon's mobility.[2] Vibrant orange tentacles line the dorsal side of its body and its arms, which turn brighter and purple as they accumulate electricity, while it also has larger, purple sacs on its head, chest, arms, and tail. Its head has a pair of straight horns, beady yellow eyes, and two sets of nested jaws that split open when the monster opens its mouth.
Narwa uses the numerous tentacles and specialized organs called Sparksacs[3] across its body to accumulate a vast electrical charge, which gives it the ability to freely float by producing magnetic fields that repel its body off the ground.[4] It discharges this electricity through a variety of yellow and purple electric attacks primarily fired from its mouth and belly sac, such as rings, beams, pillars, and bolts of electricity fired in dense patterns. Because of its control over magnetism, it is also able to freely lift and throw metal-containing objects or terrain, or even pull them out of the earth. The scale of its electricity output can cause severe burns in its vicinity while passively causing violent thunderstorms to engulf its surroundings.
Deep within its body, the Thunder Serpent grows a mysterious orb said to grant whoever wields it dominion of thunderstorms. If and how this orb is related to the Narwa's abilities is currently unknown.[5]
Thunder Serpent Narwa.behavior: Narwa's behavior beyond the mating cycle is unknown, as it has never been seen outside of it. While mating, it aggressively attacks anything that could be percieved as a threat to itself, its future young, or its mate Ibushi. However, it is less nomadic than its mate, preferring to stake out a territory and wait for Ibushi to come to it.

Narwa the Allmother.hunter_notes:
Characteristics: Having absorbed the lifeforce of her "king", Narwa has transformed and become imbued with new power. She now possesses Ibushi's mastery over wind as well as her own control over thunder, and lusts for utter annihilation. Narwa's ability to now command the wind like Ibushi as well as employ her usual attacks makes her twice as deadly. Keep your eye on her stance as she attacks so you aren't caught off guard. Attack the areas on her body that have accumulated energy to give yourself the edge over her.	
Threat Level: ★★★★★★★★★★In High Rank, Allmother’s fight is always proceed by a fight with Wind Serpent Ibushi. Upon his defeat, both of you will be knocked into the cave below the Coral Palace, where Thunder Serpent Narwa will eat Ibushi and transform into the Allmother. This is skipped in Master Rank.
Narwa primarily uses the Thunder element to attack, most commonly in the form of rings of thunder that will gradually expand or as lightning lasers. She is also capable of performing some wind-based attacks as well as attacking using her tail. Some attacks will raise up boulders that can act as platforms to stand on.
Narwa will begin the fight will lightning covering her head, forearms, back and tail. Damaging these parts enough will remove the charge from them. Removing the charge from enough of her body parts will topple her, allowing easy access to her thunder sac for damage.
Narwa progresses through 3 phases over the course of the fight that change up her moveset. To transition between these phases, Narwa will perform a special attack where she flies to the centre of the arena and firing off lightning pillars and electric rings around her. This is followed by her summoning 6 Dragonators that spin around her while sucking the hunter towards her. If she is damaged enough in this state, she will be toppled and the remainder of the attack is cancelled. If not, she will fly higher into the air before shooting an orb to the ground which explodes into a giant ring along the ground, which can be avoided by standing on the rocks she summons. In Phase 3, the Dragonator portion of the attack onwards can be performed whenever.
Before transitioning to Phase 3, a random monster will invade the quest: be it Magnamalo, Kushala Daora or Teostra. In Master Rank, Malzeno and Scorned Magnamalo can also invade. The two monsters will then proceed to fight, with the invader eventually becoming Wyvern Rideable.
Narwa the Allmother.sightings: Narwa the Allmother is fought exclusively in the Coral Palace.
Narwa the Allmother.characteristics:
Having absorbed the lifeforce of her "king", Narwa has transformed and become imbued with new power. She now possesses Ibushi's mastery over wind as well as her own control over thunder, and lusts for utter annihilation.Characteristics: Having absorbed the lifeforce of her "king", Narwa has transformed and become imbued with new power. She now possesses Ibushi's mastery over wind as well as her own control over thunder, and lusts for utter annihilation. Narwa's ability to now command the wind like Ibushi as well as employ her usual attacks makes her twice as deadly. Keep your eye on her stance as she attacks so you aren't caught off guard. Attack the areas on her body that have accumulated energy to give yourself the edge over her.	
Threat Level: ★★★★★★★★★★As an empowered state of Thunder Serpent Narwa, Narwa the Allmother bears an extremely strong resemblance to its normal self. However, its hide has become dark purple, while its tentacles and thunder sacs are now considerably longer and bright bluish-purple in color, although many are still yellow at the base. The large thunder sac on its belly now visibly holds Narwa's eggs, seen within as eight translucent orbs. Unlike its original variant, Narwa the Allmother's eyes will turn red when it is enraged.
As a result of consuming Wind Serpent Ibushi's "lifeforce", the wind sacs on Narwa's body become active, allowing it to inherit Ibushi's command over wind while drastically increasing the power of its own electrical abilities.[3] It is able to use Ibushi's draconic wind to create violent tornadoes and updrafts, using them in conjunction with its enhanced electric attacks, which take on a similar form to its original self but with far greater potency and range. Its control over electromagnetism is also greatly enhanced, allowing it to lift and throw massive objects like Dragonators with no visible exertion.[1]
Deep within its body, the Allmother is said to grow a great treasure that is spoken of in legends.[4]
Narwa the Allmother.behavior:
Narwa the Allmother is driven primarily by maternal instinct, seeking to protect its offspring at any cost. As a result of being close to laying its eggs, it is much more aggressive than its usual self, and devotes all of its effort towards destroying anything that could be percieved as a threat to its young. These behaviors, as well as the discovery that Narwa and Ibushi are two mated elder dragons belonging to the same species, are considered incredibly valuable insights that are expected to shape monster research in the future.[1]
Historical records suggest that the emergence of an Allmother has drastic effects on the surrounding environments, with large monsters and even other Elder Dragons moving towards her place of appearance for unclear reasons.[1]

Vaal Hazak.hunter_notes:
Vaal Hazak attacks primarily by biting towards their target. While their body is coated in Effluvium, several of their attacks will leave behind effluvial clouds that deal steady damage. They are also capable of firing their effluvium as a beam or a burst along the ground.
Vaal Hazak begins the fight coated in a layer of effluvium, damaging anyone nearby. Damaging them enough will cause their effluvium to dissipate, eventually fully disappearing. Without their supply, Vaal Hazak will periodically rear up on their hindlegs and attempt to suck in any nearby effluvium. If any hunters nearby are inflicted with Effluvium, they will take damage and restock Vaal's supply. If any small monsters are nearby, they will be killed and similarly restock Vaal's supply. Vaal Hazak will replenish their effluvium partially when enraging.
Vaal Hazak.sightings: Vaal Hazak is found exclusively in the Rotten Vale and can only be encountered in High Rank.
Vaal Hazak.characteristics: A grotesque elder dragon that inhabits the deepest part of the Rotten Vale. It uses the fatal vapor of the vale in what appears to be a symbiotic relationship.
Vaal Hazak.useful_information: Useful Information: Once you've become tainted, inhaling the vapor of the vale causes your own health to drain. Head for areas where the vapor is thin, and if you do get tainted, do your best to get rid of it.

Blackveil Vaal Hazak.hunter_notes:
Like Vaal Hazak, Blackveil primarily attacks by biting and by firing off beams of effluvium. One particularly effluvium attack invovles them rearing up on their hindlegs and spraying it wildly around them, with this attack causing constant damage while preparing itself to any hunter inflicted with Effluvium.
While their body is coated with effluvium, the fungus on their body are capable of expelling effluvial spores that deal steady damage. While enraged, Blackveil is capable of flying into the air before shedding all the effluvium on their body, leaving it behind as damaging clouds. Eventually, Blackveil will rear up on their hindlegs and suck back in the effluvium. If any hunters nearby are inflicted with Effluvium, they will take damage. If any infected Small Monsters are nearby, they will be killed. Blackveil's effluvium supply can also be lost by damaging them enough.
Due to the fungus covering their eyes, Blackveil is initially immune to Flash Bombs and similar effects. However, once their head is broken, they can be blinded.
Blackveil Vaal Hazak.sightings: Blackveil Vaal Hazak is found in the Ancient Forest and the Rotten Vale. They can also be found in the Rotten region of the Guiding Lands from level 5 onwards.
Blackveil Vaal Hazak.characteristics: A Vaal Hazak variant encrusted with spores that spew a torrent of toxic effluvium at any who draw close.
Blackveil Vaal Hazak.useful_information: Useful Information: Damaging areas densely covered by spores appears to dull their activity as a while. They also shield the monster from light: break the head to make flash pods work.

Valstrax.characteristics:
Threat: ★★★★★★Valstrax is a slender, aerodynamic Elder Dragon covered in reflective silver scales that reflect ultraviolet light, protecting it from the sun's rays as it flies above the clouds. Its scales are jagged in appearance, with several large spines protruding from its back. It has an avian head and blue eyes with red sclera, and lacks nostrils, with it instead inhaling air using a set of vents on its chest. Its body is extremely resilient, able to endure the wear and heat from its high-speed flight,[2] the shock from collisions at top speed, and its scorching hot internals.[3]
The wings of Valstrax are a highly unusual structure unlike almost any other monster seen so far. Connected to its body by highly flexible limbs, each wing resembles a three-pronged trident structure connected together by elastic wing membranes, each prong being extremely sharp and having an opening on the back end. The wings themselves are also extremely flexible, being able to freely extend, stretch, and fold into a vast array of configurations despite their lack of visible musculature. The spined shells lining its wings will periodically be shed as burning scraps as the monster flies.
By sucking in air, compressing it, and infusing it with dragon energy produced within its body, Valstrax is able to expel fiery energy from the vents on its wings in a manner similar to rocket propellant.[4] Using this propulsion, Valstrax is able to fly at supersonic speeds, or simply hover in place by pointing its wings downwards. The energy expelled from its wings is also used as a means of attack, either as extra thrust for supersonic stabs and strikes with its wings while they're pointing backwards, or as explosive blasts and energy barrages while its wings are pointing forwards. The energy emitted by its wings is highly volatile and can leave behind explosive aftershocks.
When enraged, Valstrax's head crest and wings will glow with red Dragon energy.
Valstrax.behavior: Valstrax is a highly elusive monster that spends most of its life high in the sky, only descending occasionally to hunt prey through sudden ambush attacks. As such, almost nothing is known of its regular habits, with its mere existence usually only being seen as a red comet in the sky. Although not immediately aggressive, Valstrax can unintentionally collide with and destroy any objects in the way while in flight.

Crimson Glow Valstrax.hunter_notes:
Characteristics: A mutant Valstrax fearsomely dubbed the "Crimson Glow". This elder dragon typically secludes itself in the upper atmosphere, but it has been driven mad by its own rampant energy, causing to lash out at anything in its sight. Once it sights its prey, it swoops down, trampling them beneath its shifting wingblades. Several have been sighted all over, so be prepared to encounter one at any time. After channeling energy into its wings, it will unleash a powerful attack. It sucks in this energy from its chest, and that's the moment to wait for. Prevent it from powering up and cause the energy to combust, dealing serious damage to the creature.
Threat Level: ★★★★★★★★★★Much like Valstrax, Crimson Glow primarily attacks with their wings and, also much like Valstrax, they are capable of pointing the thrusters on their wings either forward or backwards. With their wings facing backwards, they can stab them into the ground of expel dragon energy to jet forward. While their wings facing forward, they can slam and swipe them, as well as expel dragon energy from them as projectiles.
Periodically during the fight, Crimson Glow will begin taking in energy through their chest. If successful, Crimson Glow will enter an empowered state, causing their wings to glow crimson. In this state, attacks with their wings are capable of creating bursts of dragon energy, and their dragon projectiles will explode twice. They are also capable of firing off a draconic laser, as well as being able to hover in mid-air. If their chest is damaged enough while taking in air, they will be toppled and prevented from entering their empowered state.
Occasionally, Crimson Glow will spread their wings before blasting off far into the air, as if they are leaving the zone. Instead, an Ambush warning will occur as Crimson Glow flies around in the distance before they crash back down towards the hunter. When Crimson Glow is entering a zone with another monster in it, Crimson Glow will perform his attack on said monster, dealing zero damage to the hunter.
Crimson Glow Valstrax.sightings: Crimson Glow Valstrax can be found in any locale.
Crimson Glow Valstrax.characteristics:
A mutant Valstrax fearsomely dubbed the "Crimson Glow". This elder dragon typically secludes itself in the upper atmosphere, but it has been driven mad by its own rampant energy, causing to lash out at anything in its sight. Once it sights its prey, it swoops down, trampling them beneath its shifting wingblades. Several have been sighted all over, so be prepared to encounter one at any time.Characteristics: A mutant Valstrax fearsomely dubbed the "Crimson Glow". This elder dragon typically secludes itself in the upper atmosphere, but it has been driven mad by its own rampant energy, causing to lash out at anything in its sight. Once it sights its prey, it swoops down, trampling them beneath its shifting wingblades. Several have been sighted all over, so be prepared to encounter one at any time. After channeling energy into its wings, it will unleash a powerful attack. It sucks in this energy from its chest, and that's the moment to wait for. Prevent it from powering up and cause the energy to combust, dealing serious damage to the creature.
Threat Level: ★★★★★★★★★★Crimson Glow Valstrax is an unusual mutation of Valstrax[2] that is characterized by a violent increase in its dragon energy output. It largely resembles a normal Valstrax, but has glowing red streaks on its torso traveling from its neck to its wings, with its wings, back spines, and head crest also having a permanent red glow. It is constantly "leaking" Dragon energy from all the orifices on its body, which intensifies when the monster is enraged, also causing much of its torso to glow bright red. When charged up with Dragon energy, its whole wings will start glowing bright red. The body has also been noted to ooze with a mysterious red liquid, which is extremely hot and appears to be saturated with dragon energy.[3]
The shell of a Crimson Glow Valstrax is tempered by both the violent speeds the dragon flies at and the boiling heat building up through that speed and dragon energy, resulting in a gleaming surface.[4][5]
Due to its rampant Dragon energy, Crimson Glow Valstrax has a much higher output of energy, but has less control over it. It discharges indiscriminate, high-power barrages of volatile energy that saturate terrain with explosive patches, even when idly flying, and can even focus its energy into a massive beam fired between its wings. Its power incontinence also causes its physical attacks to saturate the ground with the explosive Dragon energy leaking out of its body.
Crimson Glow Valstrax.behavior: Due to its Dragon energy going out of control, Crimson Glow Valstrax is massively more aggressive than its normal counterpart. Unlike the usual Valstrax, which secludes itself high in the sky and only descends to feed, Crimson Glow Valstrax percieves almost anything it sees as a threat and attacks them mercilessly[2]. As a result, Crimson Glow Valstrax has entered mythology and folklore as a harbinger of destruction and despair.

Risen Crimson Glow Valstrax.hunter_notes: After inflicting a sufficient amount of damage to a Risen elder dragon, they'll enter into a Risen state. In this state, their attacks are much more powerful. With Risen Crimson Glow Valstrax, they'll amass all their strength in one wing before doing a spin attack, and skewering their prey. Stay on the offensive to prevent them from entering this state or to knock them out of it.
Risen Crimson Glow Valstrax.characteristics: Risen Crimson Glow Valstrax are elder dragons that have found a way to overcome their affliction. By suppressing the Qurio virus, they have gained great strength and new abilities. Their abundance of dragon energy has granted them greater agility, and even more devastating explosive powers. Very few will be able to withstand their ferocious attacks. When their anger reaches its peak, they'll enter into their Risen state and their body will begin to glow.After inflicting a sufficient amount of damage to a Risen elder dragon, they'll enter into a Risen state. In this state, their attacks are much more powerful. With Risen Crimson Glow Valstrax, they'll amass all their strength in one wing before doing a spin attack, and skewering their prey. Stay on the offensive to prevent them from entering this state or to knock them out of it.

Velkhana.hunter_notes:
Velkhana clad themselves in armor made of ice. By destroying the parts of this icy armor, it is possible to suppress their immense power, but precision is required. Note that the walls of ice Velkhana create can be destroyed, so take out any that block your way and get back in the fight.Velkhana primarily attacks with their knife like tail, stabbing it into the ground and sweeping it around them. They are also capable of firing off ice beams. While covered in ice armour, they are capable of performing more ice based attacks involving the creation of ice crystals.
Upon the fight starting, Velkhana will form a layer of ice armour on their body. In this state, certain attacks will leave behind frost clouds on the ground which, if hit with an ice beam, forms a wall of ice which, if damaged enough, creates an ice platform to jump off. Eventually, Velkhana’s ice armour will progress into an advanced state with the zone turning blue, allowing access to stronger ice attacks. Eventually, Velkhana will fire an ice beam around themself, before flying into the air and creating 3 rings of ice below themself, destroying their ice armour in the process. When on low health, Velkhana will retain their ice armour after the attack. Their ice armour can be destroyed with enough damage, destroying enough parts will destroy it in its entirety and topple them. Eventually, Velkhana will reform their armour.
Velkhana.sightings: Velkhana can be found in any locale.
Velkhana.characteristics: Known as the "Ice Dragons that Freeze All" or the "Iceborne Wyvern," few records of Velkhana exist, as such, they remain shrouded in mystery. Their icy breath is so cold that it can form massive spires and walls of ice out of nowhere, and it is even powerful enough to freeze other monsters. Some reports indicate that Velkhana will freeze their rivals in order to establish their domain.Velkhana clad themselves in armor made of ice. By destroying the parts of this icy armor, it is possible to suppress their immense power, but precision is required. Note that the walls of ice Velkhana create can be destroyed, so take out any that block your way and get back in the fight.

Wind Serpent Ibushi.hunter_notes:
Characteristics: A male elder dragon that exhibits inexplicable behaviors such as floating upside down midair. Research indicates that the emission of a special gas from all over its body, and the modulation of this gas, is what allows it to move freely. It shoots air from gills on its arms and tail to fly, creating its own turbulence and soaring to great heights. It possesses special organs called "windsacs" that store the gas it uses to float, and can be seen on its back, and tail. They are very delicate, and injuring them could open up a prime opportunity to attack.
Threat Level: ★★★★★★★★★Ibushi primarily attacks by firing off blasts of wind that knock the hunter directly up into the air. He will also attack frequently with his tail. Certain attacks from Ibushi are capable of creating whirlwinds, which propel anyone inside upwards. His attacks are also capable of levitating boulders to act as platforms, with some rocks also having ballista on them to damage Ibushi with.
Throughout the entire fight, Ibushi is permanently floating. Across his body, Ibushi has multiple wind-sacs that help keep him afloat. These wind-sacs can be destroyed, destroying enough of them will cause Ibushi to fall out of the sky for a short while, though it also results in his wind-sacs regenerating.
Upon entering their enrage state, Ibushi will fly to the centre of the arena, generating 8 floating rocks around him, as well as several cannonballs. After a while, Ibushi will send these rocks flying towards the hunter. However, this attack also summons 4 floating rocks with ballista on them, allowing for the rocks to be shot at and destroyed. When at low health, Ibushi will remain enraged for the remainder of the fight, periodically using this attack.
Wind Serpent Ibushi.sightings: Wind Serpent Ibushi is primarily found in the Coral Palace. He can also appear in the Red Stronghold as a Major Threat during a Rampage, with no other larger monster showing up when he arrives.
Wind Serpent Ibushi.characteristics:
A male elder dragon that exhibits inexplicable behaviors such as floating upside down midair. Research indicates that the emission of a special gas from all over its body, and the modulation of this gas, is what allows it to move freely. It shoots air from gills on its arms and tail to fly, creating its own turbulence and soaring to great heights.Characteristics: A male elder dragon that exhibits inexplicable behaviors such as floating upside down midair. Research indicates that the emission of a special gas from all over its body, and the modulation of this gas, is what allows it to move freely. It shoots air from gills on its arms and tail to fly, creating its own turbulence and soaring to great heights. It possesses special organs called "windsacs" that store the gas it uses to float, and can be seen on its back, and tail. They are very delicate, and injuring them could open up a prime opportunity to attack.
Threat Level: ★★★★★★★★★Wind Serpent Ibushi is a massive Elder Dragon with a serpentine body, vaguely resembling a deep-sea creature like an eel or seahorse. It is covered in a light blue, rubbery hide, while its claws and lower body are covered in grey scales and have numerous slits resembling gills. It has paddle-like fins, numerous dorsal spines running along its spine, and a large crest of bony spikes protruding from its head, which has blank yellow eyes and two sets of nested jaws that split open when the monster opens its mouth. When enraged, Ibushi's eyes turn orange and the gills on its body start glowing red.
Several bluish-indigo wind sacs are found on its arms, back, chest, and tail. These sacs create, store, and expel a special lighter-than-air gas that give it the ability to freely float and manipulate the wind around it.[1] Expulsion and modulation of this gas give it a variety of abilities for combat, most commonly by creating violent currents or blasts of dragon-infused winds that can lift heavy objects or blow away obstacles. Its nature of flight and wind manipulation also causes violent wind turbulence and draconic storms around it, which can reshape the landscape and force nearby monsters to flee.
Many myths tell of the legendary dorsal horns of Ibushi, which are said to contain the power to wield the sky itself.[1] Simultaneously, other tales tell of a jewel that grows within the dragon's body that grants the power to bend storms to one's will.[3] To what extent either of these features are involved in the dragon's command over wind is currently unknown.
Wind Serpent Ibushi.behavior: Ibushi's behavior beyond the mating cycle is unknown, as it has never been seen outside of it. During its mating process, it is single-minded in searching for Narwa, only stopping to remove obstacles or enemies that get in its way. It is this pursuit, and the accompanying storms, that are believed to be the source of the phenomenon known as the Rampage, where hundreds of monsters stampede in a frenzy, now interpreted as them fleeing the wrath of the Ibushi.[4]

Zorah Magdaros.characteristics: An elder dragon that rises from the earth like a volcano. Where it's headed, and why, the Research Commission has yet to figure out.
Zorah Magdaros.useful_information: Characteristics: An elder dragon that rises from the earth like a volcano. Where it's headed, and why, the Research Commission has yet to figure out.Useful Information: Normal attacks can't make a dent in its mountain-like shell. Utilize larger weapons such as cannons and ballistae, or directly attack the "magmacore" heat organs that are exposed in parts of its outer shell.

Ajarakan.hunter_notes:
Characteristic by their highly developed carapaces, Ajarakan wrap themselves in molten metal that they rub together to heat up and create explosions. Presumably due to the friction of the metal, they can reach high enough temperatures to melt even the ground or bullets. They can also use their strong limbs to grip onto the ceiling and move around freely, so a hunter must watch out from every angle, including above.
Helpful Hints: Approaching an Ajarakan's extreme heat will sap your health, so use cool drinks or Chillmantle Bugs to counteract it. Normal Ammo and arrows will wilt if you try to pierce their molten carapaces, so you must use heat-resistant equipment or hit them with Watermoss to bring down their temperature first. Continuous friction will cause their body temperature to rise, but soften their outer shells.Ajarakan attacks with their powerful forelimbs, either slamming them forward or scraping them across the ground. While their body is heated, most of their attacks with their arms will additionally fling up blast-inflicting molten debris.
As they fight, their body gradually heats up, with them eventually digging their arms into the ground and causing their back to catch on fire. While in this state, standing too close to them will cause passive damage, while weaker arrows and Bowgun ammo will fail to deal significant damage. Eventually they will exit this state after performing their spinning ball slam, though they are not guaranteed to. Dealing enough damage to them in this state will forcibly knock them out of it and topple them.
Ajarakan are also capable of hanging and swinging from the overhead debris present in certain zones, eventually leaping and slamming towards their target. They can be knocked down while climbing to topple them.
After ramming its arms into the ground and causing a huge explosion, Ajarakan's arms become a weak point for Focus Strikes, with doing so instantly toppling it and dispelling its flaming state.
Ajarakan.sightings: Ajarakan is found primarily in the Oilwell Basin, with Tempered individuals also being found in the Ruins of Wyveria. Ajarakan are often encountered and travel in pairs.
Ajarakan.characteristics:
Hunters Notes: Characteristic by their highly developed carapaces, Ajarakan wrap themselves in molten metal that they rub together to heat up and create explosions. Presumably due to the friction of the metal, they can reach high enough temperatures to melt even the ground or bullets. They can also use their strong limbs to grip onto the ceiling and move around freely, so a hunter must watch out from every angle, including above.
Helpful Hints: Approaching an Ajarakan's extreme heat will sap your health, so use cool drinks or Chillmantle Bugs to counteract it. Normal Ammo and arrows will wilt if you try to pierce their molten carapaces, so you must use heat-resistant equipment or hit them with Watermoss to bring down their temperature first. Continuous friction will cause their body temperature to rise, but soften their outer shells.Ajarakan is a Fanged Beast with an ape-like build and stance, boasting a muscular body with highly developed forelimbs that can grapple foes and easily climb terrain, while its hind limbs are much smaller in comparison. Its body is covered in coppery scales and shells, which are mostly red in coloration and become more black closer to the ends of its limbs, while the scales on its face and upper body have tinges of teal resembling oxidized copper. Its face is affixed in a perpetual snarl, with a flame-like crest adorning it, while its back also boasts a much larger carapace of twisted, flame-like shells. Its tail is fairly long and thick, with a wide, gnarled club-like structure at the tip. It has highly flexible hands with four digits, including a thumb. On the back of its hands, the Ajarakan grows hardened white pads that allow it to walk on its knuckles comfortably.[2]
The scales of Ajarakan are spiked at their tips, somewhat resembling small flames.[3] They are extremely tough, said to resist scratches from even the toughest natural materials.[4] These scales form the Ajarakan's shell, characterized by its rough surface texture, which allows it to produce sparks in response to even minor friction.[5] Its dense structure allows this carapace shell to withstand the explosive force that the Ajarakan wields.[6] Multiple sections of these shells then merge on the back of the beast into the Ajarakan's distinctive rigde, which has often been likened to flames in color and shape.[7][8]
The bone marrow of an Ajarakan maintains a high temperature and is considered almost too hot to handle.[9] This is a trait it shares, curiously, with the brainstem of the beast - the Ajarakan's Medulla burns so hot, it has been said to be as if all of the Ajarakan's heat was concentrated on it.[10] Like many other monsters, the Ajarakan also rarely grows a jewel in its body, which burns hot and has powerful explosive properties.[11][12]
Ajarakan cover themselves in molten metal, which hardens and reinforces their carapaces and scales. By scraping the metal on its carapace against itself or the ground, Ajarakan is able to generate immense amounts of heat and friction, enough to melt parts of the ground its heated body parts come into contact with. The friction also allows it to create massive explosions, ignite its surroundings, and even melt incoming projectiles. When fully heated up, the Ajarakan's back and head shells will glow incandescently.[13]
Ajarakan.behavior:
Ajarakan are primarily active during the Firespring of the Oilwell Basin, and aggressively attack any potential prey or intruders on sight. When engaging a target, they will beat their tails against their back shells both as a warning and to heat themselves up, before roaring and beginning to attack.
They have been at times observed hunting in packs of 2-3 individuals.
Ajarakan.useful_information: Approaching an Ajarakan's extreme heat will sap your health, so use cool drinks or Chillmantle Bugs to counteract it. Normal Ammo and arrows will wilt if you try to pierce their molten carapaces, so you must use heat-resistant equipment or hit them with Watermoss to bring down their temperature first. Continuous friction will cause their body temperature to rise, but soften their outer shells.

Arzuros.hunter_notes: Arzuros love honey so much that they may steal any you might be carrying and start to eat it on the spot, leaving them vulnerable. Carry around a stash of honey to take exploit their sweet tooth.Arzuros are capable of attacking both on all fours and while standing on their hindlegs, mainly attacking with their armoured braces.  Arzuros are also capable of pinning the hunter, shaking them before throwing them forward. If the hunter has any honey on them while this attack is being performed, the Arzuros will proceed to steal this honey off of them before eating it on the spot, leaving them open to attack.
Arzuros.sightings: Arzuros is found in the Shrine Ruins, Flooded Forest and the Citadel.
Arzuros.characteristics: Beasts known to dwell in humid forest and mountain regions. Though known more for fishing and standing upright to collect honey, their thick claws and heavy forearm plating allow them to deliver powerful blows to any aggressor.Arzuros love honey so much that they may steal any you might be carrying and start to eat it on the spot, leaving them vulnerable. Carry around a stash of honey to take exploit their sweet tooth.

Apex Arzuros.hunter_notes: An angry Apex Arzuros will trigger a devastating move, closing in while thrashing the ground, hitting obstacles with a colossal strike. Push on against an enraged Apex to quickly rid it of its rage and steady its temper
Apex Arzuros.characteristics: An Arzuros so mighty, it was crowned an Apex. Its body is covered in scars and wounds as if it had been caught in a storm, and it's seemingly always dominated by wrath and terror. Its forelegs are massive, deft removers of any who'd stand in their way. The call of an Apex unleashes its tortured anger on nearby beasts, driving them into a frenzy.An angry Apex Arzuros will trigger a devastating move, closing in while thrashing the ground, hitting obstacles with a colossal strike. Push on against an enraged Apex to quickly rid it of its rage and steady its temper

Bishaten.hunter_notes:
Its varied tail attacks are incredibly powerful, and sometimes it spins around like a top, so avoiding damage can be tough. But, if you use that chance to attack, the beast will drop its fruit, and you can pick it up and throw it back, aiding your hunt. Watch its moves carefully to find your opening.Bishaten’s main weapon in combat is the various fruits they store within their pouch. While their Jumbofruit act as simple projectiles, they can also utilize purple Poisonfruit and blinding Flashfruit. From High Rank onwards, they can utilize green Parafruit in attacks as well. For physical attacks, Bishaten primarily attack with their hand-like tail. They can also use this tail to cling onto walls and attack from there
Periodically, Bishaten will begin standing up on their tail, allowing them to perform new attacks. Eventually Bishaten will spin in place before charging forward, returning back to all fours. However, if their tail is damaged enough while in this state, Bishaten will be toppled and will drop their various fruit around them which can they be picked up and utilized by the hunter.
Jumbofruit act as healing items that heal the hunter instantly. Poisonfruit act similar to Poison Kunai, Parafruit act similar to Paralysis Kunai and Flashfruit act similar to Flash Bombs.
Bishaten.sightings: Bishaten is found in the Shrine Ruins, Flooded Forest and Jungle.
Bishaten.characteristics: A monster with a distinctive tail. While it is omnivorous, it has a preference for fruit, and keeps various fruits with all kinds of effects in its belly pouch. An incredibly curious beast, it enjoys playing tricks on people, and has been seen to bat fruit at its prey using its tail.Its varied tail attacks are incredibly powerful, and sometimes it spins around like a top, so avoiding damage can be tough. But, if you use that chance to attack, the beast will drop its fruit, and you can pick it up and throw it back, aiding your hunt. Watch its moves carefully to find your opening.

Blood Orange Bishaten.hunter_notes:
Ignites pinecones in a variety of ways, then attacks using a variety of arcs. The cones will explode when touched, or after a certain amount of time. When enraged these Bishaten subspecies have a fiery breath attack. Positioning is a key as any cones in this breath attack's path will be ignited.Much like Bishaten, Blood Orange utilizes plant-based projectiles, in this case pinecones which they ignite. Blood Orange is capable of throwing them forward or slamming them into the ground, creating explosions. When enraged, they are also capable of breathing fire.
Blood Orange is also capable of balancing on their tail, with them being toppled if enough damage is dealt to it. While they can exit this stance in a similar manner to Bishaten, though they will throw several pinecones into the ground before their spinning charge, when enraged they also exit the stance via a pinecone slam.
Blood Orange Bishaten.sightings: Blood Orange Bishaten is found in the Shrine Ruins, Sandy Plains  and the Citadel.
Blood Orange Bishaten.characteristics: A subspecies named for their auburn fur. Inquisitive by nature, Blood Orange Bishaten can even appear near human habitats. Their belly pouch is stuffed with combustible pinecones, and this subspecies has a distinct and focused fire breath. The breath itself isn't as dangerous as the pinecones it ignites. Reports indicate that it's possible to topple these monsters while they balance on their tails.Ignites pinecones in a variety of ways, then attacks using a variety of arcs. The cones will explode when touched, or after a certain amount of time. When enraged these Bishaten subspecies have a fiery breath attack. Positioning is a key as any cones in this breath attack's path will be ignited.

Blangonga.hunter_notes:
Large, white fanged beasts that rule over other Blango, attacking intruders as a pack. Its muscularity and mobility allows it to strike swiftly, even on fresh snow, and pounce from long distances - so hunters with long-range weapons still need to stay on guard. Large tusks are the mark of a powerful leader.
Helpful Hints: Blangonga use snowy ground to their advantage for extra mobility, and can summon other Blangos to gang up on unwary hunters. Use extra caution when they’re angry, because they can direct the whole pack at a chosen target with perilous efficiency. Watch out for that freezing breath, too. Destroying a Blangonga’s tusks is believed to undermine its authority with the other Blangos, disrupting their teamwork.Blangonga rely on physical blows from their powerful forearms to attack hunters. They are also capable of releasing beams of frost from their mouth that can freeze hunters in place and throwing snowballs.
Blangonga are typically accompanied by a pack of Blango. Blangonga are capable of issuing commands to their Blango, causing one of them to attack the hunter. While enraged, they are additionally capable of performing a special roar, causing all present Blango to rush their target. Breaking the Blangonga's fangs twice prevents them from issuing any form of command.
While in their nest in Area 14, Blangonga are capable of digging into the deep snow, re-emerging below the hunter.
While breathing frost, Blangonga's rear becomes a weak point for Focus Strikes.
Blangonga.sightings: Blangonga are found exclusively in the Iceshard Cliffs.
Blangonga.characteristics:
Hunters Notes: Large, white fanged beasts that rule over other Blango, attacking intruders as a pack. Its muscularity and mobility allows it to strike swiftly, even on fresh snow, and pounce from long distances - so hunters with long-range weapons still need to stay on guard. Large tusks are the mark of a powerful leader.
Helpful Hints: Blangonga use snowy ground to their advantage for extra mobility, and can summon other Blangos to gang up on unwary hunters. Use extra caution when they’re angry, because they can direct the whole pack at a chosen target with perilous efficiency. Watch out for that freezing breath, too. Destroying a Blangonga’s tusks is believed to undermine its authority with the other Blangos, disrupting their teamwork.Blangonga is a large-bodied Fanged Beast distinguished by its coat of long, snow white fur and colourful, ornamented face. Its naked skin is coloured a cool, almost frostbitten blue across most of the body, and is exposed on its hands, feet, belly, and face, which is decorated by grooved cyan skin running from below the eyes to the mouth, with a red line in the middle connecting the thick, horned brow-ridges to the nose and upper lip, from which another pair of red horns grow out to the sides. Sprouting from its face are a pair of whiskers, which turn yellow at the tufted tips, and the top of its bald scalp is coloured a lighter blue.
Blangonga fur is extremely resilient, and prized in cold regions for its uses in textile work.[2] It has been noted to have powerful thermal properties while also being comparable to iron chainmail in terms of defensive strength.[3] The tips of the hairs that make up this fur are pointy and needle-like.[4] The fur on the tail is quite soft and pleasant to the touch.[5] Some eastern religions are known to wear clothes made from Blangonga Fur as ritual garbs.[6]
The most notable feature of Blangonga are their large tusk-like canines which protrude out of the mouth considerably. They are as thick as a human thigh[7] and extremely sharp and deadly.[8]
Like other Fanged Beasts with prehensile hands such as Rajang or Congalala, Blangonga walk on their knuckles and fists, though they will sometimes fall onto their palms, or use them to push themselves off the ground for a leap. Their forelimbs are proportionally long, and during battles are used to club and wrestle opponents, while the hindlimbs are short; both are muscular and well developed, permitting Blangonga to easily traverse the cliffs and gorges of their mountainous homes with leaps and bounds.
Blangonga possess a more developed Frost Sac than the smaller Blangos, allowing them to expel a super-cooled breath that freezes whatever it comes into contact with to the ground. This breath is generated through the Blangonga inhaling the cold mountain air of its home and cooling it down further in its specialized organ.[9] They will also use their forelimbs to hurl up large quantities of snow and ice or burrow themselves into the thick snowpack to ambush victims from below.
Blangonga.behavior:
The Blangonga is the leader of a Blango troop, easily identified by its greater size and elaborate facial ornamentation. With a bellowing roar, it commands the Blango under its charge, but its leadership is not assured: a Blangonga owes its status in the troop's hierarchy to its pair of enlarged canines protruding from its maxilla; if these are broken, its control over the troop will lessen significantly.[10]
The regions these Monsters inhabit are worlds of scarcity: eternal winters entrap the mountainous peaks, perpetually pushing its inhabitants to the brink of starvation, fuelling high aggression. Blangonga are highly territorial, and sicc their Blango troop at perceived threats with extreme prejudice to secure what little resources are available. Within the Iceshard Cliffs, Blangonga compete with other macrocarnivores, such as the Leviathan Hirabami, which they can physically overpower and drive from their turfs.
Blangonga are considered extremely intelligent due to their sophisticated use of social hunting strategies. Their main tactic consists of instructing their Blango to hide beneath the snow in specific spots. The Alpha, aided by the rest of the troop that is not hidden, identifies prey and then chases it towards where its brethren lie in wait. Once the prey is close, the Blango beneath the snow leap out, surrounding the target and pelting it to death with simultaneous attacks.[9] They have also been observed rubbing off paintballs from their bodies, implying a degree of awareness of their role in hunting. As a result, there have been many cases of hunters becoming discouraged and giving up hunting after failing to outsmart a Blangonga.[11]
As the troop leaders, they are also seemingly tasked with marking their local territory using their feces.[12]
Blangonga.useful_information: Blangonga use snowy ground to their advantage for extra mobility, and can summon other Blangos to gang up on unwary hunters. Use extra caution when they’re angry, because they can direct the whole pack at a chosen target with perilous efficiency. Watch out for that freezing breath, too. Destroying a Blangonga’s tusks is believed to undermine its authority with the other Blangos, disrupting their teamwork.

Copper Blangonga.characteristics: Copper Blangonga is a seldom-seen Subspecies of Blangonga that have evolved to live in arid regions. The pelt of Copper Blangonga is, instead of the white of the common species, a mix of browns and greys, with blue on select parts such as the face. Like the base species Copper Blangonga have large tusks, and limbs strong enough to lift and throw large chunks of earth at attackers, and burrow underground for a surprise attack. They appear to have greater physical strength than the common species, possibly suggesting enhanced musculature.[2]
Copper Blangonga.behavior:
Copper Blangonga are quite rare, and as such not much is known about them. Thus far they have only been seen in the Old Desert.
One key difference between this and the common species is that Copper Blangonga are exclusively sighted alone - they do not seem to form packs at all, and no desert equivalent of Blango have ever been discovered. It has been suggested that the harsh deserts this species calls home are too rough to sustain large packs, and that only the strongest individuals survive by carving out a lonesome existence.[2][3]

Bulldrome.characteristics:
Threat: ★★★Bulldrome are the dominant males of the Bullfango. They are largely similar, being large quadruped beasts with huge tusks. In addition to increased size Bulldrome distinguish themselves with long, white hairs on the sides of their head, and running down their back in a Mohawk style.
A notable feature of Bulldrome are their asymmetrical curved tusks, with one being much longer than the other. Which tusk is longer differs between individuals[2] and is behaviorally determined. Every Bullfango has one tusk it prefers to use while digging up soil and looking for food. This foraging tusk is ground down through use and thus remains shorter. Whichever tusk an individual Bullfango does not prefer for foraging is instead used for intimidation and combat, growing larger by comparison. While this difference is hardly noticeable in Bullfango, it becomes much more pronounced on Bulldrome.[3]
Bulldrome.behavior:
Bulldrome are known to lead packs of Bullfango, offering the pack protection. In exchange for this protection Bulldrome are known to forcefully take their share of the food, bullying the smaller Bullfango out of their feeding spots.[3]
They're otherwise identical to Bullfango, their offense consisting exclusively of charging at a threat, and sometimes thrashing their tusks side to side.

Congalala.hunter_notes:
Large fanged beasts with pink fur and a distinct crest, which the males sculpt with plant oils and juices as a sign of virility. Congalala are common in temperate forests and are therefore well researched. They're big eaters and love mushrooms, which they absorb and then exhale as a variety of potent breaths that inflict poison, blast, paralysis, and more.
Helpful Hints: The stench from a Congalala is so rancid that healing items have no effect. But you can quickly dispel it with a deodorant or by evading in water. Those farts are also trouble, but a hunter might just spot an opportunity if they watch carefully. Congalala are also known to use any breath type - a trick some have attributed to the black mushrooms they're seen digging up.Congalala primarily attack with their claws, by slamming their body down and by farting. While not carrying anything in their tail, they are also capable of excreting into it and throwing their dung forward.
Congalala are capable of performing various breath attacks depending on the type of mushroom they have recently eaten. Periodically, Congalala will sniff into the air before going over to a patch of mushrooms to pick up one in its tail, which it will produce to eat to change the effect of its breath. By default, Congalala's breath will inflict  Soiled. After consuming red Nitroshrooms, its breath will inflict  Blastblight, after consuming yellow Parashrooms, its breath will inflict  Paralysis and after consuming purple Toadstools, its breath will inflict  Poison.
Occaisonally, Congalala will instead dig into the ground before pulling out a black Truffle Du Conga. Consuming this mushroom will give Congalala access to all their breath attacks at once. However, if they are flinched, they will drop the mushroom which can then be picked up as an item and used as a cooking ingredient.
If caught in a Pitfall Trap, Congalala will fall into it face first, leaving their rear exposed. While enraged, Congalala are capable of farting in retaliation while trapped.
While performing their breath attacks, Congalala's rear will become a weak point for Focus Strikes.
Congalala.sightings: Congalala are found primarily in the Scarlet Forest, with Tempered individuals also being found in the Ruins of Wyveria.
Congalala.characteristics:

Congalala are also known to use any breath type - a trick some have attributed to the black mushrooms they're seen digging up.

Doshaguma.hunter_notes:
Fanged beasts that are sometimes seen traveling in packs. Ruggedly built and extremely aggressive, Doshaguma won't hesitate to throw everything they've got at enemies - even other small monsters. They have been known to take prey back to their dens, which sometimes leads to violent disputes.
Helpful Hints: When Doshaguma are low on health, their wounds open exposing a weak point. They'll grow more aggressive, though, so beware of counterattacks. Their stomachs are exposed when rising to their hind legs, which is a relatively soft target and potential weak point. Use their mobility to lure them into rock and vine traps. If a Doshaguma pack attacks during a separate hunt, dung pods and large dung pods are a hunter's best friend.Doshaguma are purely physical monsters, primarily attacking with their claws, by biting or by slamming their body into the hunter.
After taking enough damage, Doshaguma will rear up on their hindlegs and perform a special roar, causing all previously destroyed wounds to re-open. In this state, Doshaguma are capable of new attacks, combo-ing the old attacks together in new ways and extends their ground scrape by digging their claws into the ground and unearthing debris in front of them.
Doshaguma.sightings: Doshaguma is found in both the Windward Plains and the Scarlet Forest, with Tempered individuals also being found in the Ruins of Wyveria. While in the Windward Plains, Doshaguma are encountered in packs lead by an Alpha Doshaguma, who is a guaranteed Gold Crown Large individual. Doshaguma found in the Scarlet Forest and Spoiler Locale 1 are solitary.
Doshaguma.characteristics:
Hunters Notes: Fanged beasts that are sometimes seen traveling in packs. Ruggedly built and extremely aggressive, Doshaguma won't hesitate to throw everything they've got at enemies - even other small monsters. They have been known to take prey back to their dens, which sometimes leads to violent disputes.
Helpful Hints: When Doshaguma are low on health, their wounds open exposing a weak point. They'll grow more aggressive, though, so beware of counterattacks. Their stomachs are exposed when rising to their hind legs, which is a relatively soft target and potential weak point. Use their mobility to lure them into rock and vine traps. If a Doshaguma pack attacks during a separate hunt, dung pods and large dung pods are a hunter's best friend.Their giant, slobbering maws are beset by a pair of tusks, and beneath the many folds of their wrinkled faces hide a pair of small, beady eyes.
An Alpha Doshaguma is identified by its much larger size and striking red mane compared to the brown one of the normal version.
Doshaguma.behavior:
Brutish and aggressive, Doshaguma are ferociously territorial and will attack any interlopers on sight, overwhelming enemies and prey with pure physical strength. They are known to prey on herbivores like Ceratonoth and Dalthydon, and will even throw them at other foes in the vicinity. Their aggressive and predatory behavior often gets them into disputes with other predators of their habitats, like Balahara.
Although generally solitary creatures, Doshaguma have been sometimes observed moving in packs. As Doshaguma are powerful enough to be self-sufficient, it is speculated that Doshaguma join packs solely due to the prospect of bringing down more powerful prey that they would otherwise be unable to kill by themselves.[2] As a result of this, packs of Doshaguma have virtually no cooperation nor unity, and the members are prone to violent infighting over food and resources.
On occasion, a larger Alpha Doshaguma may rally a pack of followers by using their superior strength to force the others to submit. Emboldened and kept in line by the Alpha's strength, these packs exhibit more aggressive roaming and predatory behavior, and are slightly more unified. However, the death of the Alpha will cause the pack to fall into disarray and scatter in short order.
Doshaguma.useful_information: When Doshaguma are low on health, their wounds open exposing a weak point. They'll grow more aggressive, though, so beware of counterattacks. Their stomachs are exposed when rising to their hind legs, which is a relatively soft target and potential weak point. Use their mobility to lure them into rock and vine traps. If a Doshaguma pack attacks during a separate hunt, dung pods and large dung pods are a hunter's best friend.
