Table_1.Approx. Dimensions: Deserts, Savannahs, Forests, Volcanoes, Snowfields, Ruins
Table_1.Approx. Dimensions.1: Deserts, Savannahs, Forests, Volcanoes, Snowfields, Ruins

Astalos.hunter_notes:
Attacks with their head, wings, or tail will be charged with electricity. The movement, attack range, and strength of each part changes when electrified; when all parts are charged, these creatures become particularly dangerous, so targeting electrified parts dispel their charge is essential.Astalos attacks with 3 parts of their body: their head, which they swipe in front of them and fire off pillars of lightning from, their wings, which they slam into and sweep across the ground, and their tail, which they can create discharge of electricity from. They are also capable of flying into the attack before diving towards their target. While flying, they can also use their tail to paralyse their target.
Attacking with their head, wings or tail enough will cause that part to become charged, causing physical attacks from that part to deal thunder damage and for that part to take more damage. Once all their parts are charged, they are capable of rearing up further into the sky while flying before divebombing their target, creating a burst of electricity around them and de-charging all their parts. Damaging a charged part enough will de-charge it.
Astalos.sightings: Astalos is found in the Shrine Ruins, Flooded Forest and Jungle.
Astalos.characteristics: Large Flying Wyverns with crest-shaped organs that let them control vast amounts of electricity. Astalos vibrate these organs on their head, forked tail, and brilliant wings to charge the respective body part with electricity, yielding tremendous strength and an amplified attack range. Violent to a fault, witnesses have observed them using all their might to drive intruders from their territory.Attacks with their head, wings, or tail will be charged with electricity. The movement, attack range, and strength of each part changes when electrified; when all parts are charged, these creatures become particularly dangerous, so targeting electrified parts dispel their charge is essential.

Barioth.hunter_notes: Destroy the spikes on its winged forelegs and it won't be as zippy on the ice anymore! If you really want to slow a Barioth down, aim at those spikes.Barioth primarily attack by pouncing at their target, swiping at them with their wings or by scraping their tail across the ground. They are also capable of firing off icy projectiles that expand into lingering icy tornadoes. Barioth are also capable of flying into and attacking from the air. While normally very agile, capable of quickly repositioning between attacks, breaking their wings will cause them to trip and stumble when leaping, as well as causing them to fall over after performing certain attacks.
Barioth.sightings: Barioth is found in the Frost Islands and the Citadel.
Barioth.characteristics: Wyverns that rule the eternally frozen Tundra. Barioth use their forelegs, tail, and their spiked scales to traverse the slippery ice with ease; this ability makes them very difficult to keep up with.Destroy the spikes on its winged forelegs and it won't be as zippy on the ice anymore! If you really want to slow a Barioth down, aim at those spikes.

Frostfang Barioth.hunter_notes:
Much like Barioth, Frostfang attacks by pouncing at the hunter and swiping at them with their wings. They can shoot out beams of ice which leave behind pools of frost on the ground, both of which are capable of freezing you in place. Doing enough damage to them can result in a special flinch, resulting in them needing to taunt after performing their next frost-based attack. Frostfang is also capable of clinging to walls and leaping off of them.
While normally agile, capable of quickly repositioning between attacks, breaking their wings like regular Barioth will cause them to trip and stumble when leaping, as well as causing them to fall over after performing certain attacks.
Frostfang Barioth.sightings: Frostfang Barioth is found exclusively in the Hoarfrost Reach.
Frostfang Barioth.characteristics: A Barioth variant capable of spewing a sub-zero breath attack that it uses to slow down prey. Be careful, as this attack can freeze you as well.
Frostfang Barioth.useful_information: Useful Information: Breaking both of its fangs will weaken its frosty breath. If flinched, it may shoot out a breath of ice upon recovering. Thaw out any icy patches on the ground with Torch Pods.

Basarios.hunter_notes:
Its thick, hardened shell is impervious to most attacks, making it tricky to approach, but if you can break its abdominal plating, you should be able to rip off its shell and deal some heavy hits. Attacks that produce heat will soften up the hide and make the job easier.Due to their weight, Basarios rely on relatively slow physical attacks, such as charges or rolls. They are also capable of expelling various gases from their belly: be it fire, poison or sleep, as well firing off flaming projectiles. However, do to their immature state, these ranged attacks are not always successful.
While the rocky hide of a Basarios is usually very tough, causing most attacks to bounce, whenever they perform a fire-based attack their hide will temporarily soften, making it more vulnerable to damage. Breaking their parts will permanently soften their armour.
Basarios are also capable of digging into the ground, emerging their back and digging towards their target. If their back comes into contact with a Barrel Bomb while digging, they will be flinched into a Pitfall Trap-like state.
Basarios.sightings: Basarios is found in the Sandy Plains and Lava Caverns.
Basarios.characteristics: These juvenile Gravios are famous for their rock-hard carapaces. They often burrow underground, mimicking rocks and savaging oblivious miners. Because their carapaces are tougher than that of a full-grown Gravios, they'll attack a threat by charging at it. They are also known to emit a poisonous gas.Its thick, hardened shell is impervious to most attacks, making it tricky to approach, but if you can break its abdominal plating, you should be able to rip off its shell and deal some heavy hits. Attacks that produce heat will soften up the hide and make the job easier.

Bazelgeuse.hunter_notes:
The formidable scales that the Bazelgeuse scatters explode after receiving an impact but the time they take to regenerate can be used as a chance to attack. When its scales turn red hot, they will explode immediately and require caution, however, parts of the body will be soft too - the perfect time to attack.Bazelgeuse attack by slamming and swiping with both their head and their tail. They are also capable of shooting fireballs as well as flying into and slamming down from the air. Most attacks from a Bazelgeuse will cause their head or tail to drop scales which remain in the ground before priming and exploding. Thrown scales will prime instantly if hit. One noteworthy attack involves Bazelgeuse flying over the hunter while dropping several scales below them, ending by crashing towards them. As they drop scales, Bazelgeuse’s supply will gradually drain, forcing them to replenish them by roaring.
When a Bazelgeuse enrages, the scales on their head and tail will glow orange, causing all thrown scales to be primed as soon as they are thrown.
Bazelgeuse.sightings: Bazelgeuse can be found in any locale.
Bazelgeuse.characteristics:
A nefarious flying wyvern that travels the world in search of prey. It scatters its own explosive scales over a wide area to prey on whatever gets caught in the blast. In some places, this has earned it the nickname "Bomber Wyvern.".The formidable scales that the Bazelgeuse scatters explode after receiving an impact but the time they take to regenerate can be used as a chance to attack. When its scales turn red hot, they will explode immediately and require caution, however, parts of the body will be soft too - the perfect time to attack.Bazelgeuse is a large Flying Wyvern that can be found in nearly any environment. Its back is covered with rock-like scutes, while the underside of its neck and tail sport protruding explosive scales. The “blasting scales” of the Bazelgeuse are not scales, rather they are formed by specialized glands located on the monster's neck and tail. These glands continuously secrete a unique fluid that hardens its exterior membrane, forming a blasting scale.[2] The scales can be dislodged from the Bazelgeuse's body, a process which happens naturally as the Bazelgeuse moves. When struck, jostled or simply exposed to the air for a long period of time, the scales detonate. Bazelgeuse is immune to the explosions caused by its own scales thanks to its incredibly resilient skin.[3] Even after scales are dropped, the glands continue to create new ones to ensure the monster always has access to its most powerful weapon.
Bazelgeuse's flight patterns are unique in that it relies primarily on gliding.[2] Its wings are sleek and wide, allowing it to glide silently while scouting for prey.
The teeth of Bazelgeuse are quite weak, and it lacks the bite force to tear tough hides. To compensate, the Bazelgeuse will pepper its food with its blasting scales to help break through the tough exterior of its prey.[2]
Bazelgeuse.behavior: Bazelgeuse are infamous for their habit of swooping in on any ongoing conflict in their vicinity, viewing any area they inhabit as their territory. The monster sees any other large monster in its territory as potential competitors for food, driving it to attack until the trespassing monster leaves or dies. Because Bazelgeuse and Deviljho, another widespread invader monster, share similar habits and temperament, it's not uncommon to see them locked in fierce combat.[4]

Seething Bazelgeuse.hunter_notes:
Keep an eye on their head and tail scales when they start glowing a phosphorescent white. These scales have a wide blast radius and are extremely dangerous. If left in this state for too long, Bazelgeuse will unleash a devastating blast attack that covers the entire area. To avoid this punishing attack, be aggressive and focus on the head and tail!Much like Bazelgeuse, Seething primarily attacks with both their head and tail, although some of their attacks are capable of creating immediate explosions. Unlike regular Bazelgeuse, Seething’s scales are glowing by default, causing any thrown scale to be immediately primed to explode. As they drop scales, Seething’s supply will gradually drain, forcing them to replenish them by roaring.
When Seething enrages, the scales on their head and tail will glow purple. In this state, they will throw off more scales with their attacks and these scales will explode in a larger radius. Eventually, Seething will fly into the air, raining scales below them before dive-bombing into the ground below them, exiting their enrage. Damaging either their head or tail enough will revert it into a non-glowing state, where thrown scales aren’t instantly primed. If both their head and tail are reverted, Seething will be knocked out of their enrage and will be toppled - their non-glowing scales will eventually return to normal.
Seething Bazelgeuse.sightings: Seething Bazelgeuse can be found in any locale.
Seething Bazelgeuse.characteristics: A Bazelgeuse variant whose body seems to smolder, like it could go critical at any moment. The heat of their explosive scales have grown, their pale blue glow worthy of the "Seething" moniker. Their scales are blisteringly hot in this state, capable of scorching the very earth with their volatile force..Keep an eye on their head and tail scales when they start glowing a phosphorescent white. These scales have a wide blast radius and are extremely dangerous. If left in this state for too long, Bazelgeuse will unleash a devastating blast attack that covers the entire area. To avoid this punishing attack, be aggressive and focus on the head and tail!

Diablos.hunter_notes: Diablos can be forcibly brought to the surface by using loud sounds. And its charging attack, while devastatingly powerful, can be baited into colliding with anthills, momentarily getting the Diablos stuck.Diablos primarily attack with their horns, mainly by charging towards the hunter to try and skewer them. While their horns are intact, hitting certain walls while charging will cause them to become temporarily embedded. They also frequently attack with their clubbed tail. While Diablos are incapable of flying, they can use their wings to burrow into the ground to ambush the hunter from below. Due to Diablos’ sensitive hearing, throwing a Sonic Bomb at them while they are underground will startle them into a Pitfall Trap-like state. However, this trick won't work when the monster is enraged.
Diablos.sightings: Diablos is found exclusively in the Sandy Plains.
Diablos.characteristics:
Known as the "Tyrant of the Desert." The Diablos is extremely territorial and will use its massive horns to charge at invaders. Diablos have the ability to burrow underground and use this ability to strike from below, however, their sensitive ears make them susceptible to Sonic Bombs. Despite their predatory appearance, they are herbivorous and mostly feed on cactus.Diablos can be forcibly brought to the surface by using loud sounds. And its charging attack, while devastatingly powerful, can be baited into colliding with anthills, momentarily getting the Diablos stuck.Diablos are powerful herbivores that live almost exclusively in harsh deserts. They display the body plan typical of Flying Wyverns: Short torsos held by two digitigrade legs, two arms modified into wings, a long tail, and a head at the end of a neck that extends forward. Most of the scales are in shades of light brown and tan except for its white underside and grey legs. The neck, body, and tail are bulkier than most flying wyverns. The tail ends with a huge club made from two hemispheres of fused osteoderms and plates. The legs are somewhat short but very muscular. Large plates protect the thighs, and the four toes on its feet end in blunt dark claws. The arms of Diablos are muscular and covered in osteoderms. Two robust digits still function like normal fingers and sport blunt claws perfect for digging.
The most striking features of Diablos are their two massive horns. They are incredibly thick and protrude forward and outwards from the top of the skull. Then they curve inwards towards the midline and the tips curve upwards. The exact shape and angle of these horns varies by individual. Some shapes are rare - and more valuable - than others.[3] Diablos Horns grow throughout the Wyvern's life, and older individuals tend to have notably longer horns.[4]
Diablos are protected by scaly plates that stay flat to the spine. On the sides, there is a line of dark gray osteoderms. The plates above the torso are the largest and slant upward. They are lined by blunt spikes similar to the frills. Larger scales protect the chest. This tan shell armor is extremely heavy and dense, providing ample defense against all manner of injury.[5] Continuous exposure to the harsh environments the Diablos live in and swirling sands hardens this shell as the Wyvern ages.[6] Some areas of the body can even harden so much that they receive a separate name: Diablos Carapace and Diablos Cortex.[7] The shell plate on Diablos' back is especially well developed, and is called a Ridge.[8] This immensely resistant plate is extremely sturdy and thus difficult to carve off.[9] Just like the rest of the shell, the Ridge of a Diablos also hardens over time, as sand and dust are baked onto it by the merciless sun. In the most extreme cases, these Ridges become near impenetrable - such Ridges are called Diablos Chine.[10]
The bone marrow of Diablos has powerful binding properties and can be used as an adhesive.[11] Like various other monsters, Diablos produce Dash Extract in their bodies to enhance their stamina.[12][13] The most valuable body part of a Diablos is its Diablos Medulla (sometimes also called a Blos Medulla). While extremely difficult to carve off without destroying it, this material is of great value to researchers.[14]
Like many burrowing monsters, Diablos have poor vision but a strong sense of hearing.[15] Sonic Bombs will cause one to surface from the sand and flail as if it were in a pitfall trap. Ironically, the roar of a Diablos is loud and high-pitched, disturbing other burrowing monsters like Delex[16]. Diablos have the strength to reshape the landscape around them[15].
Diablos.behavior:
Diablos are entirely herbivorous and predominantly feed on various species of cacti.[17] When one Diablos invades the territory of another, they will lock horns to engage in a shoving match until one is knocked over or concedes.[18] Diablos spend most of their time in large caves that they, or other Diablos, have dug. Due to their sensitivity to sound, they rarely leave their cave except to feed. Diablos leave their caves five to six times daily to feed. It does not search for water because it acquires all its moisture from cacti. They feed on the same patches of cacti each day. This is either because they choose cacti with the most water or the cactus that tastes the best[19]. Being so dangerous, Diablos has very few predators.
Mated pairs of Diablos will share a territory, but when a female Diablos is in heat or pregnant, she will turn into a Black Diablos. Her aggression reaches even greater heights and she will treat her mate as an intruder[20].
The Diablos of the New World are even more aggressive than individuals in the Old World. However, they are unaware their biggest enemies are the Carrier Ants which feed on cacti without the wyvern noticing. There are times when the cacti patches shrink because of the ants, forcing the Diablos to expand its territory further. The First Wyverians call Diablos the “Lord of the Wildspire Waste"[15].
Their excellent hearing makes Diablos quite sensitive to sounds. This includes natural sounds, such as the shriek of a startled Noios, which will cause Diablos to emerge from the sands violently.[21]

Apex Diablos.hunter_notes: An angry Apex Diablos will trigger a devastating move, launching into an unstoppable charge, bringing down everything that stands in its path. Push on against an enraged Apex to quickly rid it of its rage and steady its temper.
Apex Diablos.characteristics: A Diablos so mighty, it was crowned an Apex. Its body is covered in scars and wounds as if it had been caught in a storm, and it's seemingly always dominated by wrath and terror. Its well-developed horns add to the lethality of its charge. The call of an Apex unleashes its tortured anger on nearby beasts, driving them into a frenzy.An angry Apex Diablos will trigger a devastating move, launching into an unstoppable charge, bringing down everything that stands in its path. Push on against an enraged Apex to quickly rid it of its rage and steady its temper.

Black Diablos.hunter_notes:
Black Diablos, similar to Diablos, primarily attacks with her horns, with her horns also being able to be embedded in Wildspires if she charges into them. Her tracking charges are additionally capable of inflicting guaranteed Stuns as long as her horns are not broken. She can also use her wings to burrow into the ground to ambush the hunter from below, though due to her sensitive hearing throwing a Screamer Pod at them while they are underground will startle them into a Pitfall Trap-like state.
While in her nest in Area 14, Black Diablos are capable of burrowing into the falling sand before launching herself out of one of them.
If a Screamer Pod or Noios is set off in Area 8 enough times while a Black Diablos is in Area 13, it will trigger a unique environmental trap. The ground will shake for a moment before the Black Diablos will burst through the loose sand in the middle of the area, causing the depression there to collapse. All monsters or hunters standing near it will slide and fall down the hole into Area 13. Monsters will take damage and be toppled.
Black Diablos.sightings: Black Diablos is found primarily in the Wildspire Waste. They can also be found in the Desert region of the Guiding Lands from level 3 onwards.
Black Diablos.characteristics:
These black-shelled Diablos are actually female Diablos in heat. The color signals their aggressiveness and heightened hostility to other creatures in their habitat.Black Diablos are not true subspecies, they are female Diablos whose bodies have turned all black during the breeding season. Besides the color change, the Black Diablos’ appearance is identical to normal Diablos. They are bipedal flying wyverns with large wings and long tails. They have heavily armed heads. A frill extends from the skull, large teeth and tusks in the front of the mouth, and the two huge horns Diablos are known for. Thick armor plates protect the bulky body. The legs are strong. The wings are muscular and adorned with blunt claws. The thick tail ends in a massive club. The shell of a Black Diablos differs from that of a normal Diablos in composition and quality[2][4].
Being the same species as the regular Diablos, Black Diablos display the same regional variation that they do. Diablos found near Minegarde and Dundorma are relatively lean and their innermost toes point forward. Individuals found near Moga Village and Val Habar have innermost toes that point inward. Those found near Kamura and the New World are relatively bulky.
Black Diablos.behavior:
When pregnant, a female Diablos produces a surge of hormones that cause physical and behavioral changes. The black coloration serves as a signal to other Diablos that the female has already mated and as a warning to other creatures. It is also theorized that the darker coloration absorbs more sunlight. The heat raises her body temperature for the development of her eggs[5]. The color lasts until the brooding season[4].
Among the many changes in the Black Diablos’ behavior is her increased aggression. She may treat any creature as a threat to herself and attack accordingly. This aggression may even apply to her mate. A courted male and female will cohabit in a territory during the mating season. However, they will not cooperate in finding food or defense. The Black Diablos will instead engage in battle with the male as if they were fighting for territory. Sometimes one will break the other’s horn. Despite her increased vigilance during the gestation period, it is not confirmed if female Diablos care for their young[5].
Fortunately, Black Diablos are reclusive. They do not leave their caves except for food[5]. Regular Diablos prefer cacti with the highest moisture content, as that is where they acquire all of their water[6]. Black Diablos instead choose cacti with the most nutrients for their young[5]. They visit the same cactus patches five to six times a day [6].
Black Diablos fight similarly to regular Diablos but with greater aggression and cunning. It has been noted to circle its target and wait for the right time to attack[7]. It will attack opponents from below just like a normal Diablos. However, Black Diablos may violently launch themselves from the ground instead of pulling themselves out like normal (Note: in games where Black Diablos is absent, normal Diablos may gain this attack). Black Diablos utilize new methods of charging at opponents. It can charge with greater speed and with little warning. It will lean its body to turn in an arc while charging. Its most dangerous attack is when it scratches the ground with its feet while tracking its target’s movements. Then, it will suddenly charge as fast as possible[8].
Besides her cunning, Black Diablos also possesses increased physical strength. Capable of smashing through rock and monster alike, Black Diablos dominate over their arid habitat. Their strength and aggression are enough to ward off powerful monsters such as Deviljho[5]. Individuals who become Tempered rival Elder Dragons in physical power [2].
Black Diablos.useful_information: Useful Information: Diablos are much more aggressive against intruders when in heat, and are known to attack enemies in retreat. Do not let your guard down even if you think you've established a safe distance from these monsters.

Espinas.hunter_notes:
Characteristics: Flying Wyverns known for the red spikes on their tough green frame, forming both a means of attack and defense, thus generally keeping foes at bay. As a result, they are often seen sprawled out and relaxing in their domain. Once they sense danger, however, they expand their blood vessels to turn their hide and wing membranes a bright red, and they will run riot with noteworthy brutality. Their breath attacks are particularly annoying, inflicting poison, paralysis, and fireblight. Make sure you have resistance skills and ailment recovery items at the ready before the hunt. Espinas run riot with charge attacks when enraged, but the increased blood flow softens their flesh, so lay on the pain when you get the chance!
Threat Level: ★★★★★★★Espinas will begin the fight asleep in their nest. Unlike most monsters when asleep, Espinas requires multiple attacks to wake them up and are capable of swiping at the hunter while sleeping.
When awake, Espinas attacks primarily by biting and swiping their venomous horns around them. Breaking their parts will prevent their physical attacks inflicting Poison. Espinas are also capable of breathing fireballs, which not only deal fire damage but are also capable of inflicting both poison and paralysis. While their hide is normally very resistant to damage, upon enraging their hide will soften considerably.
Espinas.sightings: Espinas is found in the Shrine Ruins, the Citadel and Jungle.
Espinas.characteristics:
Flying Wyverns known for the red spikes on their tough green frame, forming both a means of attack and defense, thus generally keeping foes at bay. As a result, they are often seen sprawled out and relaxing in their domain. Once they sense danger, however, they expand their blood vessels to turn their hide and wing membranes a bright red, and they will run riot with noteworthy brutality.Characteristics: Flying Wyverns known for the red spikes on their tough green frame, forming both a means of attack and defense, thus generally keeping foes at bay. As a result, they are often seen sprawled out and relaxing in their domain. Once they sense danger, however, they expand their blood vessels to turn their hide and wing membranes a bright red, and they will run riot with noteworthy brutality. Their breath attacks are particularly annoying, inflicting poison, paralysis, and fireblight. Make sure you have resistance skills and ailment recovery items at the ready before the hunt. Espinas run riot with charge attacks when enraged, but the increased blood flow softens their flesh, so lay on the pain when you get the chance!
Threat Level: ★★★★★★★

Flaming Espinas.hunter_notes:
Characteristics: An Espinas subspecies with a slightly more muted body color. The boldness of the standard Espinas remains: run-of-the-mill attacks won't rouse Flaming Espinas from their slumber. Their breath attack contains a powerful poison, and a dense acid that deteriorates armor. Take this attack head on, and you won't stand a chance... Beware when Flaming Espinas stand up and spread their wings; they'll begin building up power to unleash a massive fireball attack with a wide area of effect. When they start charging up, escape to a safe distance. The fireball's explosive effects lower defense, so bring along items like Adamant Seeds to give it a boost.
Threat Level: ★★★★★★★★★Just like Espinas, Flaming will begin the fight asleep, requiring multiple attacks to wake them up and being capable of swiping at the hunter while sleeping.
When awake, Flaming will attack primarily by biting, generating flames around the mouth with each one, dragging their venomous thorns around them and shooting fireballs that will explode multiple times in front of them. All of their fire based attacks will also inflict poison and defense down. When enraged, they are capable of releasing an incredibly powerful fireball directly below them, almost guaranteeing a cart to any hunter afflicted with defense down. At low enough health, they can follow this nuke with a second weaker one from the air. While their hide is normally very resistant to damage, upon enraging their hide will soften considerably.
Flaming Espinas.sightings: Flaming Espinas is found exclusively in the Citadel, though their initial quest is in the Forlorn Arena.
Flaming Espinas.characteristics:
An Espinas subspecies with a slightly more muted body color. The boldness of the standard Espinas remains: run-of-the-mill attacks won't rouse Flaming Espinas from their slumber. Their breath attack contains a powerful poison, and a dense acid that deteriorates armor. Take this attack head on, and you won't stand a chance...Characteristics: An Espinas subspecies with a slightly more muted body color. The boldness of the standard Espinas remains: run-of-the-mill attacks won't rouse Flaming Espinas from their slumber. Their breath attack contains a powerful poison, and a dense acid that deteriorates armor. Take this attack head on, and you won't stand a chance... Beware when Flaming Espinas stand up and spread their wings; they'll begin building up power to unleash a massive fireball attack with a wide area of effect. When they start charging up, escape to a safe distance. The fireball's explosive effects lower defense, so bring along items like Adamant Seeds to give it a boost.
Threat Level: ★★★★★★★★★

Gigginox.characteristics:
Threat: ★★★★Gigginox are bizarre flying wyvern that display some visual similarities to leeches. They have the general body plan of a flying wyvern, but are covered in a smooth, moist hide which is white on the top and bright red on the underside. The head and tail look quite similar, being bulbous masses of tissue that end in a small hole.This feature is believed to be defensive camouflage aimed at confusing enemies about which part of the body to attack.[6] Their wings and large and leathery. While they can be used to fly, Gigginox mostly use their wingarms for a quadruped gait, similar to monsters like Tigrex. They are also capable of sticking to and walking on cave walls and ceilings.
The hides of Gigginox display various unique properties. The underside is covered in fine hairs,[7] possibly to aid with the wyvern's ability to walk on walls. This ability is further enhanced by the hide's constant secretion of specialized body fluids with adhesive properties, allowing for en even more secure hold on various surfaces.[4] It is believed that these body secretions also help with maintaining body temperatures.[8] This hide develops over the wyvern's life, and fully developed ones can entirely negate scents and odors on contact.[9]
The most obvious feature of Gigginox hide is its ability to change color. When enraged, the hide of a Gigginox will take on a dark hue and harden significantly.[10] This color change appears to be a consequence of the wyvern's venom production increasing as it becomes agitated, temporarily altering the surface of the skin in the process.[8] Curiously, if the hide of a Gigginox is removed while in this altered state, it will remain darkened permanently. Hide scraps retrieved in these conditions are called Uncanny Hides.[11]
Gigginox' eyes are believed to have fully degenerated as a result of live in near perpetual darkness. They instead survey their surroundings through a specialized organ that allows them to sense and track heat.[10] The wyvern's maw is flexible and full of needle-like teeth used to gradually grind down prey.[12]
A well-known and infamous feature of Gigginox is their ability to administer a powerful venom, either by spitting it out as a sludge or emitting it as a gas. This venom is produced in large, visible venom glands located on the head, abdomen and tail.[4] These glands filter out a portion of the wyvern's blood to synthesize it into venom.[8] As incredibly active organs, these glands never stop producing copious amounts of venom, using a specialized capillary system to circulate it across the entire body at all times. A notable quirk of Gigginox' venom glands is that they sometimes glow, which is especially noticeable in the dark. It is believed that this is bioluminescence resulting from the biochemical reaction that turns its blood into venom. The glow might also serve as a threat display.[4]
Gigginox are believed to be close relatives of Khezu.[13]
Gigginox.behavior:
Gigginox have so far only been sighted living in the Tundra.
These predatory wyvern hunt by detecting prey through their body heat and then incapacitating them with poison.[10] Once poisoned, prey is dragged into the Gigginox' cave and left to freeze solid, which is believed to function like a kind of cold storage.[4] This also has an additional benefit: The various corpses frozen into cave walls present a curiosity for other monsters to investigate, thus luring more prey into the clutches of the Gigginox.[8]
Outside of hunting, Gigginox spend most of their time sleeping while sticking to walls or ceilings, displaying an overall low level of activity.[4] They are generally solitary, but have been observed tolerating the presence of other Gigginox on occasion.[14] During especially harsh seasons, adolescent Gigginox have also been seen banding together and building large cocoon colonies to keep each other warm during their slumbers.[8]
Gigginox are hermaphrodites and reproduce asexually.[8] They are extremely fertile and can lay eggs near constantly, depositing them in large gelatinous sacs that hatch quickly.[10] Gigginox hatchlings are called Giggi and will seek out moist sheltered areas to protect the mucus layer on their sensitive skins.[8] While adults are only found in the Tundra, Giggi have been sighted in a large variety of biomes. It is believed that the high spawn rate of this species pushes juveniles to explore new territories.[4] The Hunter's Guild expects to eventually discover various Subspecies of Gigginox that have adapted to all the different environments these juveniles venture into.[8]

Baleful Gigginox.characteristics:
Threat: ★★★★The Baleful Gigginox shares many physiological features with the common Gigginox, but is distinguished by various unique characteristics.
While officially classified as a Subspecies, these mid-sized Wyverns are believed to actually be a random mutation in which the development of the external glands was altered, turning them into capacitor organs and causing them to produce electricity rather than toxins.[2] Additionally, the wyvern's calws and talons seem to maintain some degree of electric charge and the latter are currently being researched as an energy source.[3][4]
When enraged, a Baleful Gigginox's yellow hide will turn a deep red.
While the regular species is notoriously fertile, Baleful Gigginox have thus far never been spotted laying eggs or reproducing in any way.
Baleful Gigginox.behavior:
Like its common counterpart, the Baleful Gigginox is entirely endemic to the Tundra and is predominantly found lurking in the region's various caves. They are only seen quite rarely however.
Like the related Khezu, Baleful Gigginox are able to spit balls of electricity, which are generally used to stun prey.[2] On humans, these attacks cause paralysis as well as thunderblight. The sacs laid by Baleful Gigginox have never been witnessed containing eggs, instead always exploding into ionizing gases.

Gravios.hunter_notes:
Large wyverns found in Oilwell Basin. They have a developed physique, powerful heat rays, and a host of gases they can emit from their body. Their bony carapaces are famously tough but expose a surprisingly brittle interior once destroyed.
Helpful Hints: It’s no easy task breaking through that heavy armor covering a Gravios head to talon, but repeated attacks will eventually make a crack. That - and the weaknesses a Gravios exposes in its carapace during certain attacks - are your chances to deliver focus Strikes, demolish it piece by piece, and create even more opportunities.Due to their weight, Gravios rely on relatively slow physical attacks, such as charges, body slams and rolls. They are also capable of expelling various gases from their belly: be it fire, poison or sleep. They can also fire off powerful lava lasers from their mouth, either as sustained beams or as short bursts.
While their body armour normally makes them resiliant to most attacks, after performing certain attacks smoke will come out of parts of their body. This signals which parts of their body have become weak points for Focus Strikes. By breaking the armour on their chest, it becomes a permanent weakspot for damage. Breaking the armor on their back will prevent them from discharging fire gas after a laser beam.
Gravios.sightings: Gravios are primarily found in the Oilwell Basin, with Tempered individuals also being found in the Ruins of Wyveria.
Gravios.characteristics:
Hunters Notes: Large wyverns found in Oilwell Basin. They have a developed physique, powerful heat rays, and a host of gases they can emit from their body. Their bony carapaces are famously tough but expose a surprisingly brittle interior once destroyed.
Helpful Hints: It’s no easy task breaking through that heavy armor covering a Gravios head to talon, but repeated attacks will eventually make a crack. That - and the weaknesses a Gravios exposes in its carapace during certain attacks - are your chances to deliver focus Strikes, demolish it piece by piece, and create even more opportunities.
Gravios.useful_information: It’s no easy task breaking through that heavy armor covering a Gravios head to talon, but repeated attacks will eventually make a crack. That - and the weaknesses a Gravios exposes in its carapace during certain attacks - are your chances to deliver focus Strikes, demolish it piece by piece, and create even more opportunities.

Khezu.hunter_notes:
The Khezu will cling to walls or the ceiling to unleash its electric attacks from above. Use Wiredash to get to it and knock it down, or exhaust it to weaken its electricity.Khezu are relatively sluggish monsters, attacking by slowly lunging forward or by utilising their extendable neck. They are also capable of utilising the thunder element, both as defence bursts and by firing it off as paralysing projectiles. While they are enraged, Khezu will discharge electricity while lunging at the the hunter.
While inside caves, Khezu are also capable of clinging to both the walls and ceiling, attacking from there.
Khezu.sightings: Khezu is found in the Frost Islands and Lava Caverns.
Khezu.characteristics:
Loathsome wyverns that dwell in caves and other dark places. All but blind, Khezu hunt by smell. Their tail has evolved to cling to walls and ceilings. After using an electric shock to paralyze their prey, they extend their long neck and pounce.The Khezu will cling to walls or the ceiling to unleash its electric attacks from above. Use Wiredash to get to it and knock it down, or exhaust it to weaken its electricity.Khezu is a unique, pale flying wyvern, characterized by its long and elastic neck, which it uses to snatch prey while climbing on the ceiling of caves. Their body is generally plump with layers of fat, and unlike many monsters in the series, is not covered in scales, but in slimy flabby skin. [2] Eerily, its eyes have completely degenerated from its cavernous lifestyle,[2] and it lacks any ears or nostrils; only equipped with a single large mouth like leeches, marked with light red lips. When open, it reveals several unruly rows of triangular teeth placed in their large gums. It possesses a large round body, covered in a white pearlescent hide. From head to toe, the skin is plastered with pulsing veins of blue and red, with prominent arteries lined in its chest. Its back spine protrudes, making a noticeable ridge bump. It has regular-sized wings, used to climb walls and ceilings, but also fly short distances. The wing membranes are of a flesh-pink, and their 5 digits have nail-like claws that are of a sickly yellow. The third finger is conjoined with the fourth, similar to bird wings. It lacks talons and instead has webbed feet, together with suction pad toes like frogs, making wet platting sounds everytime it walks. Its short, stubby tails end in an extra orifice that are also lined with smaller teeth, which open up and "bite" onto the floor when using most of its electric abilities, as well as using it to hang from the ceiling.[1]
Like the Gypceros tail, Khezu's neck is rubbery and elastic, able to reach twice its body length, and is used for combat and eating. It can catch foes off guard with how long its neck can extend, and swoops its head around to knock them out. It is able to do this because most its neck vertebrae are made of cartilage, along with powerful muscles and flexible blood vessels.[1] Occasionally, it flies into the air to get through a cave shortcut, but they often use their wing claws and webbed feet to grip and crawl to other locations. Although it has no visible nostrils, it has a knack for smelling because of olfactory receptors around its mouth and is commonly seen sniffing its surroundings. It also utilises electroreception, which is where its moist hide comes to play. By using ambient humidity, it can 'see' targets when detecting electric signals from bodies, which is especially useful when Khezu lives in the cold wet caves. Inside its body is a thunder organ, capable of amplifying attacks with electricity and spitting electric projectiles. It can use these to paralyse its prey for an easy meal. When enraged, Khezu's veins and blood vessels start pulsating even faster, becoming more red. It is slow in its attacks, yet very sporadic. It can surround itself in thunder element, pushing away pesky opponents. It also likes to cry out its infamous roar, stunning anything around it.
Khezu.behavior:
Khezus are cave dwellers, frequently living in chilly locales like the Swamp and Frost Islands, specifically located near active sources of water to conduct electricity into their prey and maintain their damp skin.[4] Although they inhabit caves, they go out when they please, or when food inside grows too scarce. Outside the caves, they are vulnerable to larger Wyverns like Tigrex, who usually hang in the same areas as Khezu, but inside the caves, Khezu have the advantage as they are unhampered by the dark. Any sort of small animal will do for its diet, but it loves the typical Kelbi, as often seen in its ecological videos. It is not very hostile, due to the fact that it has no eyes and has to be near the vicinity of a hunter or monster to detect it. If the wyvern cannot detect prey, it will quite literally remain blind to their presence. Khezu are ambush predators, lying in wait near underground water sources or cave entrances waiting for unweary prey to enter their domain.[4] Thus, when walking past a Khezu, it likely would ignore you. However, if wandering too close, it will hunt you down. As they are not competitive or aggressive creatures, they do not have many turf wars and are not usually the apex of their area, often wandering only in caverns. Essentially, Khezu are not powerful monsters in their food chain and can often struggle to survive from other creatures like Zamtrios and Tigrex. Nerscylla, specifically its Shrouded subspecies, specializes in preying on Khezu and will wear their skin after eating the unfortunate wyvern. Khezu can sometimes be seen feasting on leftover corpses.
As hermaphrodites, Khezus are both male and female. They grow babies in their tail and to reproduce, and paralyze a warm-blooded creature with their electric spit and inject their young, known as Whelps. The Whelps grow inside their victim until it dies, or when they are strong enough to leave, similar to real-life parasitic creatures like the Tarantula Hawk.
Khezu's neck muscles weaken as they grow older, and their heads begin to droop. Once they reach a certain age where their heads are too weak to catch prey, they die.[4]
Khezu are also hypothesised to be the subspecies of the actual original but rarer Red Khezu, and their white skin may just be an albino genetic mutation, coincidentally landing them a better spot in the ecosystem as they can camouflage in the snowy areas they live in.

Legiana.hunter_notes: Legiana primarily attacks with their claws, slashing at the hunter, and with their tail, spinning it around them and slamming it into the ground. Their wings also makes them notably agile while in the air. They are also capable of expelling ice from their wings and tail, leaving behind patches of ice on the ground. These patches increase in size when Legiana is enraged.
Legiana.sightings: Legiana is found in the Coral Highlands and the Hoarfrost Reach. They can also be found in the Coral and Frozen regions of Guiding Lands from level 2 onwards.
Legiana.characteristics: The apex monster of the Coral Highlands, whose diet primarily consists of Raphinos. It emits a chilling wind from its body, which dulls its prey's ability to escape.
Legiana.useful_information: Useful Information: The membrane that covers its entire body enables Legiana to move with incredible speed. Damaging this membrane should help with slowing it down. Poison attacks have also been known to be effective.

Shrieking Legiana.hunter_notes:
Shrieking attacks in a similar manner to Legiana, namely with both their claws and their tail, with them being even more adept at aerial combat than the standard Legiana are. However, the majority of their attacks will alsoleave behind patches of ice which eventually erupt into icy spikes. By destroying the ice armour on their tail, talons and chest (which by extension covers their wings), attacks with these parts of their body will no longer leave behind ice spikes.
While a Legiana is present in the locale with them, Shrieking are capable of performing a special roar, immediatley causing the Legiana to head towards them.
Shrieking are particularly vulnerable to Poison, with them frequently stopping to vomit when afflicted with the status.
Shrieking Legiana.sightings: Shrieking Legiana is found primarily in the Hoarfrost Reach. They can also be found in the Frozen region of the Hoarfrost Reach from level 3 onwards.
Shrieking Legiana.characteristics: A Legiana variant shrouded in white frost. It specializes in freezing prey with the powerful chill it emits, then swooping down to strike at them from overhead.
Shrieking Legiana.useful_information: Useful Information: Sufficient damage can knock it out of the sky, and it is especially vulnerable while dive-bombing, making barrel bombs effective. Like other Legiana, poison also works well.

White Monoblos.characteristics:
Threat: ★★★★★White Monoblos are similar in physical appearance to the common species but display a drastically different coloration. Most of the White Monoblos is coated in chalky, white scale and shelling, save for the webbing of its wings, which, while still pale, is closer to the shade of the primary species's one, and a small hint of the same orange color breaking out on its beak. The white cortices of its shell are usually heavily scarred and chipped from years of combat, and undamaged examples are quite rare.[2] An undamaged White Monoblos horn has sometimes been likened to a work of art.[3]
Similarly to the base Monoblos, the head crest will become flush with patches of red when enraged.
White Monoblos.behavior: White Monoblos are considered more aggressive and violent than the common species.[4] As this monster is quite rare, little is known about it.

Nargacuga.hunter_notes:
Characteristics: Flying wyverns that have evolved to live in thickly wooded areas. Covered in jet black fur, these cunning predators stalk their prey from the shadows and attack with ferocious speed. Their massive tails are as dexterous as they are deadly, and powerful enough to slay smaller monsters with one strike. The Nargacuga is a beast of the shadows, and becomes enraged by bright light. At the risk of missing the mark and simply riling it up further, its excellent hearing can be exploited by throwing a Sonic Bomb as it pauses to focus. It can destroy Pitfall Traps, so be discreet when placing them.
Threat Level: ★★★★★★Nargacuga are highly mobile, frequently hopping to reposition around their target. They attack mainly using their long, muscular tail, which is also capable of firing off quills. A common move Nargacuga will perform is holding back one of their wings before pounce and their wings forward up to 3 times. However, due to their sensitive hearing, throwing a Sonic Bomb at them while they are readying this attack will topple them. Throwing a Sonic Bomb at them at any other time will flinch them, however this will cause the Nargacuga to immediately enrage afterwards.
While not enraged, Nargacuga are immune to Pitfall Traps, immediately hopping out of them if caught.
Nargacuga.sightings: Nargacuga is found in the Shrine Ruins, Flooded Forest and Jungle.
Nargacuga.characteristics:
Flying wyverns that have evolved to live in thickly wooded areas. Covered in jet black fur, these cunning predators stalk their prey from the shadows and attack with ferocious speed. Their massive tails are as dexterous as they are deadly, and powerful enough to slay smaller monsters with one strike.Characteristics: Flying wyverns that have evolved to live in thickly wooded areas. Covered in jet black fur, these cunning predators stalk their prey from the shadows and attack with ferocious speed. Their massive tails are as dexterous as they are deadly, and powerful enough to slay smaller monsters with one strike. The Nargacuga is a beast of the shadows, and becomes enraged by bright light. At the risk of missing the mark and simply riling it up further, its excellent hearing can be exploited by throwing a Sonic Bomb as it pauses to focus. It can destroy Pitfall Traps, so be discreet when placing them.
Threat Level: ★★★★★★

Lucent Nargacuga.hunter_notes:
Lucent Nargacuga conceal themselves using fog and moonlight during certain attacks. Look out for signs of attack and try to predict their movements. Careful when their tail bristles, they can launch tailspikes or unleash an array of other deadly tail attacks. Breaking the tailspikes will tame these ferocious moves.Lucent, much like Nargacuga, attack using their cutwings and their long tail. Uniquely, Lucent are capable of turning invisible before or during certain attacks, though they can still be targeted with the lock-on camera. Unlike Nargacuga, Lucent’s tail spikes are capable of inflicting Poison.
While enraged, Lucent is capable of extending the quills at the tip of their tail. In this state, some of their tail attacks with send of poisonous quills, with them as being able to send rains of poisonous quills around them. Damaging their tail tip enough will revert their quills to normal.
Much like Nargacuga, throwing a Sonic Bomb at them while they’re preparing to pounce will topple them, flinching and enraging them if thrown at any other time. While not enraged, they are also immune to Pitfall Traps.
After taking enough damage, Lucent will enter the 2nd phase of their fight, gaining access to new attacks and new combo paths for their old attacks. Lucent will always begin their 2nd phase by turning invisible and leaping around the hunter, ending by slamming their tail towards them.
Lucent Nargacuga.sightings: Lucent Nargacuga is exclusively fought in the Forlorn Arena.
Lucent Nargacuga.characteristics: Nargacuga clad in a radient fur that live in fog-shrouded lands. Lucent Nargacuga hide in the night's fog and moonlight, springing assaults with neither shape nor shadow. Astounding agility and marvelous mobililty make them difficult to capture with the naked eye. The throng of toxic tailspikes they launch make these wyverns perilous beasts indeed.Lucent Nargacuga conceal themselves using fog and moonlight during certain attacks. Look out for signs of attack and try to predict their movements. Careful when their tail bristles, they can launch tailspikes or unleash an array of other deadly tail attacks. Breaking the tailspikes will tame these ferocious moves.

Paolumu.hunter_notes:
While Paolumu is relatively weak while on the ground, after every attack they will attempt to suck in air, creating wind pressure in front of them. After sucking in air 5 times, their neck pouch will inflate and they will begin to float. While in the air, Paolumu will attack by slamming their tail and body onto the hunter and by spitting small cyclones. They are also capable of expelling air to reposition themself. Dealing enough damage to them will cause their neck-pouch deflate, knocking them back down to the ground.
While in their nest in Area 9, upon inflating, Paolumu will fly out one of their holes in the wall before flying out of bounds for a period of time, eventually flying back into the zone through a random other hole, attempting to ambush the hunter, deflating afterwards.
Paolumu.sightings: Paolumu is found primarily in the Coral Highlands. They can also be found in the Coral region of the Guiding Lands.
Paolumu.characteristics: Paolumu feast on eggs found in the Coral Highlands. They are able to float through the air using unique sacs in their bodies, and attack with their extremely hard tails.
Paolumu.useful_information: Useful Information: Paolumu can't move around as freely when its air sacs are deflated. Aim for its inflated body parts, or purposefully draw out its attacks that use up stored air, to gain the upper hand.

Nightshade Paolumu.hunter_notes:
Nightshade Paolumu will start the fight by immediately inflating their neck-pouch, causing the to start floating. While inflated, Nightshade is capable of spitting out Sleep-inducing clouds. They can also strike with their tail, with these attacks being capable of swatting these clouds forward and can cause the larger clouds to split into four.
Eventually Nightshade will spew out a large cloud of sleep below them, transitioning into a flying stance. Here, they are only capable of performing their flying tail attacks. While flying, they will periodically suck in air below them, pulling all sleep clouds in the area towards them and fusing them into one large cloud. After sucking in air 4 times, they will re-inflate. Damaging them enough while either floating or flying will knock them back down to the ground, where they will fight grounded for an extended period of time until they eventually re-inflate.
Nightshade Paolumu.sightings: Nightshade Paolumu is found in the Ancient Forest and the Wildspire Waste. They can also be found in the Desert region of the Guiding Lands, as well as the Forest region from level 2 onwards.
Nightshade Paolumu.characteristics: A Paolumu subspecies capable of putting prey to sleep. It produces a powerful sedative gas stored within its throat sac that it can expel and scatter to knock unwary foes out.
Nightshade Paolumu.useful_information: Useful Information: It uses tail swipes and other blows to bat its soporific breath into a target's path. Stubbornly airborne, this monster needs some "encouragement" to drop it to the ground.

Rathalos.hunter_notes:
Fearsome male wyverns known as the “Kings of the Skies.” Alongside the Rathian, they stake out a wide territory around their nest, and it is the male’s role to watch from above. Armed with powerful poisonous claws and fiery breath, Rathalos use their aerial prowess to descend on invaders.
Helpful Hints: As Kings of the Skies, Rathalos will attack with a variety of aerial strikes. A bright flash should be enough to disorient them and bring them down. When Rathalos are in trouble, their Rathian mates may swoop in to help, so be sure to have dung pods and large dung pods at the ready.Rathalos, while grounded, primarily attack by biting and shoot fireballs. However, Rathalos prefer to attack from the sky, lunging at the hunter with poisonous talons and using powerful flamethrower attacks. Damaging him enough while he is flying causes him to flinch in the air for an extended period of time, flinching him again will knock him out of the sky. Flash Bombs can also be used to instantly knock him out of the sky.
After shooting a fireball, Rathalos' mouth becomes a weak point for Focus Strikes.
Rathalos.sightings: Rathalos is found in the Scarlet Forest and the Oilwell Basin, with Tempered individuals also being found in the Ruins of Wyveria.
Rathalos.characteristics:
Hunters Notes: Fearsome male wyverns known as the “Kings of the Skies.” Alongside the Rathian, they stake out a wide territory around their nest, and it is the male’s role to watch from above. Armed with powerful poisonous claws and fiery breath, Rathalos use their aerial prowess to descend on invaders.
Helpful Hints: As Kings of the Skies, Rathalos will attack with a variety of aerial strikes. A bright flash should be enough to disorient them and bring them down. When Rathalos are in trouble, their Rathian mates may swoop in to help, so be sure to have dung pods and large dung pods at the ready.
Rathalos.useful_information: As Kings of the Skies, Rathalos will attack with a variety of aerial strikes. A bright flash should be enough to disorient them and bring them down. When Rathalos are in trouble, their Rathian mates may swoop in to help, so be sure to have dung pods and large dung pods at the ready.

Azure Rathalos.characteristics:
An azure-colored subspecies of Rathalos. More mobile than their standard cousins, they locate prey from the air and quickly swoop in for the kill.Azure Rathalos largely resemble the common Rathalos species, but display a few noteworthy differences.
The most obvious change is the coloration: Azure Rathalos are covered in a blue shell and sport green wing membranes, the exact shade of which can vary drastically between regional populations. Why and how this coloration came to be is still debated, but one hypothesis that has been brought forth suggests that it might be related to camouflage. The blue shell of an Azure Rathalos would make it blend into the skies when viewed from below, and the green membranes might help it not stick out when grounded in a forest.[4]
The shell is however not merely altered in color. It has also been noted to be much tougher than the red shells of common Rathalos, especially around the wings. This near adamantine armor offers superior protection and is also very heat resistant - a trait believed to enable the Azure Rathalos' extended presence in volcanic regions.[5]
The wings of Azure Rathalos are quite muscular and allow them to rule over the skies even better than their crimson relative.[5] They are excellent fliers, and the added armor on the wing arms and sturdier wing membranes reduce the risk of injury to the wings.[6]
Like their common relatives, Azure Rathalos possess both venom glands and fire sacs, which are used for poisonous talon swipes and flaming breath attacks respectively. The flame breath of Azure Rathalos is noted to be more variable in strength, with its potency increasing as the wyvern becomes angrier. This seems to be linked to an expansion of the lungs, resulting in increasingly violent air flow and temperature within the flame organs.[7]
Their increased physical strength and airborne agility do seem to come at a cost; Azure Rathalos have been observed slumping to the ground in exhausting after prolonged battle, implying reduced endurance and stamina compared with the common species.[5]
Which of these theories is likelier and what might have led to the evolution of Old World Azure Rathalos is currently unknown.
Azure Rathalos.behavior:
Azure Rathalos are consistently noted to be much more aggressive and irritable than the common Rathalos.[2] They have also been observed dominating and harassing their red relatives[5] and are believed to have an instinctual aggression towards them.[2] When engaging an enemy, Azure Rathalos attempt to overwhelm them with long combos of airborne attacks.[6]
Azure Rathalos pair up with Pink Rathian.[2] In the New World, Azure Rathalos spend most of the year in the Elder's Recess, but move down south to meet Pink Rathian and reproduce during the Mating Season. This migration is believed to be due to the fact that the sweltering heat and extreme competition in the Recess would make it a poor nesting ground, as it would pose a substantial risk to the hatchlings.[7]
Azure Rathalos.useful_information: Useful Information: Counter its airborne onslaught by observing its flight patterns and finding the right moment to knock it out of the sky. Once grounded, it loses its ability to perform consecutive attacks, making the fight much easier.

Silver Rathalos.hunter_notes: With deadlier aerial claw attacks than the standard Rathalos, Silver Rathalos also have a myriad of breath-based attacks. When in their Incandescent state, their breath attacks grow more potent, but their head also becomes weaker. Constant attacks to the head will knock them out of this enraged state, so focus your attacks there as you fight!Much like Rathalos, Silver attacks utilising his venomous talons and by shooting out fireballs and flamethrowers. He is still very agile whilst in the air, although he tends to prefer staying on the ground. After a while, Silver will roar into the air, entering his Incandescent state. In this state, his normally tough head will soften significantly, his flames increase in both size and power, and he becomes notably more adept at combo-ing his existing attacks together. Damaging his head enough will knock his out of this state. Breaking his head will permanently soften it.
Silver Rathalos.sightings: Silver Rathalos is found in the Shrine Ruins, Lava Caverns and the Citadel, though his initial quest is in the Forlorn Arena.
Silver Rathalos.characteristics: A rare species of Rathalos covered in shimmering silver scales. Known as the Silver Fire Wyvern, or alternatively the Silver Sun, as inspired by their majestic appearance. These wyverns are known for their fierce breath and even fiercer claws, giving these threatening beasts exceptional combat ability. In battle, their attacks grow only more intense when in their Incandescent state.With deadlier aerial claw attacks than the standard Rathalos, Silver Rathalos also have a myriad of breath-based attacks. When in their Incandescent state, their breath attacks grow more potent, but their head also becomes weaker. Constant attacks to the head will knock them out of this enraged state, so focus your attacks there as you fight!

Apex Rathalos.hunter_notes: An angry Apex Rathalos will trigger a devastating move, blasting a terrifying breath, destroying everything around it. Push on against an enraged Apex to quickly rid it of its rage and steady its temper.
Apex Rathalos.characteristics: A Rathalos so mighty, it was crowned an Apex. Its body is covered in scars and wounds as if it had been caught in a storm, and it's seemingly always dominated by wrath and terror. Its every breath releases flaming jets that singe the very air. The call of an Apex unleashes its tortured anger on nearby beasts, driving them into a frenzy.An angry Apex Rathalos will trigger a devastating move, blasting a terrifying breath, destroying everything around it. Push on against an enraged Apex to quickly rid it of its rage and steady its temper.

Rathian.hunter_notes:
Fire-breathing female wyverns known as the “Queens of the Land.” Their powerful legs and venomous tails make them efficient ground hunters. At times, Rathian and Rathalos can be sighted hunting as a couple. After laying eggs, Rathian are extremely watchful of their nests. Proceed with extra caution, as a mother will move swiftly to protect her young.
Helpful Hints: Hunters will need to maneuver carefully to avoid the potent venom in the Rathian’s tail spikes and her wide attack range. By severing the tail, you can limit her reach and gain the upper hand. After breathing fire, the inside of the Rathian’s mouth becomes tender, making it a prime target to strike.Rathian primarily attack by charging forward, backflipping into the air with her poisonous tail or by shooting fireballs. While not as adept as her mate, she is also capable of flying into the air to attack. By breaking the wings of a Rathian, she will occaisonally stumble while attemtping to take flight, leaving her on the ground. Severring her tail will remove its ability to inflict poison.
After shooting fireballs, Rathian's mouth will become a weak point for Focus Strikes.
Rathian.sightings: Rathian can be found in the Windward Plains, Scarlet Forest and Oilwell Basin.
Rathian.characteristics:
Hunters Notes: Fire-breathing female wyverns known as the “Queens of the Land.” Their powerful legs and venomous tails make them efficient ground hunters. At times, Rathian and Rathalos can be sighted hunting as a couple. After laying eggs, Rathian are extremely watchful of their nests. Proceed with extra caution, as a mother will move swiftly to protect her young.
Helpful Hints: Hunters will need to maneuver carefully to avoid the potent venom in the Rathian’s tail spikes and her wide attack range. By severing the tail, you can limit her reach and gain the upper hand. After breathing fire, the inside of the Rathian’s mouth becomes tender, making it a prime target to strike.
Rathian.useful_information: Hunters will need to maneuver carefully to avoid the potent venom in the Rathian’s tail spikes and her wide attack range. By severing the tail, you can limit her reach and gain the upper hand. After breathing fire, the inside of the Rathian’s mouth becomes tender, making it a prime target to strike.

Pink Rathian.characteristics: A subspecies with vibrant pink scales. Pink Rathians wield their toxic tails more deftly than normal Rathians, weakening prey with poison before moving in for the kill.
Pink Rathian.useful_information: Useful Information: Pink Rathians develop hard shells on different body parts compared to standard Rathians, particularly on their tails. If you're looking to sever it's tail, aim for the relatively soft tip of the tail.

Gold Rathian.hunter_notes: Gold Rathian will use their tail to greater effect compared to a standard Rathian, so watch out as their tail strikes will come at you from different ranges and trajectories. When in their Incandescent state, their tail attacks grow fiercer, but their heads also grow weaker. Constant attacks to the head will knock them out of this enraged state, so focus your attacks there as you fight!Much like Rathian, Gold attacks utilising her venomous tail and shooting out fireballs. After a while, Gold will roar into the air, entering her Incandescent state. In this state, her normally tough head will soften significantly, the size and power of her fireballs is increased, and she becomes notably more adept at utilising her tail in combat. Damaging her head enough will knock her out of this state. Breaking her head will permanently soften it.
Gold Rathian.sightings: Gold Rathian is found in the Shrine Ruins, Sandy Plains, Flooded Forest, Lava Caverns and Jungle, though her initial quest is in the Forlorn Arena.
Gold Rathian.characteristics: A rare species of Rathian covered in shimmering golden scales. Known as the Gold Fire Wyvern, or alternatively the Golden moon, as inspired by their divine appearance. These wyverns are infamous for their strong scales and attacks with their reinforced tails, giving these beasts exceptional combat ability. In battle their attacks grow only more intense when in their Incandescent state.Gold Rathian will use their tail to greater effect compared to a standard Rathian, so watch out as their tail strikes will come at you from different ranges and trajectories. When in their Incandescent state, their tail attacks grow fiercer, but their heads also grow weaker. Constant attacks to the head will knock them out of this enraged state, so focus your attacks there as you fight!

Dreadqueen Rathian.characteristics:
Threat: ★★★★★Dreadqueen Rathian resemble regular individuals in their rough body shape, but display some significant differences. The scales and shells of a Dreadqueen are a dark green with purple hues, quite unlike the pure green seen in normal Rathian. The tail tip is also much spikier, growing larger and denser bundles of spines.
Dreadqueen Rathian appear to have a highly increased rate of poison production, and the poison created in their bodies is also several degrees more deadly than regular Rathian poison. This improved poison can also hang around in the air in gaseous form after it has been expelled. The tail spikes also detach from the tail tip quite easily, impaling the ground and oozing out both liquid and gaseous poison into their immediate surroundings.[3] A Dreadqueen's poison production is so extreme that the compounds leak into every part of its body, seeping into its shell and oozing from the gaps between its scales - this is believed to be the reason for their coloration.[4] As a result, Dreadqueen Scales are incredibly poisonous to the touch[5] and can only be handled by highly skilled blacksmiths.[6]
Dreadqueen Rathian.behavior:
Very little is known about the Dreadqueen Rathian's behavior.
On rare occasions, these Deviants have been observed spending time alongside their regular counterparts.[7] The origin and purpose of this behavior is unknown.

Apex Rathian.hunter_notes: An angry Apex Rathian will trigger a devastating move, spraying poisonous thorns wherever they land. Push on against an enraged Apex to quickly rid it of its rage and steady its temper.
Apex Rathian.characteristics: A Rathian so mighty, it was crowned an Apex. Its body is covered in scars and wounds as if it had been caught in a storm, and it's seemingly always dominated by wrath and terror. Its tail oozes a venom far deadlier than any of a normal monster. The call of an Apex unleashes its tortured anger on nearby beasts, driving them into a frenzy.An angry Apex Rathian will trigger a devastating move, spraying poisonous thorns wherever they land. Push on against an enraged Apex to quickly rid it of its rage and steady its temper.

Rey Dau.hunter_notes:
The flying wyvern that reigns supreme over the Windward Plains' ecosystem. It has adapted to the Sandtide - when it most frequently appears - and is able to store, amplify and discharge the storm's heavy lightning to lethal effect. Rey Dau is highly territorial and will attack any and all intruders on sight. The fulgurite against its carapace emits a sound that puts every monster in the region on guard.
Helpful Hints: When a Rey Dau's wing or tail touches the ground while charged, it causes a reaction that produces a mantle of fulgurite. Not only does this widen the appendage's attack range, but it also increases the monster's charging capacity - so make a point of breaking these parts. Their heads may also be vulnerable after a discharge attack. Hunters are advised to bring thunder-resistant armor and water-based weaponry.Rey Dau primarily fights by slashing and slamming their wings, which can be done from both the ground and the air. Its horns can be folded in front of its face, allowing for charged stabs and firing off bolts of lightning. As it uses physical attacks with its wings and tail, these parts will become coated in Fulgurite crystals, increasing the range of its electrical attacks. These crystals can be shattered off their body with enough damage. Rey Dau's tail can not be coated in Fulgurite if it is severed.
Eventually Rey Dau will charge up its body with electricity, causing its horns to glow brightly and its wings and tail to immediatley become coated in Fulgurite glass. This state allows Rey Dau to fire even deadly lightning bolts, however they can be knocked out of it by dealing enough damage to the Fulgurite crystals covering their body.
While in its nest in Area 17, Rey Dau's electrically charged attacks will electrify the Fulgurite lining the ground, creating delayed aftershocks. However, the area has a pillar that can be pulled down to generate Grounding Pod ammo for the slinger (and damage Rey Dau), allowing one to temporarily neutralize the ground's ability to conduct electricity.
Rey Dau is immune to Great Thunderbugs and Shock Traps due to its adaptations to the Sandtide and its lightning.
After their charged lightning beams, Rey Dau's folded out horns become a weak point for Focus Strikes. Successfully landing a Focus Strike on their horns during this windows will immediately topple it, however there is a cooldown for this interaction.
Rey Dau.sightings: Rey Dau is only found in the Windward Plains and is primarily active in the Sandtide, although it can rarely be found in other weather conditions.
Rey Dau.characteristics:
Hunters Notes: The flying wyvern that reigns supreme over the Windward Plains' ecosystem. It has adapted to the Sandtide - when it most frequently appears - and is able to store, amplify and discharge the storm's heavy lightning to lethal effect. Rey Dau is highly territorial and will attack any and all intruders on sight. The fulgurite against its carapace emits a sound that puts every monster in the region on guard.
Helpful Hints: When a Rey Dau's wing or tail touches the ground while charged, it causes a reaction that produces a mantle of fulgurite. Not only does this widen the appendage's attack range, but it also increases the monster's charging capacity - so make a point of breaking these parts. Their heads may also be vulnerable after a discharge attack. Hunters are advised to bring thunder-resistant armor and water-based weaponry.The Rey Dau is the largest Flying Wyvern wherein flight capabilities are not reduced, distinguishing it from other giant species such as Barioth or Diablos, and is exceeded in wingspan only by the Bazelgeuse. The yellow shells covering the length of the head, body, forearm, talons, and thigh are adorned by enlarged, backward-facing spines protruding from the sides and center; the length of these spines and overall shape of the shells varies considerably between arrangements. They are highly conductive, and react with the Fulgurite dust in its environment to form a coat of armor that produces a distinct, threatening sound when the spines scrape against each other during motion.[2][3][4]
Its skull is stout and short, and characterised by two pairs of horns, which are covered in an armor of conductive carapace and supported by powerful muscles at their base that allow them to be moved freely.[5] The primary pair grows from the sides of the cranium and points outward at rest, while the smaller secondary pair is attached to the mandibles and points forward. By folding the primary horns over its snout, a Rey Dau is able to utilize them as a thrusting weapon or discharge large amounts of stored electricity, producing powerful lightning strikes.[6] A set of spined, deep indigo scales line the side of the Rey Dau's neck, which extrude and glow when large amounts of electricity are channeled to the Monster's horns for an attack.
Like certain other Flying Wyvvern species such as the Rathian and Rathalos, the Rey Dau feeds by tearing chunks of flesh from its prey using its beaked jaws while restraining it with its anisodactyl hindfeet. The four toes on each foot are slender and muscular, with the three facing forward curling so that only the proximal and distal interphalangeal joints touch the ground when walking, while the proportionally shorter, backward-facing toe is straight, and only touches the ground with the tip. The talons on the foreward facing toes are thin and curved, with the middle toe having the largest, followed by the straight claw on the backward toe, then those on the outer, and then inner.
The forelimbs of the Rey Dau are two fingered, of which the primary forms an exceptionally large enlongated talon, while the other serves as the attachment point for its wing membrane. This membrane is decorated by a striking pattern of dark blue stripes, with the yellow deepening to orange at its length, and unlike in many other Flying Wyrens is not supported by any additional fingers or rods of cartilage or bones. The talon is sheathed in sharp protruding scales that form a blade on its edge.
The tail is long, and coated in particularly large, spiked scales, with the largest pair forming a fork at the tailend. When the talons and tail are dragged are charged with electricity and dragged through the sands, a reaction occurs that fuses Fulgurite to the scales, forming a mantle of jagged armor that enhances Rey Dau's electrical charging capacity further and enlarges the coated appendages.[7][2]
A Rey Dau's entire body is highly conductive to electricity, a trait in part owed to the complex patterns and shapes found in its scales and carapace, but while the discharged electricity originates from its organs, it's unclear if the Monster itself is capable of producing any significant amounts by itself, or absorbs it all from the powerful thunderstorms that characterize the Sandtide.[3][4] Notably, the Rey Dau is completely unaffected by outside sources of electricity.
Rey Dau.behavior:
Rey Dau is extremely territorial and instantly aggressive towards any intruders in its turf, attacking them on sight.
Ray Dau appears to hunt primarily during the Sandtide, the Inclemency period of the Windward Plains, and can be seen snatching Ceratonoth away to its nest. Due to its power and aggression, Monsters endemic to the region are deterred by the noise produced by its coat of Fulgurite armor alone.
Rey Dau.useful_information: When a Rey Dau's wing or tail touches the ground while charged, it causes a reaction that produces a mantle of fulgurite. Not only does this widen the appendage's attack range, but it also increases the monster's charging capacity - so make a point of breaking these parts. Their heads may also be vulnerable after a discharge attack. Hunters are advised to bring thunder-resistant armor and water-based weaponry.
