Seregios.hunter_notes: When battling Seregios, watch out for flanking aerial movements, and vicious hind leg attacks. The razor-like scales they launch from all over their body can inflict Bleeding if too many connect, increasing future damage as you attack or evade. Make sure you go in knowing how to deal with this status.Seregios attacks primarily with their powerful hind-legs, often flying into the air beforehand and lunging at their target. They are also capable of firing off blade-scales from their head, wings and tail which linger on the ground and inflict Bleeding on contact.
Seregios.sightings: Seregios is found in the Shrine Ruins, Sandy Plains and the Citadel.
Seregios.characteristics: Large Flying Wyverns with sharp, blade-like scales covering their body, Seregios are well-known as extremely territorial and belligerent creatures, wielding their aerial mobility and powerful hind leg attacks in intense combat against other large monsters. Reports have confirmed that Seregios have the ability to launch the scales from their body, inflicting their victims with the Bleeding status.When battling Seregios, watch out for flanking aerial movements, and vicious hind leg attacks. The razor-like scales they launch from all over their body can inflict Bleeding if too many connect, increasing future damage as you attack or evade. Make sure you go in knowing how to deal with this status.

Tigrex.hunter_notes:
Characteristics: Flying wyverns whose primitive origins are obvious. Prone to violence, they display incredible ferocity with their claws, jaws, and developed limbs. They inhabit a wide area searching for prey, and have even been spotted in regions of harsh cold. The Tigrex's charge is swift, vicious, and far-reaching. During the hunt, keep to its side to stay outside its range; let it keep charging and eventually it will tire and slow down, opening itself up to your counterattack.
Threat Level: ★★★★★★★Being entirely flightless, Tigrex attacks by charging forward, able to re-adjust their aim towards the hunter and being able to combo their charge into various different attacks. Additionally, they can bite forward and fling boulders with their forearms, the boulders inflicting different elemental blights depending on the terrain. Tigrex’s roars are also capable of dealing damage if too close.
Tigrex.sightings: Tigrex is found in the Frost Islands, Sandy Plains, Lava Caverns and the Citadel.
Tigrex.characteristics:
Flying wyverns whose primitive origins are obvious. Prone to violence, they display incredible ferocity with their claws, jaws, and developed limbs. They inhabit a wide area searching for prey, and have even been spotted in regions of harsh cold.Characteristics: Flying wyverns whose primitive origins are obvious. Prone to violence, they display incredible ferocity with their claws, jaws, and developed limbs. They inhabit a wide area searching for prey, and have even been spotted in regions of harsh cold. The Tigrex's charge is swift, vicious, and far-reaching. During the hunt, keep to its side to stay outside its range; let it keep charging and eventually it will tire and slow down, opening itself up to your counterattack.
Threat Level: ★★★★★★★

Brute Tigrex.characteristics: Blackish brown scales and a stronger roar set this Tigrex subspecies apart. Extremely aggressive, even by Tigrex standards.
Brute Tigrex.useful_information: Useful Information: As with its standard cousins, it will tire after repeated charges, so attempt to bait them out. Breaking its head is an effective way to weaken the monster's roar

Almudron.hunter_notes:
The mud-covered tail is what makes this species strong; attacking this outer layer will chip away at it, so removing this muddy shroud should be your priority. The gold-glimmering mud is harmful to the touch, so mind the color of your surroundings while hunting these beasts.Almudron primarily attacks with their massive tail, slamming it forward and swinging it around themself. They will also use their tail to fling off waves of mud that leave behind mud piles that hinder movement. When the monster is enraged, these mud piles turn golden and will damage anyone who stands in them. Their mud attacks are also capable of creating mud structure that can be stood on for attacks and be used to block their mud waves. In certain areas, they can even create 4 massive pillars of mud to act as obstacles.
While enraged and after performing their spiralling mud wave, Almudron will pick up a ball of mud in their tail, increasing the range and damage of their tail’s attacks. Eventually, Almudron will slam this mudball down onto the hunter, destroying it in the process. Damaging the mudball enough before this point will destroy it and topple the monster. Alternatively, throwing a Flash Bomb will cause them to immediately drop it.
While standing on water, Almudron is capable of partially submerging themself for extended periods of time.
Almudron.sightings: Almudron is found in the Shrine Ruins, Sandy Plains and Flooded Forest.
Almudron.characteristics: As its name implies, Almudron spends a great deal of time lurking in mud - at least until it emerges to smother approaching prey. From its tail oozes a strange golden fluid, which Almudron uses to dissolve the ground beneath its prey, arresting them in a mire so that it can drag them under. When enraged, it produces more fluid, turning the mud golden. When you see gold, watch out!The mud-covered tail is what makes this species strong; attacking this outer layer will chip away at it, so removing this muddy shroud should be your priority. The gold-glimmering mud is harmful to the touch, so mind the color of your surroundings while hunting these beasts.

Magma Almudron.hunter_notes:
Characterized by raging attacks using the magma rock on their tail. A larger rock means more powerful attacks. Attacking the tail can cause the rock to explode, causing damage. Enters a heated, softer state when preparing a rock or after moving around underground, marking the perfect time to attack.Much like Almudron, Magma primarily attacks using their tail. Instead of flinging off waves of mud, Magma instead sends off faster moving waves of lava, typically in groups of 3. Whenever Magma dives into the ground to attack, their head and arms will soften and take more damage, however these parts of their body become able to deal fire damage.
When enraged, Magma will automatically perform their spiralling lava wave, picking up a ball of lava in their tail, increasing the range and damage of their tail’s attacks. When Magma exits their enrage, they will slam this lava-ball down onto the hunter, destroying it in the process. Damaging the lava-ball enough before this point will destroy it and topple the monster, though they will typically pick up another shortly after. While enraged, they are also capable of performing more attacks while submerged in the ground, these attacks creating rock platforms that can be stood on, though they will eventually explode.
Magma Almudron.sightings: Magma Almudron is found exclusively in the Lava Caverns.
Magma Almudron.characteristics: Unlike normal Almudron, Magma Almudron live in the Lava Caverns, and can manipulate magma instead of mud. They secrete a special liquid that melts the ground, allowing them to move freely though the earth. Known for their aggressive nature, they become extremely agitated when trespassers set foot on their turf, attacking them unrelentingly.Characterized by raging attacks using the magma rock on their tail. A larger rock means more powerful attacks. Attacking the tail can cause the rock to explode, causing damage. Enters a heated, softer state when preparing a rock or after moving around underground, marking the perfect time to attack.

Balahara.hunter_notes:
Desert-dwelling leviathans that build carapaces out of fulgurite formed by lightning strikes. They use their flexible skeletons and serpentine bodies to create quicksand traps for unwary prey. Inside their mouths are multiple eye-like sensory organs. The mucus they secret contains luminous bacteria and is believed to aid visibility while they are submerged and other low-light conditions like sandstorms.
Helpful Hints: The interior of a Balahara's mouth is a soft target that can be exploited if you strike right after it expels mucus. Since they rely on heightened hearing while submerged, sonic bombs or screamer pods - obtainable from Baunos - are highly effective. Sometimes the large monster you're hunting will get sucked into a Balahara sand pit...but there's nothing stopping you from going after it.Balahara primarily attacks by biting, firing mucus from its mouth, and using its tail like a lance to stab its target. Balahara are also capable of burrowing underground, leaping at the hunter before eventually emerging. In certain areas, while underground, they are also capable of creating large pools of quicksand that pull hunters towards its center. If Balahara is hit by a Screamer Pod while underground, they will forced out of the ground and into a Toppled state.
Balahara are capable of climbing onto the various Fulgurite pillars to unleash attacks from. The ones present in its nest in Area 15 will weaken when they are climbed on, allowing for them to be collapsed with the slinger's claw, causing Balahara to fall to the ground for massive damage and a knockdown.
After its charge mud spit, Balahara's mouth becomes a weak point for Focus Strikes.
Balahara.sightings: Balahara is only found in the Windward Plains.
Balahara.characteristics:
Hunters Notes: Desert-dwelling leviathans that build carapaces out of fulgurite formed by lightning strikes. They use their flexible skeletons and serpentine bodies to create quicksand traps for unwary prey. Inside their mouths are multiple eye-like sensory organs. The mucus they secret contains luminous bacteria and is believed to aid visibility while they are submerged and other low-light conditions like sandstorms.
Helpful Hints: The interior of a Balahara's mouth is a soft target that can be exploited if you strike right after it expels mucus. Since they rely on heightened hearing while submerged, sonic bombs or screamer pods - obtainable from Baunos - are highly effective. Sometimes the large monster you're hunting will get sucked into a Balahara sand pit...but there's nothing stopping you from going after it.Balahara is a serpentine, worm-like Leviathan with a slender beige body covered in hard black scales and padded shells, grown through the absorption of Fulgurite present in its habitat.[2] It has four stubby limbs and a drill-like tail that it uses to propel itself at great speeds through sand and stab at enemies.[3] Its head is pointed and covered in larger shells, while its jaw has a unique tripartite structure that folds outwards when opening its mouth, with numerous sharp teeth resembling drill bits used for mining, and rows of blue, eye-like sensory organs lining the edges. These "eyes" are capable of normal sight, although it primarily relies on senses like hearing and smell in low-light environments, such as caves or sandstorms.
The insides of their throat have a luminescent bluish-teal glow, provided by the bacteria in the mucus they secrete; this is believed to aid their visibility during sandstorms or tunneling. This mucus is also expelled from its mouth as a means to attack, resembling a dark blackish-green fluid when not glowing, and coats its body to give it more maneuverability.
Using its flexible skeleton and powerful tail, Balahara is able to maneuver around uneven terrain and swiftly tunnel through sand and bedrock, protected by its hard scales and skull.[4][5] It is also able to loosen the sand it digs through and create pits of quicksand that can trap prey and suck them below the surface.
Balahara take ore into their bodies through unknown means, and refine it over the course of many years into lustrous black pearls.[6]
Balahara.behavior: Balahara appear to be ambush predators who lure their prey into quicksand traps and suck them into their lairs to be devoured, although they have also been seen actively pursuing prey. They have been observed hunting both by themselves and in larger packs. Balahara appear to be more active during the Fallow and Sandtide compared to the Plenty.
Balahara.useful_information: The interior of a Balahara's mouth is a soft target that can be exploited if you strike right after it expels mucus. Since they rely on heightened hearing while submerged, sonic bombs or screamer pods - obtainable from Baunos - are highly effective. Sometimes the large monster you're hunting will get sucked into a Balahara sand pit...but there's nothing stopping you from going after it.

Hirabami.hunter_notes:
Leviathans that inhabit the Iceshard Cliffs. They have sharp, pincer-like tails and peculiar membrans on their necks that catch the wind and keep them aloft. Hirabami can sometimes be sighted nesting in groups along the cliffs, using their scales or foreclaws to cling to walls or ceiling while they sleep.
Helpful Hints: Hirabami can remain aloft as they mauever skillfully between the ground and the sky. You'll need to watch out for those tail claws, but handle an attack well to turn it into a counterstrike opportunity. Destroying the membrane on their necks will lower their guards while aloft. Furthermore, you can target the membrane wound to knock them out of their air, making this a prime target.Due to the membrane on their neck, Hirabami are capable of floating in mid-air, attacking with their claw-like tail and by shooting ice shots capable of freezing the hunter in place. Breaking their head causes Hirabami to take longer when getting back in the air and destroying any wounds on either their head or their tail will instantly topple the monster.
After shooting out ice, Hirabami's mouth will become a weak point for Focus Strikes.
Hirabami.sightings: Hirabami are primarily found in the Iceshard Cliffs, with tempered individuals also being found in the Ruins of Wyveria. While in the Iceshard Cliffs, they are often encountered in groups of 3.
Hirabami.characteristics:
Hunters Notes: Leviathans that inhabit the Iceshard Cliffs. They have sharp, pincer-like tails and peculiar membrans on their necks that catch the wind and keep them aloft. Hirabami can sometimes be sighted nesting in groups along the cliffs, using their scales or foreclaws to cling to walls or ceiling while they sleep.
Helpful Hints: Hirabami can remain aloft as they mauever skillfully between the ground and the sky. You'll need to watch out for those tail claws, but handle an attack well to turn it into a counterstrike opportunity. Destroying the membrane on their necks will lower their guards while aloft. Furthermore, you can target the membrane wound to knock them out of their air, making this a prime target.Hirabami are medium sized purple leviathans with long, flat bodies, and speckled teal spots on their greyish underbellies. Their stubby forelegs have small fins on the lower half and terminate in two talons each, one being greatly elongated and hook-like, while their hind legs are spindly and have webbed digits. The monster primarily slithers to move around on land, only using its small limbs for leverage or grip. Their bodies are extremely flexible, being able to contort, fold, and roll up with no difficulty, while their pliable cloth-like purple hide has insulating properties.[2] They are known to periodically shed their skin, leaving behind the remains as Hirabami Moltings.
Hirabami have pointed, bony heads with beady yellow eyes, along with a tripartite jaw that folds outwards when they open their mouths. The insides of their mouths are teal in color and lined with many sets of small, blunt teeth, and have a tube-like orifice at the bottom, from which Hirabami can spit a freezing fluid to immobilize prey.
Hirabami have a two-layered elastic membrane on their neck that is able to flare out into a large hood-like structure.[3] When expanded, this lightweight membrane catches and modulates the strong wind currents in their habitats, allowing them to hover in place and fly through the air.[4] They can maintain stable flight even in extreme weather,[5] but even in regions without strong wind, like the Wounded Hollow, Hirabami still demonstrate the ability to hover relatively freely. Their scales are sturdy yet small and extremely light, aiding their ability to float.[6]
The Hirabami's flat, ribbonlike tail accounts for the majority of its body length, and has a teal underside lined with many rows of pincer-like claws, which oscillate like swimmerets while folded. At the end of its tail are several pairs of much larger barbed claws which serve as the Hirabami's main means of hunting, with it using them to immobilize and cut apart prey.[7]
Hirabami.behavior:
Hirabami are pack hunters, often surrounding prey in groups of 3. They will also nest in groups by clinging to surfaces using their scales or foreclaws as they sleep.[4]
They are known to get into territorial disputes with other predators in the Iceshard Cliffs, such as Blangonga and Jin Dahaad.
Hirabami.useful_information: Hirabami can remain aloft as they mauever skillfully between the ground and the sky. You'll need to watch out for those tail claws, but handle an attack well to turn it into a counterstrike opportunity. Destroying the membrane on their necks will lower their guards while aloft. Furthermore, you can target the membrane wound to knock them out of their air, making this a prime target.

Jin Dahaad.hunter_notes:
A leviathan that sits at the peak of the Iceshard Cliffs' ecosystem. It surrounds its massive form in cold temperatures via ridge-like cooling organs across its body; the frost its limbs produce doubles as a potent weapon and a way to travel along walls and floating rocks.
Helpful Hints: Every part of Jin Dahaad's massive body is capable of powerful freezing attacks. Diminish their offensive capabilities by attacking the ridges that they use for cooling. The largest ridges on their back are particularly powerful and should be destroyed, but the hide there is very tough unless the other ridges are dealt with first.The battle with Jin Dahaad takes place over three (four in its proper quest) areas that it moves between at health intervals. The first and second areas are largely nondescript, with Jin Dahaad using powerful physical attacks from their forelimbs and tail that kick up icy debris around them, as well as ice breath attacks from its mouth, with it being able to use more powerful ice breaths from the second area onwards. The second area will always have three resting Hirabami that, if awakened, will interfere with the fight by attacking Jin Dahaad for a brief time before leaving.
The four iceplates distributed across their body (Cranial, Abdominal, Tail and Large) can be broken. Breaking their Large, Abdominal and Tail iceplates will weaken their forelimbs, hindlimbs and tail's ability to release freezing air respectively. The Large Iceplate will be frozen over and nearly immune to damage until all three other Iceplates are broken, with breaking it additionally disabling their use of their nova. Attacking and breaking Jin Dahaad's legs can knock it down and allow better access to the iceplates. Players that deal enough damage to Jin Dahaad will draw its aggro, indicated by a red line connecting them to the monster similar to that caused by a Luring Pod.
In the third area, there will be several collapsible walls that can be brought down onto Jin Dahaad , floating rubble that can be knocked down to damage Jin Dahaad and provide temporary cover from its attacks, and several crumbling structures that Jin Dahaad can climb onto before launching ice breath attacks. The crumbling structures will gradually weaken as Jin Dahaad  clings to them, until they can be collapsed with the slinger's claw to send Jin Dahaad falling back down for massive damage and a knockdown. It will also periodically use a special attack where it begins sucking in air, dealing continuous chip damage to hunters, before releasing a zone-spanning ice explosion that deals immense damage. Hunter can avoid this attack by dropping the rubble from the top of the arena and using it as cover from the blast.
In its Slay quest, Jin Dahaad will move to a fourth area once its health is low enough. This area is largely the same as the third except lacking the crumbling walls. Jin Dahaad uses a similar moveset to its third phase, but behaves more aggressively and gains a new attack where it crystallizes its surroundings, inflicting Frostblight.
Unusually for a non-Elder Dragon, Jin Dahaad cannot be captured. It remains vulnerable to Shock Traps, but is immune to Pitfall Traps.
Jin Dahaad has numerous weak points for Focus Strikes that appear at specific points in time:
Jin Dahaad.sightings: Jin Dahaad is only found in the Iceshard Cliffs, and is primarily active in the Frostwinds, although it can rarely be found during other weather conditions. Interaction with Jin Dahaad in the Cliffs is limited, as it will lean over a cliffside and launch attacks at hunters and other monsters, leaving if hunters damage it enough. If Jin Dahaad is repelled like this and the player is eligible for the quest, they can pursue Jin Dahaad to the Rimechain Peak to begin a quest. Jin Dahaad can also appear at the Rimechain Peak itself, upon which players can directly start an Investigation for it from the menu.
Jin Dahaad.characteristics:
Hunters Notes: A leviathan that sits at the peak of the Iceshard Cliffs' ecosystem. It surrounds its massive form in cold temperatures via ridge-like cooling organs across its body; the frost its limbs produce doubles as a potent weapon and a way to travel along walls and floating rocks.
Helpful Hints: Every part of Jin Dahaad's massive body is capable of powerful freezing attacks. Diminish their offensive capabilities by attacking the ridges that they use for cooling. The largest ridges on their back are particularly powerful and should be destroyed, but the hide there is very tough unless the other ridges are dealt with first.Jin Dahaad is a gargantuan serpentine monster covered in a gnarled grey hide, with articulated ridges resembling copper or bronze covering the majority of its body, the largest of which can freely fold in and out. A large crest of these ridges adorns its head, which is fairly flat in shape and has a tripartite jaw structure that folds outwards when the monster opens its mouth. It has a set of massive ridges protruding from its back, as well as a protruding ribbed chest structure terminating in several bony spikes. Each of its claws has smaller ridges and a spike in the palm position that Jin Dahaad uses to dig into terrain and anchor itself. Its tail is long and slender, with more metallic ridges at their base and tip, along with flat spines running along its length and a rake-like structure at the tip. Although mostly concealed by the ridges on its head, Jin Dahaad has beady black eyes, each surrounded by several more structures that resemble additional eyes but are currently unknown in nature.
The large coppery ridges on Jin Dahaad's body, known as Iceplates, are layered structures made of a metallic material with an extreme ability to absorb and retain heat,[2] to the point that they continue to chill the surroundings when separated from the monster.[3] The Iceplates serve as heat sinks for the monster; by absorbing heat and channeling it to the ridges, which retain it and vent it into the surrounding air, Jin Dahaad can dramatically lower the temperature of its body and the immediate surroundings. The amount of heat shunted to the Iceplates causes them to glow incandescently when the monster is cooling itself, with the ridges constantly emitting steam even when not active; in spite of this, the Iceplates are never seen melting or deforming, although the largest ones are visibly tinted teal, presumably from heat-induced oxidation.
By using its cooling abilities, Jin Dahaad produces and expels massive amounts of supercooled air and frost from its mouth and various vents along its body (notably its chest, lower body, tail, and claws), allowing it to nearly instantly freeze its surroundings. In addition to its serpentine body allowing it to coil around terrain or structures, it also utilizes its cooling abilities to freeze its limbs to surfaces on contact, acting as a form of adhesion that helps it freely climb on uneven terrain and walls despite its enormous size and weight.[4]
The metallic nature of Jin Dahaad's scales prevent them from freezing despite the cold of its environment and abilities,[5] while its carapace is as tough as steel yet doesn't impede its movement at all.[6] Its claws are so cold that they are said to immediately freeze anything they touch.[7]
Jin Dahaad.behavior:
Jin Dahaad is highly territorial and does not take kindly to intruders in its turf, pursuing them relentlessly once they enter. Once angered, it is tenacious to the point that even severe injury is not enough to deter it from hunting down the offenders. When engaging a target in combat, Jin Dahaad violently rattles the cooling ridges on its head and back in a gesture akin to intimidation.
Jin Dahaad appears to descend to the Iceshard Cliffs to hunt only during the Frostwinds, the Inclemency period of the Iceshard Cliffs.
Jin Dahaad.useful_information: Every part of Jin Dahaad's massive body is capable of powerful freezing attacks. Diminish their offensive capabilities by attacking the ridges that they use for cooling. The largest ridges on their back are particularly powerful and should be destroyed, but the hide there is very tough unless the other ridges are dealt with first.

Abyssal Lagiacrus.characteristics:
Threat: ★★★★★★Abyssal Lagiacrus are technically not a separate species from the regular Lagiacrus. Instead, these are elderly Lagiacrus that have grown too large and heavy to venture onto land. As a result, these old individuals moved into the sea permanently, their bodies changing and adapting to dark depths over untold years of fully aquatic life.[2]
These changes manifest most prominently in the leviathan's coloration - Abyssal Lagiacrus are jet-black, blending into the dark sea. Despite their dark surface however, the scales of Abyssal Lagiacrus have been noted to give off an eerie, unearthly glow.[3] Its dark body is illuminated by a constant stream of electricity that flows across the monster's body. Like with the regular species, this charge seems to be concentrated on the Abyssal Lagiacrus' Deathly Shockers on its back. These organs are more powerful than their counterparts on the regular species, and are said to be able to electrify entire seas.[4] The origin of this perpetual electric charge is however believed to be a separate organ, called a Dynamo, which is only found in the bodies of Abyssal Lagiacrus. How exactly it functions is unknown, but it appears to supply the leviathan with nearly endless electric energy.[5]
Abyssal Lagiacrus.behavior: Abyssal Lagiacrus are extremely elusive and rare, to the point where their existence was long only known about through ancient texts. It has often been called the "Lord of the Underworld" throughout history, due to its mysterious nature and seeming dominion of the deepest depths. [6] They are only found in the Underwater Ruins near Moga Village and appear to be quite aggressive, attacking Hunters on sight.

Mizutsune.hunter_notes:
Specially evolved leviathans with sleek, lithe bodies, Mizutsune can secrete a peculiar foam that covers their foes in immobilizing bubbles. Once their prey's movement is impaired, they'll close in with spry, dance-like movements.
Helpful Hints: The foam of a Mizutsune allows it to move with incredible agility even on land, but that's not all. Different kinds of foam produce unique effects, such as inflicting bubbleblight, healing hunters, or boosting your attacks. They can even employ an explosive foam when angered. If you are inflicted with bubbleblight, you'll be left open for longer after taking an attack, so fix yourself up quickly with a cleanser.Mizutsune attacks by sliding across the ground using his bubblefoam, often attacking with his brush-like tail in the process. Hitting a Mizutsune while he is sliding around will topple him. Additionally, Mizutsune are capable of shooting both jets of water and bubbles, with some of his attacks also sending off bubbles. Small bubbles inflict Minor Bubbleblight, large bubbles inflict Major Bubbleblight. In addition, he will sometimes produce green and red bubbles, which heal you and boost attack respectively.
After Mizutsune's head has been broken twice and the monster enters his enraged state, he will form a blue fiery glow in one of its eyes, similar to Soulseer Mizutsune. In this state, he can spit fire-element bubbles and perform attacks similar to Soulseer.
Mizutsune.sightings: Mizutsune is found primarily in the Scarlet Forest, with Tempered individuals also being found in the Ruins of Wyveria.
Mizutsune.characteristics:
Hunters Notes: Specially evolved leviathans with sleek, lithe bodies, Mizutsune can secrete a peculiar foam that covers their foes in immobilizing bubbles. Once their prey's movement is impaired, they'll close in with spry, dance-like movements.
Helpful Hints: The foam of a Mizutsune allows it to move with incredible agility even on land, but that's not all. Different kinds of foam produce unique effects, such as inflicting bubbleblight, healing hunters, or boosting your attacks. They can even employ an explosive foam when angered. If you are inflicted with bubbleblight, you'll be left open for longer after taking an attack, so fix yourself up quickly with a cleanser.Mizutsune are large quadruped leviathans known for their fox-like appearance and strange bubble based abilities. They have four large pink fins and two smaller ones decorating their whiskered faces, purple fur coating the bottom of their body and tail, and rows of pink dorsal fins on their back. The large fins on its head can change color as a result of the large number of blood vessels within, such as turning red when the monster is enraged or blue when it is fatigued.
Mizutsune scales are partially transparent, and their uneven shape refracts light in various different colors.[3] Over the leviathan's life, the scales fall off and are replaces by newly formed ones. Mizutsune scales that remain on their bodies for a long time become polished and smooth by the monster's body fluids and increase in value proportionally.[4] It is said that only a single scale on an individual Mizutsune's body remains for its entire life, and that such a scale is so polished that the light it reflects creates rainbows in the sky.[1]
The most distinctive physiological feature of Mizutsune is their unique synovial fluid, which is produced in specialized glands all over the body. By mixing these fluids with water in their surroundings and moisture stuck to their bodies, Mizutsune create a foamy, soapy substance that they can use for various purposes. They can cover their bodies in a thin layer of it, giving the leviathans body a slippery surface that enhances its agility and allows it to glide elegantly across all kinds of terrain. The foam mixture also causes Mizutsune to be surrounded by various large bubbles at most times, which form naturally as the substance is mixed and dispersed by the monster's fur. These bubbles can incapacitate foes by popping near them and covering them in soap, causing them to slip and fall uncontrollably. The bubbles also serve as sensory enhancers - the many whiskers of Mizutsune are attuned to sense and hear the movements and poppings of the bubbles, expanding the range of their hearing and allowing them to enforce large territories.[1] Mizutsune can also store water within their bodies and spray pressurized streams or blasts of it from their mouths.
The large-finned individuals commonly sighted by the Guild have been discovered to be male Mizutsune, while females of the species are noted to have smaller fins.[1]
Mizutsune.behavior:
These leviathans are quite voracious, and have been noted to eat copious amounts of fish by swallowing them whole. Due to this voraciousness, Mizutsune ingest not just fish, but all other things their prey fish might themselves have eaten. This leads to an incredibly varied diet by proxy, and is theorized to be linked to the production of the leviathan's unique synovial fluid.[1]
Mizutsune are known to engage in territorial disputes, especially with Zinogre, as the species share many habitats.[1] They usually have a calm disposition, but males of the species are known to become highly aggressive during the mating season.[5]
Mizutsune.useful_information: The foam of a Mizutsune allows it to move with incredible agility even on land, but that's not all. Different kinds of foam produce unique effects, such as inflicting bubbleblight, healing hunters, or boosting your attacks. They can even employ an explosive foam when angered. If you are inflicted with bubbleblight, you'll be left open for longer after taking an attack, so fix yourself up quickly with a cleanser.

Violet Mizutsune.hunter_notes:
The key to subduing Violet Mizutsune is to avoid their bubble barrage, but beware; once they're enveloped in flame, their attacks become much more powerful. Look for openings to attack and if you continually attack parts covered in flame, you'll topple the monster, providing a chance for a counter-offensive. Avoid wearing armor with low fire resistance.Violet, much like Mizutsune, attack primarily by sliding around on their belly, with some of their attacks leaving behind oil pools that lower elemental resistance before igniting. They can also fire off jets of oil and produce bubbles, however unlike Mizutsune, these bubbles will ignite before traveling towards the hunter.
After taking enough damage, Violet’s enrage mode is enhanced, causing their head and tail to catch on fire. In this state, they are capable of performing physical attacks enhanced with fire. After enough time has passed, Violet will create a massive bubble which they will knock into the air above them. Eventually, Violet will suck the towards them before dropping the bubble on top of them, dealing massive damage and exiting their enrage. Dealing enough damage to either their head or tail will knock them out of their enrage and topple them. Knocking them out of their enrage while their large bubble is in the air, however, will instead cause the bubble to fall onto them for massive damage, toppling them afterwards.
Violet Mizutsune.sightings: Violet Mizutsune is fought in the Forlorn Arena and Infernal Springs.
Violet Mizutsune.characteristics: Violet Mizutsune are leviathans known for their beautiful lilac-colored fur. They use the fluid they secrete to slide around, targeting their prey with gas-filled bubbles. Though they appear graceful creatures, the facade quickly fades as they envelop themselves in pale flames and bathe their surroundings in a beautiful, but deadly, inferno of white-hot flame.The key to subduing Violet Mizutsune is to avoid their bubble barrage, but beware; once they're enveloped in flame, their attacks become much more powerful. Look for openings to attack and if you continually attack parts covered in flame, you'll topple the monster, providing a chance for a counter-offensive. Avoid wearing armor with low fire resistance.

Apex Mizutsune.hunter_notes: An angry Apex Mizutsune will trigger a devastating move, wreaking havoc to its surroundings by shooting out explosive bubbles. These can be dealt with by using kunai, ranged weapon shots, or ballistae. Push on against an enraged Apex to quickly rid it of its rage and steady its temper.
Apex Mizutsune.characteristics: A Mizutsune so mighty, it was crowned an Apex. Its body is covered in scars and wounds as if it had been caught in a storm, and it's seemingly always dominated by wrath and terror. Its bubbles and huge tail have no trouble sending foes packing. The call of an Apex unleashes its tortured anger on nearby beasts, driving them into a frenzy.An angry Apex Mizutsune will trigger a devastating move, wreaking havoc to its surroundings by shooting out explosive bubbles. These can be dealt with by using kunai, ranged weapon shots, or ballistae. Push on against an enraged Apex to quickly rid it of its rage and steady its temper.

Royal Ludroth.hunter_notes:
Characteristics: Larger than regular Ludroth, Royal Ludroth use their sponge-like mane to absorb water and keep from drying out on land. Once the sponge loses moisture, they will seek out water to recover. They also spew mucus to trip their prey. The Royal Ludroth's attacks are empowered when in proximity of water, and can inflict foes with water-blight. Combat this by stocking up on Nulberries and drawing the creature away from aquatic areas. 
Threat Level: ★★★Royal Ludroth’s most common form of attack is rolling, either to one side or forward. He also frequently uses his sponge-like mane to attack, creating splashes of water around him if these attacks are performed while standing on water. Royal Ludroth are also capable of firing off balls of water, which either linger in place on land or travel forward as waves while on water.
Royal Ludroth.sightings: Royal Ludroth is found in the Flooded Forest, Lava Caverns and Jungle.
Royal Ludroth.characteristics:
Larger than regular Ludroth, Royal Ludroth use their sponge-like mane to absorb water and keep from drying out on land. Once the sponge loses moisture, they will seek out water to recover. They also spew mucus to trip their prey.Characteristics: Larger than regular Ludroth, Royal Ludroth use their sponge-like mane to absorb water and keep from drying out on land. Once the sponge loses moisture, they will seek out water to recover. They also spew mucus to trip their prey. The Royal Ludroth's attacks are empowered when in proximity of water, and can inflict foes with water-blight. Combat this by stocking up on Nulberries and drawing the creature away from aquatic areas. 
Threat Level: ★★★

Somnacanth.hunter_notes:
While in the water, it can move about as it pleases, but it doesn't fare so well on land, so draw it out to shore for an easy hunt. If you're caught in a cloud of its sleep powder, it's lights out; use a wirebug to leap away from it and position for a counterattack.Uniquely for a leviathan, Somnacanth primarily attack while standing on their tail, mainly preferring to leap towards their target. Somnacanth also capable of expelling a cyan mist from their mouth that puts their target to sleep. While enraged, Somnacanth are capable of emitting this mist in a ring around them, requiring the usage of Wirebugs to evade it. Alternatively, throwing a Sonic Bomb at them while they are preparing this move will interrupt the attack.
While standing on water, Somnacanth are capable of swimming on their back before picking up various oyster which they will crack on their belly. These oysters can generate blinding flashes, explosions or even be used to heal themself.
Somnacanth.sightings: Somnacanth is found in the Frost Islands, Flooded Forest  and Lava Caverns.
Somnacanth.characteristics: A formidable aquatic serpent that crests on moonlit nights-likely why it has often been mistaken for a mermaid. It expels an intoxicating sleep powder from its neck gills and tail, knocking out prey before it can resist. Some Somnacanth sightings tell of this species making use of unusual shells, so exercise caution if you catch one swimming towards you with a shell in its claws.While in the water, it can move about as it pleases, but it doesn't fare so well on land, so draw it out to shore for an easy hunt. If you're caught in a cloud of its sleep powder, it's lights out; use a wirebug to leap away from it and position for a counterattack.

Aurora Somnacanth.hunter_notes: This subspecies slides and circles around more often than the normal Somnacanth. Keep focused on their position when they have all four legs on the ground. The ice breath is very powerful, causing near-fatal freezing. You can escape up in the air, but focus on circling behind and keeping your distance.Compared to Somnacanth, Aurora fights more commonly on all fours compared to standing on their tail, primarily attacking by sliding around on their belly. Instead of sleep, Aurora utilises ice, which can be fired off as beams from their mouth or generated as icy blasts around their leaps. While enraged, Aurora is capable of performing a special attack where they slide around the ground in a circle before stopping in place and generating several ice explosions in front of them. Throwing a Sonic Bomb at them while they are singing in place will interrupt this attack.
Aurora Somnacanth.sightings: Aurora Somnacanth is found in the Frost Islands and the Citadel.
Aurora Somnacanth.characteristics: Light illuminates the dust scattered around this subspecies, making their fantastical appearance shimmer softly. Aurora Somnacanth sprays its icy blasts in place of sleeping poweder, attacking all who dare enter their territory. They use the permanent cold emanating from their bodies to freeze the vicinity, and then the frozen surface to move around swiftly.This subspecies slides and circles around more often than the normal Somnacanth. Keep focused on their position when they have all four legs on the ground. The ice breath is very powerful, causing near-fatal freezing. You can escape up in the air, but focus on circling behind and keeping your distance.

Uth Duna.hunter_notes:
The leviathan that reigns supreme over the Scarlet Forest's ecosystem. It has adapted to water-rich environments and is sighted most often during the Downpour. Uth Duna's secretions when combined with water form a protective veil that not only absorbs hostile blows but also adds weight, which it slams down with enough force to sweep away surrounding threats in the resulting wave.
Helpful Hints: Seeing as an Uth Duna's veil reduces attack damage, the first order of business is to dispel it quickly. It will fall away once it loses enough water, but that's not entirely good news; without the veil weighing the monster down, an Uth Duna will become more agile and aggressive. You can dodge their wave with some creative evading, or by using things like Wedge Beetles to escape upward.Uth Duna primarily uses slow, powerful physical attacks with its claws and belly. With their water veil up, and while submerged in deep waters, these attacks are augmented by waves that push the hunter away from Uth Duna, with the more powerful waves also being capable of dealing damage.
Uth Duna begins to fight covered in a veil of water. These veils are considered separate from the monster itself, and do not damage Uth Duna when attacked. However, dealing enough damage can break them individually, weakening Uth Duna's defenses. Destroying enough of them will dispel the rest and briefly knock the monster over, but without them weighing it down, its speed and aggression will increase significantly. Uth Duna will restore its veils after enough time has passed without them, damaging and pushing back Hunters caught in the resulting explosion.
While within its lair in Area 17, Uth Duna will be able to swim in the deep waters of the reservoir, performing acrobatic leaps that create particularly powerful waves. Several Wedge Beetles present at the edge of the reservoir allow Hunters to avoid them, and a pair of Loch Ruins in the water can be torn down onto the Uth Duna when it swims past using the Slinger's claw, damaging the Monster considerably and forcing it back into the shallows, where it will be momentarily toppled. Another ruin situated over the deeper portion of the river in Area 13 can be collapsed on top of Uth Duna when it travels between Areas 15 and 12, with the same effect.
After performing their leaping belly flop, Uth Duna's mouth will become a weak point for Focus Strikes.
Uth Duna.sightings: Uth Duna is only found in the Scarlet Forest, appearing most often during the Downpour, although it can rarely be found during other weather conditions.
Uth Duna.characteristics:
Hunters Notes: The leviathan that reigns supreme over the Scarlet Forest's ecosystem. It has adapted to water-rich environments and is sighted most often during the Downpour. Uth Duna's secretions when combined with water form a protective veil that not only absorbs hostile blows but also adds weight, which it slams down with enough force to sweep away surrounding threats in the resulting wave.
Helpful Hints: Seeing as an Uth Duna's veil reduces attack damage, the first order of business is to dispel it quickly. It will fall away once it loses enough water, but that's not entirely good news; without the veil weighing the monster down, an Uth Duna will become more agile and aggressive. You can dodge their wave with some creative evading, or by using things like Wedge Beetles to escape upward.Similar to the Nibelsnarf and Gobul, the Uth Duna is robust and stout in build, rather than slender and elongated as is typical for a Leviathan. The torso is broad and long, and undulates when swimming, appearing to be its primary means of propulsion, whereas the horizontally triangular tail is proportionally short and thick, with almost an third of the Leviathan's impressive length being owed to the long cilia growing from its tail and the tentacles on its shoulders, which extend long over the tail when not suporting its water veil.
The skull is flat and V-shaped, and uniquely among Leviathans, the jaws are able to protrude from the mouth. Unlike the skull, they are U-Shaped, and the mandible is longer than the maxilla, ending in a long, pointed chin.  Like the Nibelsnarf and Hirabami, Uth Duna possess gill-like structures situated at the sides of its head, which are covered by a developed gill-flap. The eye is lidless and covered in a milky white membrane, and like in most Monsters, shines in the dark, suggesting the presence of a tapetum lucidum for enhanced night vision.
Most of the body is covered in a pattern of red and blue cycloid scales, which is separated from the light grey-brown belly by a thick band of black scales. The hindlimbs and skull are black in colouration as well, with yellow stripes decorating the gill-flaps and area around the Monster's eye. The scales are cycloid in shape, and thinly grooved to enhance water retention.[2]
Pairs of long, fleshy tentacles lined with long strands of wiry light-blue cilia protrude from the Uth Duna's skull, shoulders, and forehand, which support a veil of gelatinous fluid composed of water and a substance produced in its body.[3] The ones situated at the shoulder are almost longer than the body itself, and support a pair of veils that run across the sides of the back to the hip. The second longest pair are the ones growing from the skull, where the veils run across the length of the neck to above the shoulders. The tentacles on the forehand are the shortest, and the veil runs along the length of the arm, along the side of the belly, and to the hindleg.
The forehands possess four broad, developed fingers, with the fifth digits appearing to form the base of the tentacles, while the hindfeet are long, with five short, thick toes. The claws on the fingers are tough and curved, allowing the Leviathan to anchor itself amidst strong water currents and climb up waterfalls.[4]
The cilia grow from the Uth Duna's body in different lengths and arrangements. The longest are found on the tentacles and tail, are ordered into thin rows, and support the length and width of the water veil, ending at the depressions between the teardrop shapes on its rim. Shorter, curly cilia grow in thick bands on the tail tip, forearms, sides of the belly, and portions of the tentacles, forming a woven mesh to which the water veil anchors.[5]
The gelatinous fluid forming the veil is tough and heavy, which protects the Uth Duna's body and increases its mass and surface area. When it becomes destroyed, the tentacles growing from the skull and shoulders are folded up against its body and the cilia bound into a long, false tail, mitigating the risk of them being damaged.[5] The tentacles on the forehands are not retracted, and the attaching cilia form a tangled mesh vaguely resembling wing membranes. Due to their length, the shoulder tentacles extend a short distance over the tail when folded.
Uth Duna.behavior:
Uth Duna primarily appears during the Downpour, emerging from the deep waters of the loch to patrol the forest growing beneath.
It will attack other Large Monsters and packs of Piragills upon finding them within its territory, but exhibits no aggression towards Gajios. Uth Duna feeds on large predatory fish such as Gajau or Great Trevally, which are ambushed from below and eaten underwater. Due to the high speeds achieved in the attack, the Leviathan will breach from the water, launching its victim into the air before catching it in its protruding jaws.
Uth Duna.useful_information: Seeing as an Uth Duna's veil reduces attack damage, the first order of business is to dispel it quickly. It will fall away once it loses enough water, but that's not entirely good news; without the veil weighing the monster down, an Uth Duna will become more agile and aggressive. You can dodge their wave with some creative evading, or by using things like Wedge Beetles to escape upward.

Beotodus.hunter_notes:
Beotodus begins to fight partially buried into the snow, attacking primarily by swiping with their horn and by kicking up snow around them. They can also burrow deeper into the snow, often followed by them lunging towards their target. Throwing a Screamer Pod at them while they are buried will startle them, forcing them onto land and toppling them. Beotodus can also be forced onto land by hitting them enough.
Beotodus also begins the fight covered in snow, protecting themself from damage. Snow can be destroyed with enough damage or by firing Torch Pods at it. Upon re-burying themself, Beotodus will try and re-coat themself in snow, however they are unable to coat any part of their body which has been broken.
Beotodus.sightings: Beotodus is found exclusively in the Hoarfrost Reach.
Beotodus.characteristics: This piscine monster’s wedge-shaped head allows it to freely swim through the tundra snow. Frequently seen flinging snow at prey.
Beotodus.useful_information: Useful Information: Stripping the snow packed on its body will force the monster out in the open. Firing screamer pods can provide an opening to attack: focus on its leg fins to weaken it.

Jyuratodus.hunter_notes:
A Jyuratodus's mud-caked carapace is tough, so use water-elemental weapons to dissolve the mud and get to its squishy core. Stepping in its mud slows you down, so pay attention to your footing.Jyuratodus begins the fight submerged in water, attacking primarily by biting and spewing out balls of mud, leaving behind mud piles that hinder movement. They can also dive deeper underwater before emerging underneath the hunter. While underwater, hitting them with a Sonic Bomb will startle them, forcing them onto land and toppling them. Jyuratodus can also be forced onto land by hitting them enough and will automatically transition onto land if lured out of the water. Jyuratodus may also come onto land after performing their underwater dive.
Jyuratodus also begins the fight covered in mud armour, protecting themself from damage. In Master Rank, armoured parts are also capable of sending off mud balls. Mud armour can be destroyed with enough damage. Upon re-entering the water, Jyuratodus will try and re-coat themself in mud, however they are unable to coat any part of their body which has been broken.
Jyuratodus.sightings: Jyuratodus is found exclusively in the Flooded Forest.
Jyuratodus.characteristics: A piscine wyvern that inhabits swamps, utilizing the mud there to hunt and survive. It wallows in the mire to maximize cutaneous respiration and preserve the toughness of its scales. The sludge it spits is highly viscous, so watch where you step, lest you get stuck in it.A Jyuratodus's mud-caked carapace is tough, so use water-elemental weapons to dissolve the mud and get to its squishy core. Stepping in its mud slows you down, so pay attention to your footing.

Lavasioth.hunter_notes:
Lavasioth primarily attack by "swimming" along the ground, leaving behind pools of lava in their wake, as well as spewing balls of lava. They are also capable of burrowing into the ground to attack, though their sensitive hearing means throwing a Screamer Pod will cause them to resurface, toppling them. They are also capable of submerging themself in lava and swimming in it.
Lavasioth's body is coated in a layer of lava which will eventually cool, causing most weapons to bounce. This armour can be heated again by hitting it with Torch Pods, or by waiting for the monster to either burrow underground or swim into lava. Breaking Lavasioth's parts will cause those parts to no longer be armoured.
In their nest in Area 10, Lavasioth is capable of leaping between the holes in the ground, scattering lava around them with each leap.
Lavasioth.sightings: Lavasioth is found primarily in the Elder's Recess. They can also be found in the Volcanic region of the Guiding Lands.
Lavasioth.characteristics: Lavasioths utilize molten as armor. They are extremely aggressive and will attack without prejudice until the threat has been eliminated.
Lavasioth.useful_information: Useful Information: The hardened magma on Lavasioth's body becomes softer as it swims through lava. Attack its armor immediately after it surfaces to increase your chances of destroying it before it rehardens.

Leshen.characteristics: Dwelling deep inside the forest, these creatures use their innate magic to control all flora and fauna within their territory.
Leshen.useful_information: Useful Information: Revoltures and Jagras controlled by a leshen are tough to approach, but the Igni Sign is very useful in fending off the leshen's lashing roots.

Ancient Leshen.characteristics: An old Leshen that arrived through a portal to assume control over the Ancient Forest. Sometimes revered as an indigenous deity.
Ancient Leshen.useful_information: Useful Information: Ancient leshens use their wisdom and tactical knowledge to curse hunters and send packs of wild Jagras after them.

Najarala.characteristics:
Threat: ★★★★Najarala, along with its subspecies Tidal Najarala, are the only large species of the Snake Wyvern order. The elongated body of the Najarala is adorned with a thick carapace of green shells. The hide beneath the hardened carapace is surprisingly smooth and flexible.[3] It has four relatively short legs, its forelimbs slightly longer than its hind legs. The skull of the Najarala is stout, adorned with large fangs and a curved beak. The monster's tail tapers into a fan-like shape at the tip, from which it can shoot resonating scales.
The shells on its neck protrude outwards and form a sail-like shape that, when rubbed together, vibrate the surrounding air and produce powerful soundwaves.[1] The strength of the soundwaves produced by the vibrations of the monster's scales is amplified by the unique acoustic properties of the protruding shells on its neck, called sounders.[4] Najarala can also shoot resonating scales at enemies from its tail, which burst due to the sympathetic vibration caused by the monster's roars or the rattling of its shells.[1][5]
The Najarala's beak boasts two enlarged fangs, along with a row of smaller, needle-like teeth. The fangs contain a powerful, highly-concentrated neurotoxin that induces paralysis.[6] These toxins are also found in the monster's bone marrow, which can also cause paralysis if handled improperly.[7]
Despite its extremely large size, the Najarala is quite agile and bendy thanks to the flexible skin hidden underneath its thick plating[3] and its surprisingly adept limbs. The plates on the monster's body come in various sizes to ensure that it can slither around with ease.[8] Najarala's short legs come with surprising strength, able to support the monster's weight while it is standing upright.
There have been sightings of Najarala with colour variations reported to the Hunter's Guild. It has been theorized that Najarala that live in certain habitats have varying colours due to dietary differences, however, the existence of these colour variations is unconfirmed.[1]
Najarala.behavior:
The Najarala is an ambush predator. It attacks unsuspecting prey by burrowing underground and ambushing them from beneath their feet, or by launching resonating scales to catch prey unawares. Once its prey is stunned, the Najarala wraps its serpentine body around them and constricts them to death.[5] Najarala prey on small monsters such as Slagtoth.
These Snake Wyverns appear to be quite intelligent and will target stunned enemies.[9]

Lala Barina.hunter_notes:
Temnocerans native to the Scarlet Forest with distinctive, pirouette-like movements. Their fluids contain a neuroplegic agent which they mix with water to produce red, petal-like bristles on their abdomens. When agitated, Lala Barina open these bristles like a deadly, blossoming flower and release them as florets that paralyze whatever they come into contact with.
Helpful Hints: The paralytic effects of a single Lala Barina floret are weak and not enough to subdue a hunter, but repeated contact should be avoided. The stinger on their abdomens makes approaching from the rear a risky bet, but when tired, the stinger will stay exposed and vulnerable. There are reports that when in terrain such as their nests where they hang from above, sustained attacks will knock them down.Lala Barina attack with their claws, legs and the paralytic stinger normally kept hidden in their abdomen. Lala Barina are also capable of extending the rose-like bristles on their abdomen, releasing several florets around them. If enough of these florets make contact with a hunter, they will be left paralysed. When a Lala Barina is enraged, these bristles will open permenantly, causing them to release more florets as they reposition.
While in their nest in Area 4, Lala Barina are capable of hanging from the ceiling from a thread of string, allowing them to release even more florets around them.
After attacking with their stinger, it is left open as a weak point for Focus Strikes.
Lala Barina.sightings: Lala Barina is found primarily in the Scarlet Forest, with Tempered individuals also being found in the Ruins of Wyveria.

Nerscylla.hunter_notes:
Temnocerans that inhabit the Iceshard Cliffs. They weave vast, sticky webs across their territory, using them and various status ailments to corner prey before utilizing pincer-like jaws to finish it off. Sometimes dead Gypceros can be found in the webs, the hide of which Nerscylla are known to adorn themselves with after devouring the rest of the carcass.
Helpful Hints: To defend against the poison, sleep and binding effects of a Nerscylla's webbing, a hunter must go in duly prepared. While its powerful pincers are quite dangerous, they can and should be targeted as a weakness, provided they are approached correctly. The Gypceros hides draped on a Nerscylla's back are resistant to thunder but susceptible to fire - qualities that are reversed once the hide is destroyed.Nerscylla attack with their sharp claws and a myriad of different statuses. Their large retractable mandibles and back spikes are capable of poisoning, their stinger put the hunter to sleep and they can fire web shots from their abdomen that trap their target in place. Their back spikes can be broken twice to prevent them from poisoning.
Nerscylla wears the skin of a Gypceros as armour, giving it immunity to the Thunder element. This hide is, in turn, very weak to the Fire element. However, once the hide is broken, their exposed body is weak to the Thunder element and much more resistant to Fire.
While in their nest in Area 4, Nerscylla are capable of both clinging to the webbing from the ceiling, as well as digging beneath the webbing on the floor to ambush their target from beneath.
After attacking with their poisonous mandibles, they are left exposed as a weak point for Focus Strikes.
Nerscylla.sightings: Nerscylla is found in both the Oilwell Basin and the Iceshard Cliffs, with Tempered individuals also being found in the Ruins of Wyveria.
Nerscylla.characteristics:
Hunters Notes: Temnocerans that inhabit the Iceshard Cliffs. They weave vast, sticky webs across their territory, using them and various status ailments to corner prey before utilizing pincer-like jaws to finish it off. Shrouded Nerscylla.characteristics:
Threat: ★★★★Shrouded Nerscylla closely resemble common Nerscylla. They are large, six-eyed Temnoceran with six legs, four of which are used for walking while the anterior two limbs are modified into hooked pedipalps. Like the common species, Shrouded Nerscylla also possess massive extendable chelicerae doused in venom.
A distinguishing feature of this subspecies is its coloration - its shell is black with purple nodes around the joints, and blue accents on the underside.[2] Just as with the regular species, the true shell of a Shrouded Nerscylla is often hidden by the skin of other monsters, which the Temnoceran wears as a cloak. While common Nerscylla generally use the hides of Gypceros for this to benefit from their thunder resistant skin, Shrouded Nerscylla are generally seen wearing the skin of a Khezu.[2] The purpose of this is believed to be related to moisture retention, as the wet hide of Khezu can protect the Shrouded Nerscylla from drying out in the desert while also reflecting sunlight due to its color.[5] It has been suggested that Shrouded Nerscylla may wear other monster skins too depending on regional variations.[2]
While Shrouded Nerscylla display the same venomous bite of the common species, the large crystal spikes on their backs are quite different, being a sickly yellow instead of purple. These spikes are also made up of crystalized venom, but in the Shrouded Nerscylla's case, this is a special paralytic compound unique to this subspecies. These spikes can easily paralyze foes, as the venom they consist of is highly concentrated.[6]
Shrouded Nerscylla.behavior:
Shrouded Nerscylla mostly inhabit the Dunes and are generally considered desert-dwellers. Their hunting strategy differs quite drastically from the common species: Shrouded Nerscylla do not built trap webs (although they do possess the ability to produce webbing) but instead dig into the sand, lying in wait until suitable prey walks by. When such an opportunity presents itself, they emerge with their chelicerae extended, snapping together violently in an attempt to kill their target in one bite.[7] They can also use their hooked pedipalps to gut and skin prey with ease.[8]
Shrouded Nerscylla are born in desert regions, but cannot reach maturity there, as the monsters they need to skin - namely Khezu - do not live in those climates. In order to grow into a state in which they can survive the desert sun and to find secure sources of food, juvenile Shrouded Nerscylla build small sails from their webbing in order to catch the winds that whip across the arid wastes, letting themselves be carried away into new lands. Their goal is to land in cavernous areas such as the Sunken Hollow, where they can feast on the rotten carcasses left behind by large cave predators. Shrouded Nerscylla that survive long enough to successfully skin a Khezu can then return to the deserts they were born in, reigning over them and eventually laying eggs there themselves, thus starting this cycle anew.[5]

Rakna-Kadaki.hunter_notes:
Characteristics: A Rakna-Kadaki is usually seen covered in sticky webbing. Clinging to its abdomen are its offspring, known as Rachnoid, which it controls using the flammable gas that builds up there. Rachnoid spit fire, capture prey, and support the Rakna-Kadaki's massive body. As their numbers dwindle, the beast will hatch more, at which point it is extremely dangerous. It moves quickly by tethering webs to its offspring, but a strike timed well enough to sever these threads will cause the Rakna-Kadaki to lose its balance and provide you an opening. If, however, you become entangled in its web and roasted by its flames, expect to take a significant amount of damage.
Threat Level: ★★★★★★★Rakna-Kadaki fights utilizing her extendable claws, producing string from her mouth to bind her targets and by firing out blasts of fire, either from her mouth or her sides. If a hunter is hit with a fire attack while Webbed, they will be stunned for a brief amount of time, becoming unable to break out of the webbing.
Rakna-Kadaki starts the fight with 5 Rachnoid on her abdomen. These Rachnoid can be thrown out attached to string, pulling the Rakna-Kadaki behind them. Attacking the string will sever it and topple the Rakna. Rachnoid can also be thrown out to perform attacks: either firing off webbing or a stream of fire when the Rakna is enraged. Damaging the Rachnoids enough will cause them to flee. Rachnoids will also flee if two of Rakna-Kadaki’s legs are broken, which will also cause her remaining legs to break and briefly topple her.
After all her Rachnoids flee, Rakna-Kadaki will proceed to create a brood sac over her abdomen, causing her abdomen to deal more damage and the cost of it receiving more damage. Eventually, Rakna-Kadaki will release a burst of flame around her, destroying her brood sac. The brood sac can also be destroyed with enough damage, toppling her. Either way, when the brood sac is destroyed, Rakna-Kadaki will regain her 5 Rachnoids and reform the string on her legs.
Rakna-Kadaki.sightings: Rakna-Kadaki is found in the Sandy Plains and Lava Caverns.
Rakna-Kadaki.characteristics:
A Rakna-Kadaki is usually seen covered in sticky webbing. Clinging to its abdomen are its offspring, known as Rachnoid, which it controls using the flammable gas that builds up there. If, however, you become entangled in its web and roasted by its flames, expect to take a significant amount of damage.
Threat Level: ★★★★★★★

Pyre Rakna-Kadaki.hunter_notes:
Characteristics: A subspecies of Rakna-Kadaki filled with explosive material, their bodies are covered in a dark red, explosion- resistant webbing. An advanced chain of command lets them direct their offspring with a special sound-producing organ. On offense, they strike their forelimbs like flints to induce explosions. Connecting special detonation threads to offspring in the area lets them expand the explosive area to their positions. Pyre Rakna-Kadaki coordinate with the Pyrantula they scatter around. Ignoring these small fry will strengthen their explosive attacks, so slay any nearby Pyrantula. Attacking the abdomen reduces the number of Pyrantula they can spread around. Continued attacks cause them to lay eggs and stop coordinating with tiny Temonocerans.
Threat Level: ★★★★★★★Much like Rakna-Kadaki, Pyre also fights with her claws and by shooting out both webbing and streams of fire. Instead of Rachnoids, Pyre commands 5 Pyrantula. While they can be used to pull around the monster in a similar fashion, Pyre are also capable of throwing out 3 of them which string attached before sending an explosion to each one.
Certain attacks of hers will also throw off additional Pyrantula that remain in one spot, being able to have up to 4 active at once. While starting off passive, they will turn aggressive when approached, preventing Pyre from interacting with them. Pyre is capable of attaching string to these Pyrantula during her pyrantula explosions, signalled by her calling into the air beforehand. After exploding, Pyrantula will flee.
Similar to Rakna-Kadaki, causing all of Pyre’s Pyrantula to flee, either by breaking 2 of her legs or by attaching them enough, will cause her to form a brood sac on her abdomen. Eventually, Pyre will release a burst of flame around her, destroying her brood sac. The brood sac can also be destroyed with enough damage, toppling her. Either way, when the brood sac is destroyed, Pyre will regain her 5 Pyrantula and reform the string on her legs.
Pyre Rakna-Kadaki.sightings: Pyre Rakna-Kadaki is found in the Lava Caverns  and the Citadel.
Pyre Rakna-Kadaki.characteristics:
A subspecies of Rakna-Kadaki filled with explosive material, their bodies are covered in a dark red, explosion- resistant webbing. An advanced chain of command lets them direct their offspring with a special sound-producing organ. On offense, they strike their forelimbs like flints to induce explosions. Connecting special detonation threads to offspring in the area lets them expand the explosive area to their positions.Characteristics: A subspecies of Rakna-Kadaki filled with explosive material, their bodies are covered in a dark red, explosion- resistant webbing. An advanced chain of command lets them direct their offspring with a special sound-producing organ. On offense, they strike their forelimbs like flints to induce explosions. Connecting special detonation threads to offspring in the area lets them expand the explosive area to their positions. Pyre Rakna-Kadaki coordinate with the Pyrantula they scatter around. Ignoring these small fry will strengthen their explosive attacks, so slay any nearby Pyrantula. Attacking the abdomen reduces the number of Pyrantula they can spread around. Continued attacks cause them to lay eggs and stop coordinating with tiny Temonocerans.
Threat Level: ★★★★★★★

Chaotic Gore Magala.hunter_notes:
Characteristics: Gore Magala that have fallen into chaos, having been denied their evolution into Shagaru Magala. They maintain their original power, while possessing the potential of Shagaru Magala, making them incredibly unstable. Sometimes this leads them to fall into a state of anguish and violence. When attacking their prey, they repeatedly fold and unfurl their wings, as if to show their internal struggle with their own form. Containing the latent powers of Shagaru Magala, their attacks become especially fearsome when they let themselves go, causing explosions across a wide area with their breath attacks. Like regular Gore Magala, they can be knocked out of their enraged state if you continually attack their head.
Threat Level: ★★★★★★★★★★Chaotic utilises the moveset of both Gore and Shagaru. While their wings are folded over their back, they attack using moves from Gore’s standard state, while their wings are on the ground, they attack using the moves from Shagaru.
Eventually, Chaotic will enter their frenzy state, extending their antenna with their wings glowing blue, gaining access to stronger attacks with their wing-arms. Dealing enough damage to them followed by a blow to the head will return them to normal, toppling them. At low health, Chaotic’s Frenzy state is enhanced with them instead glowing pink, causing some attacks with their wing-arms to send off frenzy explosions. They are also capable of shooting a large cloud of frenzy which explodes in front of them, writhing in pain afterwards.
Chaotic Gore Magala.sightings: Chaotic Gore Magala is found in the Shrine Ruins, Flooded Forest, the Citadel and Jungle.
